Verse: அகர	முதல	எழுத்தெல்லாம்	ஆதி			பகவன்	முதற்றே	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :A, as its first of letters, every speech maintains; The "Primal Deity" is first through all the world's domains.
Explanation: Explanation :As all letters have the letter A for their first, so the world has the eternal God for its first.

Verse: கற்றதனால்	ஆய	பயனென்கொல்	வாலறிவன்			நற்றாள்	தொழாஅர்	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :No fruit have men of all their studied lore, Save they the 'Purely Wise One's' feet adore.
Explanation: Explanation :What Profit have those derived from learning, who worship not the good feet of Him who is possessed of pure knowledge ?

Verse: மலர்மிசை	ஏகினான்	மாணடி	சேர்ந்தார்			நிலமிசை	நீடுவாழ்	வார்.
Translation: Translation :His feet, 'Who o'er the full-blown flower hath past,' who gain In bliss long time shall dwell above this earthly plain.
Explanation: Explanation :They who are united to the glorious feet of Him who occupies swiftly the flower of the mind, shall flourish in the highest of worlds (heaven).

Verse: வேண்டுதல்	வேண்டாமை	இலானடி	சேர்ந்தார்க்கு			யாண்டும்	இடும்பை	இல.
Translation: Translation :His foot, 'Whom want affects not, irks not grief,' who gain Shall not, through every time, of any woes complain.
Explanation: Explanation :To those who meditate the feet of Him who is void of desire or aversion, evil shall never come.

Verse: இருள்சேர்	இருவினையும்	சேரா	இறைவன்			பொருள்சேர்	புகழ்புரிந்தார்	மாட்டு.
Translation: Translation :The men, who on the 'King's' true praised delight to dwell, Affects not them the fruit of deeds done ill or well.
Explanation: Explanation :The two-fold deeds that spring from darkness shall not adhere to those who delight in the true praise of God.

Verse: பொறிவாயில்	ஐந்தவித்தான்	பொய்தீர்	ஒழுக்க			நெறிநின்றார்	நீடுவாழ்	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Long live they blest, who 've stood in path from falsehood freed; His, 'Who quenched lusts that from the sense-gates five proceed'.
Explanation: Explanation :Those shall long proposer who abide in the faultless way of Him who has destroyed the five desires of the senses.

Verse: தனக்குவமை	இல்லாதான்	தாள்சேர்ந்தார்க்	கல்லால்			மனக்கவலை	மாற்றல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Unless His foot, 'to Whom none can compare,' men gain, 'Tis hard for mind to find relief from anxious pain.
Explanation: Explanation :Anxiety of mind cannot be removed, except from those who are united to the feet of Him who is incomparable.

Verse: அறவாழி	அந்தணன்	தாள்சேர்ந்தார்க்	கல்லால்			பிறவாழி	நீந்தல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Unless His feet 'the Sea of Good, the Fair and Bountiful,' men gain, 'Tis hard the further bank of being's changeful sea to attain.
Explanation: Explanation :None can swim the sea of vice, but those who are united to the feet of that gracious Being who is a sea of virtue.

Verse: கோளில்	பொறியின்	குணமிலவே	எண்குணத்தான்			தாளை	வணங்காத்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Before His foot, 'the Eight-fold Excellence,' with unbent head, Who stands, like palsied sense, is to all living functions dead.
Explanation: Explanation :The head that worships not the feet of Him who is possessed of eight attributes, is as useless as a sense without the power of sensation.

Verse: பிறவிப்	பெருங்கடல்	நீந்துவர்	நீந்தார்			இறைவன்	அடிசேரா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :They swim the sea of births, the 'Monarch's' foot who gain; None others reach the shore of being's mighty main.
Explanation: Explanation :None can swim the great sea of births but those who are united to the feet of God.

Verse: வான்நின்று	உலகம்	வழங்கி	வருதலால்			தான்அமிழ்தம்	என்றுணரற்	பாற்று.
Translation: Translation :The world its course maintains through life that rain unfailing gives; Thus rain is known the true ambrosial food of all that lives.
Explanation: Explanation :By the continuance of rain the world is preserved in existence; it is therefore worthy to be called ambrosia.

Verse: துப்பார்க்குத்	துப்பாய	துப்பாக்கித்	துப்பார்க்குத்			துப்பாய	தூஉம்	மழை.
Translation: Translation :The rain makes pleasant food for eaters rise; As food itself, thirst-quenching draught supplies.
Explanation: Explanation :Rain produces good food, and is itself food.

Verse: விண்இன்று	பொய்ப்பின்	விரிநீர்	வியனுலகத்து			உள்நின்று	உடற்றும்	பசி.
Translation: Translation :If clouds, that promised rain, deceive, and in the sky remain, Famine, sore torment, stalks o'er earth's vast ocean-girdled plain.
Explanation: Explanation :If the cloud, withholding rain, deceive (our hopes) hunger will long distress the sea-girt spacious world.

Verse: ஏரின்	உழாஅர்	உழவர்	புயல்என்னும்			வாரி	வளங்குன்றிக்	கால்.
Translation: Translation :If clouds their wealth of waters fail on earth to pour, The ploughers plough with oxen's sturdy team no more.
Explanation: Explanation :If the abundance of wealth imparting rain diminish, the labour of the plough must cease.

Verse: கெடுப்பதூஉம்	கெட்டார்க்குச்	சார்வாய்மற்	றாங்கே			எடுப்பதூஉம்	எல்லாம்	மழை.
Translation: Translation :'Tis rain works all: it ruin spreads, then timely aid supplies; As, in the happy days before, it bids the ruined rise.
Explanation: Explanation :Rain by its absence ruins men; and by its existence restores them to fortune.

Verse: விசும்பின்	துளிவீழின்	அல்லால்மற்	றாங்கே			பசும்புல்	தலைகாண்பு	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :If from the clouds no drops of rain are shed. 'Tis rare to see green herb lift up its head.
Explanation: Explanation :If no drop falls from the clouds, not even the green blade of grass will be seen.

Verse: நெடுங்கடலும்	தன்நீர்மை	குன்றும்	தடிந்தெழிலி			தான்நல்கா	தாகி	விடின்.
Translation: Translation :If clouds restrain their gifts and grant no rain, The treasures fail in ocean's wide domain.
Explanation: Explanation :Even the wealth of the wide sea will be diminished, if the cloud that has drawn (its waters) up gives them not back again (in rain).

Verse: சிறப்பொடு	பூசனை	செல்லாது	வானம்			வறக்குமேல்	வானோர்க்கும்	ஈண்டு.
Translation: Translation :If heaven grow dry, with feast and offering never more, Will men on earth the heavenly ones adore.
Explanation: Explanation :If the heaven dry up, neither yearly festivals, nor daily worship will be offered in this world, to the celestials.

Verse: தானம்	தவம்இரண்டும்	தங்கா	வியன்உலகம்			வானம்	வழங்கா	தெனின்.
Translation: Translation :If heaven its watery treasures ceases to dispense, Through the wide world cease gifts, and deeds of 'penitence'.
Explanation: Explanation :If rain fall not, penance and alms-deeds will not dwell within this spacious world.

Verse: நீர்இன்று	அமையாது	உலகெனின்	யார்யார்க்கும்			வான்இன்று	அமையாது	ஒழுக்கு.
Translation: Translation :When water fails, functions of nature cease, you say; Thus when rain fails, no men can walk in 'duty's ordered way'.
Explanation: Explanation :If it be said that the duties of life cannot be discharged by any person without water, so without rain there cannot be the flowing of water.

Verse: ஒழுக்கத்து	நீத்தார்	பெருமை	விழுப்பத்து			வேண்டும்	பனுவல்	துணிவு.
Translation: Translation :The settled rule of every code requires, as highest good, Their greatness who, renouncing all, true to their rule have stood.
Explanation: Explanation :The end and aim of all treatise is to extol beyond all other excellence, the greatness of those who, while abiding in the rule of conduct peculiar to their state, have abandoned all desire.

Verse: துறந்தார்	பெருமை	துணைக்கூறின்	வையத்து			இறந்தாரை	எண்ணிக்கொண்	டற்று.
Translation: Translation :As counting those that from the earth have passed away, 'Tis vain attempt the might of holy men to say.
Explanation: Explanation :To describe the measure of the greatness of those who have forsaken the two-fold desires, is like counting the dead.

Verse: இருமை	வகைதெரிந்து	ஈண்டுஅறம்	பூண்டார்			பெருமை	பிறங்கிற்று	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :Their greatness earth transcends, who, way of both worlds weighed, In this world take their stand, in virtue's robe arrayed.
Explanation: Explanation :The greatness of those who have discovered the properties of both states of being, and renounced the world, shines forth on earth (beyond all others).

Verse: உரனென்னும்	தோட்டியான்	ஓரைந்தும்	காப்பான்			வரனென்னும்	வைப்பிற்கோர்	வித்தது.
Translation: Translation :He, who with firmness, curb the five restrains, Is seed for soil of yonder happy plains.
Explanation: Explanation :He who guides his five senses by the hook of wisdom will be a seed in the world of heaven.

Verse: ஐந்தவித்தான்	ஆற்றல்	அகல்விசும்பு	ளார்கோமான்			இந்திரனே	சாலுங்	கரி.
Translation: Translation :Their might who have destroyed 'the five', shall soothly tell Indra, the lord of those in heaven's wide realms that dwell.
Explanation: Explanation :Indra, the king of the inhabitants of the spacious heaven, is himself, a sufficient proof of the strength of him who has subdued his five senses.

Verse: செயற்கரிய	செய்வார்	பெரியர்	சிறியர்			செயற்கரிய	செய்கலா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :Things hard in the doing will great men do; Things hard in the doing the mean eschew.
Explanation: Explanation :The great will do those things which is difficult to be done; but the mean cannot do them.

Verse: சுவைஒளி	ஊறுஓசை	நாற்றமென	ஐந்தின்			வகைதெரிவான்	கட்டே	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :Taste, light, touch, sound, and smell: who knows the way Of all the five,- the world submissive owns his sway.
Explanation: Explanation :The world is within the knowledge of him who knows the properties of taste, sight, touch, hearing and smell.

Verse: நிறைமொழி	மாந்தர்	பெருமை	நிலத்து			மறைமொழி	காட்டி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :The might of men whose word is never vain, The 'secret word' shall to the earth proclaim.
Explanation: Explanation :The hidden words of the men whose words are full of effect, will shew their greatness to the world.

Verse: குணமென்னும்	குன்றேறி	நின்றார்	வெகுளி			கணமேயும்	காத்தல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :The wrath 'tis hard e'en for an instant to endure, Of those who virtue's hill have scaled, and stand secure.
Explanation: Explanation :The anger of those who have ascended the mountain of goodness, though it continue but for a moment, cannot be resisted.

Verse: அந்தணர்	என்போர்	அறவோர்மற்	றெவ்வுயிர்க்கும்			செந்தண்மை	பூண்டொழுக	லான்.
Translation: Translation :Towards all that breathe, with seemly graciousness adorned they live; And thus to virtue's sons the name of 'Anthanar' men give,
Explanation: Explanation :The virtuous are truly called Anthanar; because in their conduct towards all creatures they are clothed in kindness.

Verse: சிறப்புஈனும்	செல்வமும்	ஈனும்	அறத்தினூஉங்கு			ஆக்கம்	எவனோ	உயிர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :It yields distinction, yields prosperity; what gain Greater than virtue can a living man obtain?
Explanation: Explanation :Virtue will confer heaven and wealth; what greater source of happiness can man possess ?

Verse: அறத்தினூஉங்கு	ஆக்கமும்	இல்லை	அதனை			மறத்தலின்	ஊங்கில்லை	கேடு.
Translation: Translation :No greater gain than virtue aught can cause; No greater loss than life oblivious of her laws.
Explanation: Explanation :There can be no greater source of good than (the practice of) virtue; there can be no greater source of evil than the forgetfulness of it.

Verse: ஒல்லும்	வகையான்	அறவினை	ஓவாதே			செல்லும்வாய்	எல்லாஞ்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :To finish virtue's work with ceaseless effort strive, What way thou may'st, where'er thou see'st the work may thrive.
Explanation: Explanation :As much as possible, in every way, incessantly practise virtue.

Verse: மனத்துக்கண்	மாசிலன்	ஆதல்	அனைத்தறன்			ஆகுல	நீர	பிற.
Translation: Translation :Spotless be thou in mind! This only merits virtue's name; All else, mere pomp of idle sound, no real worth can claim.
Explanation: Explanation :Let him who does virtuous deeds be of spotless mind; to that extent is virtue; all else is vain show.

Verse: அழுக்காறு	அவாவெகுளி	இன்னாச்சொல்	நான்கும்			இழுக்கா	இயன்றது	அறம்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis virtue when, his footsteps sliding not through envy, wrath, Lust, evil speech-these four, man onwards moves in ordered path.
Explanation: Explanation :That conduct is virtue which is free from these four things, viz, malice, desire, anger and bitter speech.

Verse: அன்றறிவாம்	என்னாது	அறஞ்செய்க	மற்றது			பொன்றுங்கால்	பொன்றாத்	துணை.
Translation: Translation :Do deeds of virtue now. Say not, 'To-morrow we'll be wise'; Thus, when thou diest, shalt thou find a help that never dies.
Explanation: Explanation :Defer not virtue to another day; receive her now; and at the dying hour she will be your undying friend.

Verse: அறத்தாறு	இதுவென	வேண்டா	சிவிகை			பொறுத்தானோடு	ஊர்ந்தான்	இடை.
Translation: Translation :Needs not in words to dwell on virtue's fruits: compare The man in litter borne with them that toiling bear!
Explanation: Explanation :The fruit of virtue need not be described in books; it may be inferred from seeing the bearer of a palanquin and the rider therein.

Verse: வீழ்நாள்	படாஅமை	நன்றாற்றின்	அஃதொருவன்			வாழ்நாள்	வழியடைக்கும்	கல்.
Translation: Translation :If no day passing idly, good to do each day you toil, A stone it will be to block the way of future days of moil.
Explanation: Explanation :If one allows no day to pass without some good being done, his conduct will be a stone to block up the passage to other births.

Verse: அறத்தான்	வருவதே	இன்பம்	மற்றெல்லாம்			புறத்த	புகழும்	இல.
Translation: Translation :What from virtue floweth, yieldeth dear delight; All else extern, is void of glory's light.
Explanation: Explanation :Only that pleasure which flows from domestic virtue is pleasure; all else is not pleasure, and it is without praise.

Verse: செயற்பால	தோரும்	அறனே	ஒருவற்கு			உயற்பால	தோரும்	பழி.
Translation: Translation :'Virtue' sums the things that should be done; 'Vice' sums the things that man should shun.
Explanation: Explanation :That is virtue which each ought to do, and that is vice which each should shun.

Verse: இல்வாழ்வான்	என்பான்	இயல்புடைய	மூவர்க்கும்			நல்லாற்றின்	நின்ற	துணை.
Translation: Translation :The men of household virtue, firm in way of good, sustain The other orders three that rule professed maintain.
Explanation: Explanation :He will be called a (true) householder, who is a firm support to the virtuous of the three orders in their good path.

Verse: துறந்தார்க்கும்	துவ்வாதவர்க்கும்	இறந்தார்க்கும்	இல்வாழ்வான்			என்பான்	துணை.
Translation: Translation :To anchorites, to indigent, to those who've passed away, The man for household virtue famed is needful held and stay.
Explanation: Explanation :He will be said to flourish in domestic virtue who aids the forsaken, the poor, and the dead.

Verse: தென்புலத்தார்	தெய்வம்	விருந்தொக்கல்	தானென்றாங்கு			ஐம்புலத்தாறு	ஓம்பல்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :The manes, God, guests kindred, self, in due degree, These five to cherish well is chiefest charity.
Explanation: Explanation :The chief (duty of the householder) is to preserve the five-fold rule (of conduct) towards the manes, the Gods, his guests, his relations and himself.

Verse: பழியஞ்சிப்	பாத்தூண்	உடைத்தாயின்	வாழ்க்கை			வழியெஞ்சல்	எஞ்ஞான்றும்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Who shares his meal with other, while all guilt he shuns, His virtuous line unbroken though the ages runs.
Explanation: Explanation :His descendants shall never fail who, living in the domestic state, fears vice (in the acquisition of property) and shares his food (with others).

Verse: அன்பும்	அறனும்	உடைத்தாயின்	இல்வாழ்க்கை			பண்பும்	பயனும்	அது.
Translation: Translation :If love and virtue in the household reign, This is of life the perfect grace and gain.
Explanation: Explanation :If the married life possess love and virtue, these will be both its duty and reward.

Verse: அறத்தாற்றின்	இல்வாழ்க்கை	ஆற்றின்	புறத்தாற்றில்			போஒய்ப்	பெறுவ	எவன்.
Translation: Translation :If man in active household life a virtuous soul retain, What fruit from other modes of virtue can he gain?
Explanation: Explanation :What will he who lives virtuously in the domestic state gain by going into the other, (ascetic) state ?

Verse: இயல்பினான்	இல்வாழ்க்கை	வாழ்பவன்	என்பான்			முயல்வாருள்	எல்லாம்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :In nature's way who spends his calm domestic days, 'Mid all that strive for virtue's crown hath foremost place.
Explanation: Explanation :Among all those who labour (for future happiness) he is greatest who lives well in the household state.

Verse: ஆற்றின்	ஒழுக்கி	அறனிழுக்கா	இல்வாழ்க்கை			நோற்பாரின்	நோன்மை	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Others it sets upon their way, itself from virtue ne'er declines; Than stern ascetics' pains such life domestic brighter shines.
Explanation: Explanation :The householder who, not swerving from virtue, helps the ascetic in his way, endures more than those who endure penance.

Verse: அறனென்ப்	பட்டதே	இல்வாழ்க்கை	அஃதும்			பிறன்பழிப்ப	தில்லாயின்	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :The life domestic rightly bears true virtue's name; That other too, if blameless found, due praise may claim.
Explanation: Explanation :The marriage state is truly called virtue. The other state is also good, if others do not reproach it.

Verse: வையத்துள்	வாழ்வாங்கு	வாழ்பவன்	வான்உநற்யும்			தெய்வத்துள்	வைக்கப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who shares domestic life, by household virtues graced, Shall, mid the Gods, in heaven who dwell, be placed.
Explanation: Explanation :He who on earth has lived in the conjugal state as he should live, will be placed among the Gods who dwell in heaven.

Verse: மனைக்தக்க	மாண்புடையள்	ஆகித்தற்	கொண்டான்			வளத்தக்காள்	வாழ்க்கைத்	துணை.
Translation: Translation :As doth the house beseem, she shows her wifely dignity; As doth her husband's wealth befit, she spends: help - meet is she.
Explanation: Explanation :She who has the excellence of home virtues, and can expend within the means of her husband, is a help in the domestic state.

Verse: மனைமாட்சி	இல்லாள்கண்	இல்லாயின்	வாழ்க்கை			எனைமாட்சித்	தாயினும்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :If household excellence be wanting in the wife, Howe'er with splendour lived, all worthless is the life.
Explanation: Explanation :If the wife be devoid of domestic excellence, whatever (other) greatness be possessed, the conjugal state, is nothing.

Verse: இல்லதென்	இல்லவள்	மாண்பானால்	உள்ளதென்			இல்லவள்	மாணாக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :There is no lack within the house, where wife in worth excels, There is no luck within the house, where wife dishonoured dwells.
Explanation: Explanation :If his wife be eminent (in virtue), what does (that man) not possess ? If she be without excellence, what does (he) possess ?

Verse: பெண்ணின்	பெருந்தக்க	யாவுள	கற்பென்னும்			திண்மைஉண்	டாகப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :If woman might of chastity retain, What choicer treasure doth the world contain?
Explanation: Explanation :What is more excellent than a wife, if she possess the stability of chastity ?

Verse: தெய்வம்	தொழாஅள்	கொழுநன்	தொழுதெழுவாள்			பெய்யெனப்	பெய்யும்	மழை.
Translation: Translation :No God adoring, low she bends before her lord; Then rising, serves: the rain falls instant at her word!
Explanation: Explanation :If she, who does not worship God, but who rising worships her husband, say, "let it rain," it will rain.

Verse: தற்காத்துத்	தற்கொண்டாற்	பேணித்	தகைசான்ற			சொற்காத்துச்	சோர்விலாள்	பெண்.
Translation: Translation :Who guards herself, for husband's comfort cares, her household's fame, In perfect wise with sleepless soul preserves, -give her a woman's name.
Explanation: Explanation :She is a wife who unweariedly guards herself, takes care of her husband, and preserves an unsullied fame.

Verse: சிறைகாக்கும்	காப்பெவன்	செய்யும்	மகளிர்			நிறைகாக்கும்	காப்பே	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Of what avail is watch and ward? Honour's woman's safest guard.
Explanation: Explanation :What avails the guard of a prison ? The chief guard of a woman is her chastity.

Verse: பெற்றாற்	பெறின்பெறுவர்	பெண்டிர்	பெருஞ்சிறப்புப்			புத்தேளிர்	வாழும்	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :If wife be wholly true to him who gained her as his bride, Great glory gains she in the world where gods bliss abide.
Explanation: Explanation :If women shew reverence to their husbands, they will obtain great excellence in the world where the gods flourish.

Verse: புகழ்புரிந்த	இல்லிலோர்க்கு	இல்லை	இகழ்வார்முன்			ஏறுபோல்	பீடு	நடை.
Translation: Translation :Who have not spouses that in virtue's praise delight, They lion-like can never walk in scorner's sight.
Explanation: Explanation :The man whose wife seeks not the praise (of chastity) cannot walk with lion-like stately step, before those who revile them.

Verse: மங்கலம்	என்ப	மனைமாட்சி	மற்றுஅதன்			நன்கலம்	நன்மக்கட்	பேறு.
Translation: Translation :The house's 'blessing', men pronounce the house-wife excellent; The gain of blessed children is its goodly ornament.
Explanation: Explanation :The excellence of a wife is the good of her husband; and good children are the jewels of that goodness.

Verse: பெறுமவற்றுள்	யாமறிவது	இல்லை	அறிவறிந்த			மக்கட்பேறு	அல்ல	பிற.
Translation: Translation :Of all that men acquire, we know not any greater gain, Than that which by the birth of learned children men obtain.
Explanation: Explanation :Among all the benefits that may be acquired, we know no greater benefit than the acquisition of intelligent children.

Verse: எழுபிறப்பும்	தீயவை	தீண்டா	பழிபிறங்காப்			பண்புடை	மக்கட்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :Who children gain, that none reproach, of virtuous worth, No evils touch them, through the sev'n-fold maze of birth.
Explanation: Explanation :The evils of the seven births shall not touch those who abtain children of a good disposition, free from vice.

Verse: தம்பொருள்	என்பதம்	மக்கள்	அவர்பொருள்			தம்தம்	வினையான்	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :'Man's children are his fortune,' say the wise; From each one's deeds his varied fortunes rise.
Explanation: Explanation :Men will call their sons their wealth, because it flows to them through the deeds which they (sons) perform on their behalf.

Verse: அமிழ்தினும்	ஆற்ற	இனிதேதம்	மக்கள்			சிறுகை	அளாவிய	கூழ்.
Translation: Translation :Than God's ambrosia sweeter far the food before men laid, In which the little hands of children of their own have play'd.
Explanation: Explanation :The rice in which the little hand of their children has dabbled will be far sweeter (to the parent) than ambrosia.

Verse: மக்கள்மெய்	தீண்டல்	உடற்கின்பம்	மற்றுஅவர்			சொற்கேட்டல்	இன்பம்	செவிக்கு.
Translation: Translation :To patent sweet the touch of children dear; Their voice is sweetest music to his ear.
Explanation: Explanation :The touch of children gives pleasure to the body, and the hearing of their words, pleasure to the ear.

Verse: குழல்இனிது	யாழ்இனிது	என்பதம்	மக்கள்			மழலைச்சொல்	கேளா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :'The pipe is sweet,' 'the lute is sweet,' by them't will be averred, Who music of their infants' lisping lips have never heard.
Explanation: Explanation :"The pipe is sweet, the lute is sweet," say those who have not heard the prattle of their own children.

Verse: தந்தை	மகற்காற்று	நன்றி	அவையத்து			முந்தி	இருப்பச்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Sire greatest boon on son confers, who makes him meet, In councils of the wise to fill the highest seat.
Explanation: Explanation :The benefit which a father should confer on his son is to give him precedence in the assembly of the learned.

Verse: தம்மின்தம்	மக்கள்	அறிவுடைமை	மாநிலத்து			மன்னுயிர்க்	கெல்லாம்	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :Their children's wisdom greater than their own confessed, Through the wide world is sweet to every human breast.
Explanation: Explanation :That their children should possess knowledge is more pleasing to all men of this great earth than to themselves.

Verse: ஈன்ற	பொழுதின்	பெரிதுவக்கும்	தன்மகனைச்			சான்றோன்	எனக்கேட்ட	தாய்.
Translation: Translation :When mother hears him named 'fulfill'd of wisdom's lore,' Far greater joy she feels, than when her son she bore.
Explanation: Explanation :The mother who hears her son called "a wise man" will rejoice more than she did at his birth.

Verse: மகன்தந்தைக்கு	ஆற்றும்	உதவி	இவன்தந்தை			என்நோற்றான்	கொல்எனும்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :To sire, what best requital can by grateful child be done? To make men say, 'What merit gained the father such a son?'
Explanation: Explanation :(So to act) that it may be said "by what great penance did his father beget him," is the benefit which a son should render to his father.

Verse: அன்பிற்கும்	உண்டோ	அடைக்குந்தாழ்	ஆர்வலர்			புன்கணீர்	பூசல்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :And is there bar that can even love restrain? The tiny tear shall make the lover's secret plain.
Explanation: Explanation :Is there any fastening that can shut in love ? Tears of the affectionate will publish the love that is within.

Verse: அன்பிலார்	எல்லாம்	தமக்குரியர்	அன்புடையார்			என்பும்	உரியர்	பிறர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :The loveless to themselves belong alone; The loving men are others' to the very bone.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who are destitute of love appropriate all they have to themselves; but those who possess love consider even their bones to belong to others.

Verse: அன்போடு	இயைந்த	வழக்கென்ப	ஆருயிர்க்கு			என்போடு	இயைந்த	தொடர்பு.
Translation: Translation :Of precious soul with body's flesh and bone, The union yields one fruit, the life of love alone.
Explanation: Explanation :They say that the union of soul and body in man is the fruit of the union of love and virtue (in a former birth).

Verse: அன்புஈனும்	ஆர்வம்	உடைமை	அதுஈனும்			நண்பு	என்னும்	நாடாச்	சிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :From love fond yearning springs for union sweet of minds; And that the bond of rare excelling friendship binds.
Explanation: Explanation :Love begets desire: and that (desire) begets the immeasureable excellence of friendship.

Verse: அன்புற்று	அமர்ந்த	வழக்கென்ப	வையகத்து			இன்புற்றார்	எய்தும்	சிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :Sweetness on earth and rarest bliss above, These are the fruits of tranquil life of love.
Explanation: Explanation :They say that the felicity which those who, after enjoying the pleasure (of the conjugal state) in this world, obtain in heaven is the result of their domestic state imbued with love.

Verse: அறத்திற்கே	அன்புசார்	பென்ப	அறியார்			மறத்திற்கும்	அஃதே	துணை.
Translation: Translation :The unwise deem love virtue only can sustain, It also helps the man who evil would restrain.
Explanation: Explanation :The ignorant say that love is an ally to virtue only, but it is also a help to get out of vice.

Verse: என்பி	லதனை	வெயில்போலக்	காயுமே			அன்பி	லதனை	அறம்.
Translation: Translation :As sun's fierce ray dries up the boneless things, So loveless beings virtue's power to nothing brings.
Explanation: Explanation :Virtue will burn up the soul which is without love, even as the sun burns up the creature which is without bone, i.e. worms.

Verse: அன்பகத்	தில்லா	உயிர்வாழ்க்கை	வன்பாற்கண்			வற்றல்	மரந்தளிர்த்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :The loveless soul, the very joys of life may know, When flowers, in barren soil, on sapless trees, shall blow.
Explanation: Explanation :The domestic state of that man whose mind is without love is like the flourishing of a withered tree upon the parched desert.

Verse: புறத்துறுப்	பெல்லாம்	எவன்செய்யும்	யாக்கை			அகத்துறுப்பு	அன்பி	லவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :Though every outward part complete, the body's fitly framed; What good, when soul within, of love devoid, lies halt and maimed?
Explanation: Explanation :Of what avail are all the external members (of the body) to those who are destitute of love, the internal member.

Verse: அன்பின்	வழியது	உயிர்நிலை	அஃதிலார்க்கு			என்புதோல்	போர்த்த	உடம்பு.
Translation: Translation :Bodies of loveless men are bony framework clad with skin; Then is the body seat of life, when love resides within.
Explanation: Explanation :That body alone which is inspired with love contains a living soul: if void of it, (the body) is bone overlaid with skin.

Verse: இருந்தோம்பி	இல்வாழ்வ	தெல்லாம்	விருந்தோம்பி			வேளாண்மை	செய்தற்	பொருட்டு.
Translation: Translation :All household cares and course of daily life have this in view. Guests to receive with courtesy, and kindly acts to do.
Explanation: Explanation :The whole design of living in the domestic state and laying up (property) is (to be able) to exercise the benevolence of hospitality.

Verse: விருந்து	புறத்ததாத்	தானுண்டல்	சாவா			மருந்தெனினும்	வேண்டற்பாற்	றன்று.
Translation: Translation :Though food of immortality should crown the board, Feasting alone, the guests without unfed, is thing abhorred.
Explanation: Explanation :It is not fit that one should wish his guests to be outside (his house) even though he were eating the food of immortality.

Verse: வருவிருந்து	வைகலும்	ஓம்புவான்	வாழ்க்கை			பருவந்து	பாழ்படுதல்	இன்று.
Translation: Translation :Each day he tends the coming guest with kindly care; Painless, unfailing plenty shall his household share.
Explanation: Explanation :The domestic life of the man that daily entertains the guests who come to him shall not be laid waste by poverty.

Verse: அகனமர்ந்து	செய்யாள்	உறையும்	முகனமர்ந்து			நல்விருந்து	ஓம்புவான்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :With smiling face he entertains each virtuous guest, 'Fortune' with gladsome mind shall in his dwelling rest.
Explanation: Explanation :Lakshmi with joyous mind shall dwell in the house of that man who, with cheerful countenance, entertains the good as guests.

Verse: வித்தும்	இடல்வேண்டும்	கொல்லோ	விருந்தோம்பி			மிச்சில்	மிசைவான்	புலம்.
Translation: Translation :Who first regales his guest, and then himself supplies, O'er all his fields, unsown, shall plenteous harvests rise.
Explanation: Explanation :Is it necessary to sow the field of the man who, having feasted his guests, eats what may remain ?

Verse: செல்விருந்து	ஓம்பி	வருவிருந்து	பார்த்திருப்பான்			நல்வருந்து	வானத்	தவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :The guest arrived he tends, the coming guest expects to see; To those in heavenly homes that dwell a welcome guest is he.
Explanation: Explanation :He who, having entertained the guests that have come, looks out for others who may yet come, will be a welcome guest to the inhabitants of heaven.

Verse: இனைத்துணைத்	தென்பதொன்	றில்லை	விருந்தின்			துணைத்துணை	வேள்விப்	பயன்.
Translation: Translation :To reckon up the fruit of kindly deeds were all in vain; Their worth is as the worth of guests you entertain.
Explanation: Explanation :The advantages of benevolence cannot be measured; the measure (of the virtue) of the guests (entertained) is the only measure.

Verse: பரிந்தோம்பிப்	பற்றற்றேம்	என்பர்	விருந்தோம்பி			வேள்வி	தலைப்படா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :With pain they guard their stores, yet 'All forlorn are we,' they'll cry, Who cherish not their guests, nor kindly help supply.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have taken no part in the benevolence of hospitality shall (at length lament) saying, "we have laboured and laid up wealth and are now without support."

Verse: உடைமையுள்	இன்மை	விருந்தோம்பல்	ஓம்பா			மடமை	மடவார்கண்	உண்டு.
Translation: Translation :To turn from guests is penury, though worldly goods abound; 'Tis senseless folly, only with the senseless found.
Explanation: Explanation :That stupidity which excercises no hospitality is poverty in the midst of wealth. It is the property of the stupid.

Verse: மோப்பக்	குழையும்	அனிச்சம்	முகந்திரிந்து			நோக்கக்	குநழ்யும்	விருந்து.
Translation: Translation :The flower of 'Anicha' withers away, If you do but its fragrance inhale; If the face of the host cold welcome convey, The guest's heart within him will fail.
Explanation: Explanation :As the Anicham flower fades in smelling, so fades the guest when the face is turned away.

Verse: இன்சொலால்	ஈரம்	அளைஇப்	படிறுஇலவாம்			செம்பொருள்	கண்டார்வாய்ச்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :Pleasant words are words with all pervading love that burn; Words from his guileless mouth who can the very truth discern.
Explanation: Explanation :Sweet words are those which imbued with love and free from deceit flow from the mouth of the virtuous.

Verse: அகன்அமர்ந்து	ஈதலின்	நன்றே	முகனமர்ந்து			இன்சொலன்	ஆகப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :A pleasant word with beaming smile,s preferred, Even to gifts with liberal heart conferred.
Explanation: Explanation :Sweet speech, with a cheerful countenance is better than a gift made with a joyous mind.

Verse: முகத்தான்	அமர்ந்து	இனிதுநோக்கி	அகத்தானாம்			இன்சொ	லினதே	அறம்.
Translation: Translation :With brightly beaming smile, and kindly light of loving eye, And heart sincere, to utter pleasant words is charity.
Explanation: Explanation :Sweet speech, flowing from the heart (uttered) with a cheerful countenance and a sweet look, is true virtue.

Verse: துன்புறூஉம்	துவ்வாமை	இல்லாகும்	யார்மாட்டும்			இன்புறூஉம்	இன்சொ	லவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :The men of pleasant speech that gladness breathe around, Through indigence shall never sorrow's prey be found.
Explanation: Explanation :Sorrow-increasing poverty shall not come upon those who use towards all, pleasure-increasing sweetness of speech.

Verse: பணிவுடையன்	இன்சொலன்	ஆதல்	ஒருவற்கு			அணியல்ல	மற்றுப்	பிற.
Translation: Translation :Humility with pleasant speech to man on earth, Is choice adornment; all besides is nothing worth.
Explanation: Explanation :Humility and sweetness of speech are the ornaments of man; all others are not (ornaments).

Verse: அல்லவை	தேய	அறம்பெருகும்	நல்லவை			நாடி	இனிய	சொலின்
Translation: Translation :Who seeks out good, words from his lips of sweetness flow; In him the power of vice declines, and virtues grow.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man, while seeking to speak usefully, speaks also sweetly, his sins will diminish and his virtue increase.

Verse: நயன்ஈன்று	நன்றி	பயக்கும்	பயன்ஈன்று			பண்பின்	தலைப்பிரியாச்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :The words of sterling sense, to rule of right that strict adhere, To virtuous action prompting, blessings yield in every sphere.
Explanation: Explanation :That speech which, while imparting benefits ceases not to please, will yield righteousness (for this world) and merit (for the next world).

Verse: சிறுமையுவு	நீங்கிய	இன்சொல்	மறுமையும்			இம்மையும்	இன்பம்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Sweet kindly words, from meanness free, delight of heart, In world to come and in this world impart.
Explanation: Explanation :Sweet speech, free from harm to others, will give pleasure both in this world and in the next.

Verse: இன்சொல்	இனிதீன்றல்	காண்பான்	எவன்கொலோ			வன்சொல்	வழங்கு	வது.
Translation: Translation :Who sees the pleasure kindly speech affords, Why makes he use of harsh, repellant words?
Explanation: Explanation :Why does he use harsh words, who sees the pleasure which sweet speech yields ?

Verse: இனிய	உளவாக	இன்னாத	கூறல்			கனிஇருப்பக்	காய்கவர்ந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :When pleasant words are easy, bitter words to use, Is, leaving sweet ripe fruit, the sour unripe to choose.
Explanation: Explanation :To say disagreeable things when agreeable are at hand is like eating unripe fruit when there is ripe.

Verse: செய்யாமல்	செய்த	உதவிக்கு	வையகமும்			வானகமும்	ஆற்றல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Assistance given by those who ne'er received our aid, Is debt by gift of heaven and earth but poorly paid.
Explanation: Explanation :(The gift of) heaven and earth is not an equivalent for a benefit which is conferred where none had been received.

Verse: காலத்தி	னாற்செய்த	நன்றி	சிறிதெனினும்			ஞாலத்தின்	மாணப்	பெரிது.
Translation: Translation :A timely benefit, -though thing of little worth, The gift itself, -in excellence transcends the earth.
Explanation: Explanation :A favour conferred in the time of need, though it be small (in itself), is (in value) much larger than the world.

Verse: பயன்தூக்கார்	செய்த	உதவி	நயன்தூக்கின்			நன்மை	கடலின்	பெரிது.
Translation: Translation :Kindness shown by those who weigh not what the return may be: When you ponder right its merit, 'Tis vaster than the sea.
Explanation: Explanation :If we weigh the excellence of a benefit which is conferred without weighing the return, it is larger than the sea.

Verse: தினைத்துணை	நன்றி	செயினும்	பனைத்துணையாக்			கொள்வர்	பயன்தெரி	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Each benefit to those of actions' fruit who rightly deem, Though small as millet-seed, as palm-tree vast will seem.
Explanation: Explanation :Though the benefit conferred be as small as a millet seed, those who know its advantage will consider it as large as a palmyra fruit.

Verse: உதவி	வரைத்தன்று	உதவி	உதவி			செயப்பட்டார்	சால்பின்	வரைத்து.
Translation: Translation :The kindly aid's extent is of its worth no measure true; Its worth is as the worth of him to whom the act you do.
Explanation: Explanation :The benefit itself is not the measure of the benefit; the worth of those who have received it is its measure.

Verse: மறவற்க	மாசற்றார்	கேண்மை	துறவற்க			துன்பத்துள்	துப்பாயார்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Kindness of men of stainless soul remember evermore! Forsake thou never friends who were thy stay in sorrow sore!
Explanation: Explanation :Forsake not the friendship of those who have been your staff in adversity. Forget not be benevolence of the blameless.

Verse: எழுமை	எழுபிறப்பும்	உள்ளுவர்	தங்கண்			விழுமந்	துடைத்தவர்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Through all seven worlds, in seven-fold birth, Remains in mem'ry of the wise. Friendship of those who wiped on earth, The tears of sorrow from their eyes.
Explanation: Explanation :(The wise) will remember throughout their seven-fold births the love of those who have wiped away their affliction.

Verse: நன்றி	மறப்பது	நன்றன்று	நன்றல்லது			அன்றே	மறப்பது	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :'Tis never good to let the thought of good things done thee pass away; Of things not good, 'tis good to rid thy memory that very day.
Explanation: Explanation :It is not good to forget a benefit; it is good to forget an injury even in the very moment (in which it is inflicted).

Verse: கொன்றன்ன	இன்னா	செயினும்	அவர்செய்த			ஒன்றுநன்று	உள்ளக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Effaced straightway is deadliest injury, By thought of one kind act in days gone by.
Explanation: Explanation :Though one inflict an injury great as murder, it will perish before the thought of one benefit (formerly) conferred.

Verse: எந்நன்றி	கொன்றார்க்கும்	உய்வுண்டாம்	உய்வில்லை			செய்ந்நன்றி	கொன்ற	மகற்கு.
Translation: Translation :Who every good have killed, may yet destruction flee; Who 'benefit' has killed, that man shall ne'er 'scape free!
Explanation: Explanation :He who has killed every virtue may yet escape; there is no escape for him who has killed a benefit.

Verse: தகுதி	எனவொன்று	நன்றே	பகுதியால்			பாற்பட்டு	ஒழுகப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :If justice, failing not, its quality maintain, Giving to each his due, -'tis man's one highest gain.
Explanation: Explanation :That equity which consists in acting with equal regard to each of (the three) divisions of men [enemies, strangers and friends] is a pre-eminent virtue.

Verse: செப்பம்	உடையவன்	ஆக்கஞ்	சிதைவின்றி			எச்சத்திற்	கேமாப்பு	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :The just man's wealth unwasting shall endure, And to his race a lasting joy ensure.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of the man of rectitude will not perish, but will bring happiness also to his posterity.

Verse: நன்றே	தரினும்	நடுவிகந்தாம்	ஆக்கத்தை			அன்றே	யொழிய	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Though only good it seem to give, yet gain By wrong acquired, not e'en one day retain!
Explanation: Explanation :Forsake in the very moment (of acquisition) that gain which, though it should bring advantage, is without equity.

Verse: தக்கார்	தகவிலர்	என்பது	அவரவர்			எச்சத்தாற்	காணப்ப	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who just or unjust lived shall soon appear: By each one's offspring shall the truth be clear.
Explanation: Explanation :The worthy and unworthy may be known by the existence or otherwise of good offsprings.

Verse: கேடும்	பெருக்கமும்	இல்லல்ல	நெஞ்சத்துக்			கோடாமை	சான்றோர்க்	கணி.
Translation: Translation :The gain and loss in life are not mere accident; Just mind inflexible is sages' ornament.
Explanation: Explanation :Loss and gain come not without cause; it is the ornament of the wise to preserve evenness of mind (under both).

Verse: கெடுவல்யான்	என்பது	அறிகதன்	நெஞ்சம்			நடுவொரீஇ	அல்ல	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :If, right deserting, heart to evil turn, Let man impending ruin's sign discern!
Explanation: Explanation :Let him whose mind departing from equity commits sin well consider thus within himself, "I shall perish."

Verse: கெடுவாக	வையாது	உலகம்	நடுவாக			நன்றிக்கண்	தங்கியான்	தாழ்வு.
Translation: Translation :The man who justly lives, tenacious of the right, In low estate is never low to wise man's sight.
Explanation: Explanation :The great will not regard as poverty the low estate of that man who dwells in the virtue of equity.

Verse: சமன்செய்து	சீர்தூக்குங்	கோல்போல்	அமைந்தொருபால்			கோடாமை	சான்றோர்க்	கணி.
Translation: Translation :To stand, like balance-rod that level hangs and rightly weighs, With calm unbiassed equity of soul, is sages' praise.
Explanation: Explanation :To incline to neither side, but to rest impartial as the even-fixed scale is the ornament of the wise.

Verse: சொற்கோட்டம்	இல்லது	செப்பம்	ஒருதலையா			உட்கோட்டம்	இன்மை	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :Inflexibility in word is righteousness, If men inflexibility of soul possess.
Explanation: Explanation :Freedom from obliquity of speech is rectitude, if there be (corresponding) freedom from bias of mind.

Verse: வாணிகம்	செய்வார்க்கு	வாணிகம்	பேணிப்			பிறவும்	தமபோல்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :As thriving trader is the trader known, Who guards another's interests as his own.
Explanation: Explanation :The true merchandize of merchants is to guard and do by the things of others as they do by their own.

Verse: அடக்கம்	அமரருள்	உய்க்கும்	அடங்காமை			ஆரிருள்	உய்த்து	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :Control of self does man conduct to bliss th' immortals share; Indulgence leads to deepest night, and leaves him there.
Explanation: Explanation :Self-control will place (a man) among the Gods; the want of it will drive (him) into the thickest darkness (of hell).

Verse: காக்க	பொருளா	அடக்கத்தை	ஆக்கம்			அதனினூஉங்	கில்லை	உயிர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :Guard thou as wealth the power of self-control; Than this no greater gain to living soul!
Explanation: Explanation :Let self-control be guarded as a treasure; there is no greater source of good for man than that.

Verse: செறிவறிந்து	சீர்மை	பயக்கும்	அறிவறிந்து			ஆற்றின்	அடங்கப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :If versed in wisdom's lore by virtue's law you self restrain. Your self-repression known will yield you glory's gain.
Explanation: Explanation :Knowing that self-control is knowledge, if a man should control himself, in the prescribed course, such self-control will bring him distinction among the wise.

Verse: நிலையின்	திரியாது	அடங்கியான்	தோற்றம்			மலையினும்	மாணப்	பெரிது.
Translation: Translation :In his station, all unswerving, if man self subdue, Greater he than mountain proudly rising to the view.
Explanation: Explanation :More lofty than a mountain will be the greatness of that man who without swerving from his domestic state, controls himself.

Verse: எல்லார்க்கும்	நன்றாம்	பணிதல்	அவருள்ளும்			செல்வர்க்கே	செல்வம்	தகைத்து.
Translation: Translation :To all humility is goodly grace; but chief to them With fortune blessed, -'tis fortune's diadem.
Explanation: Explanation :Humility is good in all; but especially in the rich it is (the excellence of) higher riches.

Verse: ஒருநம்யுள்	ஆமைபோல்	ஐந்தடக்கல்	ஆற்றின்			எழுநம்யும்	ஏமாப்	புடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Like tortoise, who the five restrains In one, through seven world bliss obtains.
Explanation: Explanation :Should one throughout a single birth, like a tortoise keep in his five senses, the fruit of it will prove a safe-guard to him throughout the seven-fold births.

Verse: யாகாவா	ராயினும்	நாகாக்க	காவாக்கால்			சோகாப்பர்	சொல்லிழுக்குப்	பட்டு.
Translation: Translation :Whate'er they fail to guard, o'er lips men guard should keep; If not, through fault of tongue, they bitter tears shall weep.
Explanation: Explanation :Whatever besides you leave unguarded, guard your tongue; otherwise errors of speech and the consequent misery will ensue.

Verse: ஒன்றானுந்	தீச்சொல்	பொருட்பயன்	உண்டாயின்			நன்றாகா	தாகி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :Though some small gain of good it seem to bring, The evil word is parent still of evil thing.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man's speech be productive of a single evil, all the good by him will be turned into evil.

Verse: தீயினாற்	சுட்டபுண்	உள்ளாறும்	ஆறாதே			நாவினாற்	சுட்ட	வடு.
Translation: Translation :In flesh by fire inflamed, nature may thoroughly heal the sore; In soul by tongue inflamed, the ulcer healeth never more.
Explanation: Explanation :The wound which has been burnt in by fire may heal, but a wound burnt in by the tongue will never heal.

Verse: கதங்காத்துக்	கற்றடங்கல்	ஆற்றுவான்	செவ்வி			அறம்பார்க்கும்	ஆற்றின்	நுழைந்து.
Translation: Translation :Who learns restraint, and guards his soul from wrath, Virtue, a timely aid, attends his path.
Explanation: Explanation :Virtue, seeking for an opportunity, will come into the path of that man who, possessed of learning and self-control, guards himself against anger.

Verse: ஒழுக்கம்	விழுப்பந்	தரலான்	ஒழுக்கம்			உயிரினும்	ஓம்பப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :'Decorum' gives especial excellence; with greater care 'Decorum' should men guard than life, which all men share.
Explanation: Explanation :Propriety of conduct leads to eminence, it should therefore be preserved more carefully than life.

Verse: பரிந்தோம்பிக்	காக்க	ஒழுக்கம்	தெரிந்தோம்பித்			தேரினும்	அஃதே	துணை.
Translation: Translation :Searching, duly watching, learning, 'decorum' still we find; Man's only aid; toiling, guard thou this with watchful mind.
Explanation: Explanation :Let propriety of conduct be laboriously preserved and guarded; though one know and practise and excel in many virtues, that will be an eminent aid.

Verse: ஒழுக்கம்	உடைமை	குடிமை	இழுக்கம்			இழிந்த	பிறப்பாய்	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :'Decorum's' true nobility on earth; 'Indecorum's' issue is ignoble birth.
Explanation: Explanation :Propriety of conduct is true greatness of birth, and impropriety will sink into a mean birth.

Verse: மறப்பினும்	ஓத்துக்	கொளலாகும்	பார்ப்பான்			பிறப்பொழுக்கங்	குன்றக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Though he forget, the Brahman may regain his Vedic lore; Failing in 'decorum due,' birthright's gone for evermore.
Explanation: Explanation :A Brahman though he should forget the Vedas may recover it by reading; but, if he fail in propriety of conduct even his high birth will be destroyed.

Verse: அழுக்கா	றுடையான்கண்	ஆக்கம்போன்று	இல்லை			ஒழுக்க	மிலான்கண்	உயர்வு.
Translation: Translation :The envious soul in life no rich increase of blessing gains, So man of 'due decorum' void no dignity obtains.
Explanation: Explanation :Just as the envious man will be without wealth, so will the man of destitute of propriety of conduct be without greatness.

Verse: ஒழுக்கத்தின்	ஒல்கார்	உரவோர்	இழுக்கத்தின்			ஏதம்	படுபாக்	கறிந்து.
Translation: Translation :The strong of soul no jot abate of 'strict decorum's' laws, Knowing that 'due decorum's' breach foulest disgrace will cause.
Explanation: Explanation :Those firm in mind will not slacken in their observance of the proprieties of life, knowing, as they do, the misery that flows from the transgression from them.

Verse: ஒழுக்கத்தின்	எய்துவர்	மேன்மை	இழுக்கத்தின்			எய்துவர்	எய்தாப்	பழி.
Translation: Translation :'Tis source of dignity when 'true decorum' is preserved; Who break 'decorum's' rules endure e'en censures undeserved.
Explanation: Explanation :From propriety of conduct men obtain greatness; from impropriety comes insufferable disgrace.

Verse: நன்றிக்கு	வித்தாகும்	நல்லொழுக்கம்	தீயொழுக்கம்			என்றும்	இடும்பை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :'Decorum true' observed a seed of good will be; 'Decorum's breach' will sorrow yield eternally.
Explanation: Explanation :Propriety of conduct is the seed of virtue; impropriety will ever cause sorrow.

Verse: ஒழுக்க	முடையவர்க்கு	ஒல்லாவே	தீய			வழுக்கியும்	வாயாற்	சொலல்.
Translation: Translation :It cannot be that they who 'strict decorum's' law fulfil, E'en in forgetful mood, should utter words of ill.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who study propriety of conduct will not speak evil, even forgetfully.

Verse: உலகத்தோடு	ஒட்ட	ஒழுகல்	பலகற்றும்			கல்லார்	அறிவிலா	தார்
Translation: Translation :Who know not with the world in harmony to dwell, May many things have learned, but nothing well.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who know not how to act agreeably to the world, though they have learnt many things, are still ignorant.

Verse: பிறன்பொருளாள்	பெட்டொழுகும்	பேதைமை	ஞாலத்து			அறம்பொருள்	கண்டார்கண்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Who laws of virtue and possession's rights have known, Indulge no foolish love of her by right another's own.
Explanation: Explanation :The folly of desiring her who is the property of another will not be found in those who know (the attributes of) virtue and (the rights of) property.

Verse: அறன்கடை	நின்றாருள்	எல்லாம்	பிறன்கடை			நின்றாரின்	பேதையார்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :No fools, of all that stand from virtue's pale shut out, Like those who longing lurk their neighbour's gate without.
Explanation: Explanation :Among all those who stand on the outside of virtue, there are no greater fools than those who stand outside their neighbour's door.

Verse: விளிந்தாரின்	வேறல்லர்	மன்ற	தெளிந்தாரில்			தீமை	புரிந்துதொழுகு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :They're numbered with the dead, e'en while they live, -how otherwise? With wife of sure confiding friend who evil things devise.
Explanation: Explanation :Certainly they are no better than dead men who desire evil towards the wife of those who undoubtingly confide in them.

Verse: எனைத்துணையர்	ஆயினும்	என்னாம்	தினைத்துணையும்			தேரான்	பிறனில்	புகல்.
Translation: Translation :How great soe'er they be, what gain have they of life, Who, not a whit reflecting, seek a neighbour's wife.
Explanation: Explanation :However great one may be, what does it avail if, without at all considering his guilt, he goes unto the wife of another ?

Verse: எளிதென	இல்லிறப்பான்	எய்துமெஞ்	ஞான்றும்			விளியாது	நிற்கும்	பழி.
Translation: Translation :'Mere triflel' saying thus, invades the home, so he ensures. A gain of guilt that deathless aye endures.
Explanation: Explanation :He who thinks lightly of going into the wife of another acquires guilt that will abide with him imperishably and for ever.

Verse: பகைபாவம்	அச்சம்	பழியென	நான்கும்			இகவாவாம்	இல்லிறப்பான்	கண்.
Translation: Translation :Who home ivades, from him pass nevermore, Hatred and sin, fear, foul disgrace; these four.
Explanation: Explanation :Hatred, sin, fear, disgrace; these four will never leave him who goes in to his neighbour's wife.

Verse: அறனியலான்	இல்வாழ்வான்	என்பான்	பிறனியலாள்			பெண்மை	நயவா	தவன்.
Translation: Translation :Who sees the wife, another's own, with no desiring eye In sure domestic bliss he dwelleth ever virtuously.
Explanation: Explanation :He who desires not the womanhood of her who should walk according to the will of another will be praised as a virtuous house-holder.

Verse: பிறன்மனை	நோக்காத	பேராண்மை	சான்றோர்க்கு			அறனொன்றோ	ஆன்ற	வொழுக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Manly excellence, that looks not on another's wife, Is not virtue merely, 'tis full 'propriety' of life.
Explanation: Explanation :That noble manliness which looks not at the wife of another is the virtue and dignity of the great.

Verse: நலக்குரியார்	யாரெனின்	நாமநீர்	வைப்பின்			பிறர்க்குரியாள்	தோள்தோயா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :Who 're good indeed, on earth begirt by ocean's gruesome tide? The men who touch not her that is another's bride.
Explanation: Explanation :Is it asked, "who are those who shall obtain good in this world surrounded by the terror-producing sea ?" Those who touch not the shoulder of her who belongs to another.

Verse: அறன்வரையான்	அல்ல	செயினும்	பிறன்வரையாள்			பெண்மை	நயவாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Though virtue's bounds he pass, and evil deeds hath wrought; At least, 'tis good if neighbour's wife he covet not.
Explanation: Explanation :Though a man perform no virtuous deeds and commit (every) vice, it will be well if he desire not the womanhood of her who is within the limit (of the house) of another.

Verse: அகழ்வாரைத்	தாங்கும்	நிலம்போலத்	தம்மை			இகழ்வார்ப்	பொறுத்தல்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :As earth bears up the men who delve into her breast, To bear with scornful men of virtues is the best.
Explanation: Explanation :To bear with those who revile us, just as the earth bears up those who dig it, is the first of virtues.

Verse: பொறுத்தல்	இறப்பினை	என்றும்	அதனை			மறத்தல்	அதனினும்	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Forgiving trespasses is good always; Forgetting them hath even higher praise;
Explanation: Explanation :Bear with reproach even when you can retaliate; but to forget it will be still better than that.

Verse: இன்நம்யுள்	இன்மை	விருந்தொரால்	வன்மையுள்			வன்மை	மடவார்ப்	பொறை.
Translation: Translation :The sorest poverty is bidding guest unfed depart; The mightiest might to bear with men of foolish heart.
Explanation: Explanation :To neglect hospitality is poverty of poverty. To bear with the ignorant is might of might.

Verse: நிறையுடைமை	நீங்காமை	வேண்டின்	பொற்யுடைமை			போற்றி	யொழுகப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Seek'st thou honour never tarnished to retain; So must thou patience, guarding evermore, maintain.
Explanation: Explanation :If you desire that greatness should never leave, you preserve in your conduct the exercise of patience.

Verse: ஒறுத்தாரை	ஒன்றாக	வையாரே	வைப்பர்			பொறுத்தாரைப்	பொன்போற்	பொதிந்து.
Translation: Translation :Who wreak their wrath as worthless are despised; Who patiently forbear as gold are prized.
Explanation: Explanation :(The wise) will not at all esteem the resentful. They will esteem the patient just as the gold which they lay up with care.

Verse: ஒறுத்தார்க்கு	ஒருநாளை	இன்பம்	பொறுத்தார்க்குப்			பொன்றுந்	துணையும்	புகழ்.
Translation: Translation :Who wreak their wrath have pleasure for a day; Who bear have praise till earth shall pass away.
Explanation: Explanation :The pleasure of the resentful continues for a day. The praise of the patient will continue until (the final destruction of) the world.

Verse: திறனல்ல	தற்பிறர்	செய்யினும்	நோநொந்து			அறனல்ல	செய்யாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Though others work thee ill, thus shalt thou blessing reap; Grieve for their sin, thyself from vicious action keep!
Explanation: Explanation :Though others inflict injuries on you, yet compassionating the evil (that will come upon them) it will be well not to do them anything contrary to virtue.

Verse: மிகுதியான்	மிக்கவை	செய்தாரைத்	தாந்தம்			தகுதியான்	வென்று	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :With overweening pride when men with injuries assail, By thine own righteous dealing shalt thou mightily prevail.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a man by patience overcome those who through pride commit excesses.

Verse: துறந்தாரின்	தூய்மை	உடையர்	இறந்தார்வாய்			இன்னாச்சொல்	நோற்கிற்	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :They who transgressors' evil words endure With patience, are as stern ascetics pure.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who bear with the uncourteous speech of the insolent are as pure as the ascetics.

Verse: உண்ணாது	நோற்பார்	பெரியர்	பிறர்சொல்லும்			இன்னாச்சொல்	நோற்பாரின்	பின்.
Translation: Translation :Though 'great' we deem the men that fast and suffer pain, Who others' bitter words endure, the foremost place obtain.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who endure abstinence from food are great, next to those who endure the uncourteous speech of others.

Verse: ஒழுக்காறாக்	கொள்க	ஒருவன்தன்	நெஞ்சத்து			அழுக்காறு	இலாத	இயல்பு.
Translation: Translation :As 'strict decorum's' laws, that all men bind, Let each regard unenvying grace of mind.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a man esteem that disposition which is free from envy in the same manner as propriety of conduct.

Verse: விழுப்பேற்றின்	அஃதொப்பது	இல்லையார்	மாட்டும்			அழுக்காற்றின்	அன்மை	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :If man can learn to envy none on earth, 'Tis richest gift, -beyond compare its worth.
Explanation: Explanation :Amongst all attainable excellences there is none equal to that of being free from envy towords others.

Verse: அறன்ஆக்கம்	வேண்டாதான்	என்பான்	பிறனாக்கம்			பேணாது	அழுக்கறுப்	பான்.
Translation: Translation :Nor wealth nor virtue does that man desire 'tis plain, Whom others' wealth delights not, feeling envious pain.
Explanation: Explanation :Of him who instead of rejoicing in the wealth of others, envies it, it will be said "he neither desires virtue not wealth."

Verse: அழுக்காற்றின்	அல்லவை	செய்யார்	இழுக்காற்றின்			ஏதம்	படுபாக்கு	அறிந்து.
Translation: Translation :The wise through envy break not virtue's laws, Knowing ill-deeds of foul disgrace the cause.
Explanation: Explanation :(The wise) knowing the misery that comes from transgression will not through envy commit unrighteous deeds.

Verse: அழுக்காறு	உடையார்க்கு	அதுசாலும்	ஒன்னார்			வழுக்காயும்	கேடீன்	பது.
Translation: Translation :Envy they have within! Enough to seat their fate! Though foemen fail, envy can ruin consummate.
Explanation: Explanation :To those who cherish envy that is enough. Though free from enemies that (envy) will bring destruction.

Verse: கொடுப்பது	அழுக்கறுப்பான்	சுற்றம்	உடுப்பதூஉம்			உண்பதூஉம்	இன்றிக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who scans good gifts to others given with envious eye, His kin, with none to clothe or feed them, surely die.
Explanation: Explanation :He who is envious at a gift (made to another) will with his relations utterly perish destitute of food and rainment.

Verse: அவ்வித்து	அழுக்காறு	உடையானைச்	செய்யவள்			தவ்வையைக்	காட்டி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :From envious man good fortune's goddess turns away, Grudging him good, and points him out misfortune's prey.
Explanation: Explanation :Lakshmi envying (the prosperity) of the envious man will depart and introduce him to her sister.

Verse: அழுக்காறு	எனஒரு	பாவி	திருச்செற்றுத்			தீயுழி	உய்த்து	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :Envy, embodied ill, incomparable bane, Good fortune slays, and soul consigns to fiery pain.
Explanation: Explanation :Envy will destroy (a man's) wealth (in his world) and drive him into the pit of fire (in the world to come.)

Verse: அவ்விய	நெஞ்சத்தான்	ஆக்கமும்	செவ்வியான்			கேடும்	நினைக்கப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :To men of envious heart, when comes increase of joy, Or loss to blameless men, the 'why' will thoughtful hearts employ.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of a man of envious mind and the poverty of the righteous will be pondered.

Verse: அழுக்கற்று	அகன்றாரும்	இல்லை	அஃதுஇல்லார்			பெருக்கத்தில்	தீர்ந்தாரும்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :No envious men to large and full felicity attain; No men from envy free have failed a sure increase to gain.
Explanation: Explanation :Never have the envious become great; never have those who are free from envy been without greatness.

Verse: நடுவின்றி	நன்பொருள்	வெஃகின்	குடிபொன்றிக்			குற்றமும்	ஆங்கே	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :With soul unjust to covet others' well-earned store, Brings ruin to the home, to evil opes the door.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man departing from equity covet the property (of others), at that very time will his family be destroyed and guilt be incurred.

Verse: படுபயன்	வெஃகிப்	பழிப்படுவ	செய்யார்			நடுவன்மை	நாணு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Through lust of gain, no deeds that retribution bring, Do they, who shrink with shame from every unjust thing.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who blush at the want of equity will not commit disgraceful acts through desire of the profit that may be gained.

Verse: சிற்றின்பம்	வெஃகி	அறனல்ல	செய்யாரே			மற்றின்பம்	வேண்டு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :No deeds of ill, misled by base desire, Do they, whose souls to other joys aspire.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who desire the higher pleasures (of heaven) will not act unjustly through desire of the trifling joy. (in this life.)

Verse: இலமென்று	வெஃகுதல்	செய்யார்	புலம்வென்ற			புன்மையில்	காட்சி	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Men who have conquered sense, with sight from sordid vision freed, Desire not other's goods, e'en in the hour of sorest need.
Explanation: Explanation :The wise who have conquered their senses and are free from crime, will not covet (the things of others), with the thought "we are destitute."

Verse: அஃகி	அகன்ற	அறிவென்னாம்	யார்மாட்டும்			வெஃகி	வெறிய	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :What gain, though lore refined of amplest reach he learn, His acts towards all mankind if covetous desire to folly turn?
Explanation: Explanation :What is the advantage of extensive and accurate knowledge if a man through covetousness act senselessly towards all ?

Verse: அருள்வெஃகி	ஆற்றின்கண்	நின்றான்	பொருள்வெஃகிப்			பொல்லாத	சூழக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Though, grace desiring, he in virtue's way stand strong, He's lost who wealth desires, and ponders deeds of wrong.
Explanation: Explanation :If he, who through desire of the virtue of kindness abides in the domestic state i.e., the path in which it may be obtained, covet (the property of others) and think of evil methods (to obtain it), he will perish.

Verse: வேண்டற்க	வெஃகியாம்	ஆக்கம்	விளைவயின்			மாண்டற்	கரிதாம்	பயன்.
Translation: Translation :Seek not increase by greed of gain acquired; That fruit matured yields never good desired.
Explanation: Explanation :Desire not the gain of covetousness. In the enjoyment of its fruits there is no glory.

Verse: அஃகாமை	செல்வத்திற்கு	யாதெனின்	வெஃகாமை			வேண்டும்	பிறன்கைப்	பொருள்.
Translation: Translation :What saves prosperity from swift decline? Absence of lust to make another's cherished riches thine!
Explanation: Explanation :If it is weighed, "what is the indestructibility of wealth," it is freedom from covetousness.

Verse: அறனறிந்து	வெஃகா	அறிவுடையார்ச்	சேரும்			திறன்அறிந்	தாங்கே	திரு.
Translation: Translation :Good fortune draws anigh in helpful time of need, To him who, schooled in virtue, guards his soul from greed.
Explanation: Explanation :Lakshmi, knowing the manner (in which she may approach) will immediately come to those wise men who, knowing that it is virtue, covet not the property of others.

Verse: இறலீனும்	எண்ணாது	வெஃகின்	விறல்ஈனும்			வேண்டாமை	என்னுஞ்	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :From thoughtless lust of other's goods springs fatal ill, Greatness of soul that covets not shall triumph still.
Explanation: Explanation :To covet (the wealth of another) regardless of consequences will bring destruction. That greatness (of mind) which covets not will give victory.

Verse: அறங்கூறான்	அல்ல	செயினும்	ஒருவன்			புறங்கூறான்	என்றல்	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :Though virtuous words his lips speak not, and all his deeds are ill. If neighbour he defame not, there's good within him still.
Explanation: Explanation :Though one do not even speak of virtue and live in sin, it will be well if it be said of him "he does not backbite."

Verse: அறனழீஇ	அல்லவை	செய்தலின்	தீதே			புறனழீஇப்	பொய்த்து	நகை.
Translation: Translation :Than he who virtue scorns, and evil deeds performs, more vile, Is he that slanders friend, then meets him with false smile.
Explanation: Explanation :To smile deceitfully (in another's presence) after having reviled him to his destruction (behind his back) is a greater evil than the commission of (every other) sin and the destruction of (every) virtue.

Verse: புறங்கூறிப்	பொய்த்துயிர்	வாழ்தலின்	சாதல்			அறங்கூற்றும்	ஆக்கத்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis greater gain of virtuous good for man to die, Than live to slander absent friend, and falsely praise when nigh.
Explanation: Explanation :Death rather than life will confer upon the deceitful backbiter the profit which (the treatises on) virtue point out.

Verse: கண்ணின்று	கண்ணறச்	சொல்லினும்	சொல்லற்க			முன்னின்று	பின்நோக்காச்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :In presence though unkindly words you speak, say not In absence words whose ill result exceeds your thought.
Explanation: Explanation :Though you speak without kindness before another's face speak not in his absence words which regard not the evil subsequently resulting from it.

Verse: அறஞ்சொல்லும்	நெஞ்சத்தான்	அன்மை	புறஞ்சொல்லும்			புன்மையாற்	காணப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :The slanderous meanness that an absent friend defames, 'This man in words owns virtue, not in heart,' proclaims.
Explanation: Explanation :The emptiness of that man's mind who (merely) praises virtue will be seen from the meanness of reviling another behind his back.

Verse: பிறன்பழி	கூறுவான்	தன்பழி	யுள்ளும்			திறன்தெரிந்து	கூறப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who on his neighbours' sins delights to dwell, The story of his sins, culled out with care, the world will tell.
Explanation: Explanation :The character of the faults of that man who publishes abroad the faults of others will be sought out and published.

Verse: பகச்சொல்லிக்	கேளிர்ப்	பிரிப்பர்	நகச்சொல்லி			நட்பாடல்	தேற்றா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :With friendly art who know not pleasant words to say, Speak words that sever hearts, and drive choice friends away.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who know not to live in friendship with amusing conversation will by back-biting estrange even their relatives.

Verse: துன்னியார்	குற்றமும்	தூற்றும்	மரபினார்			என்னைகொல்	ஏதிலார்	மாட்டு.
Translation: Translation :Whose nature bids them faults of closest friends proclaim What mercy will they show to other men's good name?
Explanation: Explanation :What will those not do to strangers whose nature leads them to publish abroad the faults of their intimate friends ?

Verse: அறன்நோக்கி	ஆற்றுங்கொல்	வையம்	புறன்நோக்கிப்			புன்சொல்	உரைப்பான்	பொறை.
Translation: Translation :'Tis charity, I ween, that makes the earth sustain their load. Who, neighbours' absence watching, tales or slander tell abroad.
Explanation: Explanation :The world through charity supports the weight of those who reproach others observing their absence.

Verse: ஏதிலார்	குற்றம்போல்	தங்குற்றங்	காண்கிற்பின்			தீதுண்டோ	மன்னும்	உயிர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :If each his own, as neighbours' faults would scan, Could any evil hap to living man?
Explanation: Explanation :If they observed their own faults as they observe the faults of others, would any evil happen to men ?

Verse: பல்லார்	முனியப்	பயனில	சொல்லுவான்			எல்லாரும்	எள்ளப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Words without sense, while chafe the wise, Who babbles, him will all despise.
Explanation: Explanation :He who to the disgust of many speaks useless things will be despised by all.

Verse: பயனில	பல்லார்முன்	சொல்லல்	நயனில			நட்டார்கண்	செய்தலிற்	றீது.
Translation: Translation :Words without sense, where many wise men hear, to pour Than deeds to friends ungracious done offendeth more.
Explanation: Explanation :To speak useless things in the presence of many is a greater evil than to do unkind things towards friends.

Verse: நயனிலன்	என்பது	சொல்லும்	பயனில			பாரித்	துரைக்கும்	உரை.
Translation: Translation :Diffusive speech of useless words proclaims A man who never righteous wisdom gains.
Explanation: Explanation :That conversation in which a man utters forth useless things will say of him "he is without virtue."

Verse: நயன்சாரா	நன்மையின்	நீக்கும்	பயன்சாராப்			பண்பில்சொல்	பல்லா	ரகத்து.
Translation: Translation :Unmeaning, worthless words, said to the multitude, To none delight afford, and sever men from good.
Explanation: Explanation :The words devoid of profit or pleasure which a man speaks will, being inconsistent with virtue, remove him from goodness.

Verse: சீர்மை	சிறப்பொடு	நீங்கும்	பயனில			நீர்மை	யுடையார்	சொலின்.
Translation: Translation :Gone are both fame and boasted excellence, When men of worth speak of words devoid of sense.
Explanation: Explanation :If the good speak vain words their eminence and excellence will leave them.

Verse: பயனில்சொல்	பராட்டு	வானை	மகன்எனல்			மக்கட்	பதடி	யெனல்.
Translation: Translation :Who makes display of idle words' inanity, Call him not man, -chaff of humanity!
Explanation: Explanation :Call not him a man who parades forth his empty words. Call him the chaff of men.

Verse: நயனில	சொல்லினுஞ்	சொல்லுக	சான்றோர்			பயனில	சொல்லாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Let those who list speak things that no delight afford, 'Tis good for men of worth to speak no idle word.
Explanation: Explanation :Let the wise if they will, speak things without excellence; it will be well for them not to speak useless things.

Verse: அரும்பயன்	ஆயும்	அறிவினார்	சொல்லார்			பெரும்பயன்	இல்லாத	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :The wise who weigh the worth of every utterance, Speak none but words of deep significance.
Explanation: Explanation :The wise who seek after rare pleasures will not speak words that have not much weight in them.

Verse: பொருள்தீர்ந்த	பொச்சாந்துஞ்	சொல்லார்	மருள்தீர்ந்த			மாசறு	காட்சி	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :The men of vision pure, from wildering folly free, Not e'en in thoughtless hour, speak words of vanity.
Explanation: Explanation :Those wise men who are without faults and are freed from ignorance will not even forgetfully speak things that profit not.

Verse: சொல்லுக	சொல்லிற்	பயனுடைய	சொல்லற்க			சொல்லிற்	பயனிலாச்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :If speak you will, speak words that fruit afford, If speak you will, speak never fruitless word.
Explanation: Explanation :Speak what is useful, and speak not useless words.

Verse: தீவினையார்	அஞ்சார்	விழுமியார்	அஞ்சுவர்			தீவினை	என்னும்	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :With sinful act men cease to feel the dread of ill within, The excellent will dread the wanton pride of cherished sin.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have experience of evil deeds will not fear, but the excellent will fear the pride of sin.

Verse: தீயவை	தீய	பயத்தலால்	தீயவை			தீயினும்	அஞ்சப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Since evils new from evils ever grow, Evil than fire works out more dreaded woe.
Explanation: Explanation :Because evil produces evil, therefore should evil be feared more than fire.

Verse: அறிவினுள்	எல்லாந்	தலையென்ப	தீய			செறுவார்க்கும்	செய்யா	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Even to those that hate make no return of ill; So shalt thou wisdom's highest law, 'tis said, fulfil.
Explanation: Explanation :To do no evil to enemies will be called the chief of all virtues.

Verse: மறந்தும்	பிறன்கேடு	சூழற்க	சூழின்			அறஞ்சூழம்	சூழ்ந்தவன்	கேடு.
Translation: Translation :Though good thy soul forget, plot not thy neighbour's fall, Thy plans shall 'virtue's Power' by ruin to thyself forestall.
Explanation: Explanation :Even though forgetfulness meditate not the ruin of another. Virtue will meditate the ruin of him who thus meditates.

Verse: இலன்என்று	தீயவை	செய்யற்க	செய்யின்			இலனாகும்	மற்றும்	பெயர்த்து.
Translation: Translation :Make not thy poverty a plea for ill; Thy evil deeds will make thee poorer still.
Explanation: Explanation :Commit not evil, saying, "I am poor": if you do, you will become poorer still.

Verse: தீப்பால	தான்பிறர்கண்	செய்யற்க	நோய்ப்பால			தன்னை	அடல்வேண்டா	தான்.
Translation: Translation :What ranks as evil spare to do, if thou would'st shun Affliction sore through ill to thee by others done.
Explanation: Explanation :Let him not do evil to others who desires not that sorrows should pursue him.

Verse: எனைப்பகை	யுற்றாரும்	உய்வர்	வினைப்பகை			வீயாது	பின்சென்று	அடும்.
Translation: Translation :From every enmity incurred there is to 'scape, a way; The wrath of evil deeds will dog men's steps, and slay.
Explanation: Explanation :However great be the enmity men have incurred they may still live. The enmity of sin will incessantly pursue and kill.

Verse: தீயவை	செய்தார்	கெடுதல்	நிழல்தன்னை			வீயாது	அஇஉறைந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :Man's shadow dogs his steps where'er he wends; Destruction thus on sinful deeds attends.
Explanation: Explanation :Destruction will dwell at the heels of those who commit evil even as their shadow that leaves them not.

Verse: தன்னைத்தான்	காதல	னாயின்	எனைத்தொன்றும்			துன்னற்க	தீவினைப்	பால்.
Translation: Translation :Beware, if to thyself thyself is dear, Lest thou to aught that ranks as ill draw near!
Explanation: Explanation :If a man love himself, let him not commit any sin however small.

Verse: அருங்கேடன்	என்பது	அறிக	மருங்கோடித்			தீவினை	செய்யான்	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :The man, to devious way of sin that never turned aside, From ruin rests secure, whatever ills betide.
Explanation: Explanation :Know ye that he is freed from destruction who commits no evil, going to neither side of the right path.

Verse: கைம்மாறு	வேண்டா	கடப்பாடு	மாரிமாட்டு			என்ஆற்றுங்	கொல்லோ	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :Duty demands no recompense; to clouds of heaven, By men on earth, what answering gift is given?
Explanation: Explanation :Benevolence seeks not a return. What does the world give back to the clouds ?

Verse: தாளாற்றித்	தந்த	பொருளெல்லாம்	தக்கார்க்கு			வேளாண்மை	செய்தற்	பொருட்டு.
Translation: Translation :The worthy say, when wealth rewards their toil-spent hours, For uses of beneficence alone 'tis ours.
Explanation: Explanation :All the wealth acquired with perseverance by the worthy is for the exercise of benevolence.

Verse: புத்தே	ளுலகத்தும்	ஈண்டும்	பெறலரிதே			ஒப்புரவின்	நல்ல	பிற.
Translation: Translation :To 'due beneficence' no equal good we know, Amid the happy gods, or in this world below.
Explanation: Explanation :It is difficult to obtain another good equal to benevolence either in this world or in that of the gods.

Verse: ஒத்த	தறவோன்	உயிர்வாழ்வான்	மற்றையான்			செத்தாருள்	வைக்கப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who knows what's human life's befitting grace, He lives; the rest 'mongst dead men have their place.
Explanation: Explanation :He truly lives who knows (and discharges) the proper duties (of benevolence). He who knows them not will be reckoned among the dead.

Verse: ஊருணி	நீர்நிறைந்	தற்றே	உலகவாம்			பேரறி	வாளன்	திரு.
Translation: Translation :The wealth of men who love the 'fitting way,' the truly wise, Is as when water fills the lake that village needs supplies.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of that man of eminent knowledge who desires to exercise the benevolence approved of by the world, is like the full waters of a city-tank.

Verse: பயன்மரம்	உள்ளூர்ப்	பழுத்தற்றால்	செல்வம்			நயனுடை	யான்கண்	படின்.
Translation: Translation :A tree that fruits in th' hamlet's central mart, Is wealth that falls to men of liberal heart.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of a man (possessed of the virtue) of benevolence is like the ripening of a fruitful tree in the midst of a town.

Verse: மருந்தாகித்	தப்பா	மரத்தற்றால்	செல்வம்			பெருந்தகை	யான்கண்	படின்.
Translation: Translation :Unfailing tree that healing balm distils from every part, Is ample wealth that falls to him of large and noble heart.
Explanation: Explanation :If wealth be in the possession of a man who has the great excellence (of benevolence), it is like a tree which as a medicine is an infallible cure for disease.

Verse: இடனில்	பருவத்தும்	ஒப்புரவிற்கு	ஒல்கார்			கடனறி	காட்சி	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :E'en when resources fall, they weary not of 'kindness due,'- They to whom Duty's self appears in vision true.
Explanation: Explanation :The wise who know what is duty will not scant their benevolence even when they are without wealth.

Verse: நயனுடையான்	நல்கூர்ந்தா	னாதல்	செயும்நீர			செய்யாது	அமைகலா	வாறு.
Translation: Translation :The kindly-hearted man is poor in this alone, When power of doing deeds of goodness he finds none.
Explanation: Explanation :The poverty of a benevolent man, is nothing but his inability to exercise the same.

Verse: ஒப்புரவி	னால்வரும்	கேடெனின்	அஃதொருவன்			விற்றுக்கோள்	தக்க	துடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Though by 'beneficence,' the loss of all should come, 'Twere meet man sold himself, and bought it with the sum.
Explanation: Explanation :If it be said that loss will result from benevolence, such loss is worth being procured even by the sale of one's self.

Verse: வறியார்க்கொன்று	ஈவதே	ஈகைமற்	றெல்லாம்			குறியெதிர்ப்பை	நீர	துடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Call that a gift to needy men thou dost dispense, All else is void of good, seeking for recompense.
Explanation: Explanation :To give to the destitute is true charity. All other gifts have the nature of (what is done for) a measured return.

Verse: நல்லாறு	எனினும்	கொளல்தீது	மேலுலகம்			இல்லெனினும்	ஈதலே	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Though men declare it heavenward path, yet to receive is ill; Though upper heaven were not, to give is virtue still.
Explanation: Explanation :To beg is evil, even though it were said that it is a good path (to heaven). To give is good, even though it were said that those who do so cannot obtain heaven.

Verse: இலனென்னும்	எவ்வம்	உரையாமை	ஈதல்			குலனுடையான்	கண்ணே	யுள.
Translation: Translation :'I've nought' is ne'er the high-born man's reply; He gives to those who raise themselves that cry.
Explanation: Explanation :(Even in a low state) not to adopt the mean expedient of saying "I have nothing," but to give, is the characteristic of the mad of noble birth.

Verse: இன்னாது	இரக்கப்	படுதல்	இரந்தவர்			இன்முகங்	காணும்	அளவு.
Translation: Translation :The suppliants' cry for aid yields scant delight, Until you see his face with grateful gladness bright.
Explanation: Explanation :To see men begging from us in disagreeable, until we see their pleasant countenance.

Verse: ஆற்றுவார்	ஆற்றல்	பசிஆற்றல்	அப்பசியை			மாற்றுவார்	ஆற்றலின்	பின்.
Translation: Translation :'Mid devotees they're great who hunger's pangs sustain, Who hunger's pangs relieve a higher merit gain.
Explanation: Explanation :The power of those who perform penance is the power of enduring hunger. It is inferior to the power of those who remove the hunger (of others).

Verse: அற்றார்	அழிபசி	தீர்த்தல்	அஃதொருவன்			பெற்றான்	பொருள்வைப்	புழி.
Translation: Translation :Let man relieve the wasting hunger men endure; For treasure gained thus finds he treasure-house secure.
Explanation: Explanation :The removal of the killing hunger of the poor is the place for one to lay up his wealth.

Verse: பாத்தூண்	மரீஇ	யவனைப்	பசியென்னும்			தீப்பிணி	தீண்டல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Whose soul delights with hungry men to share his meal, The hand of hunger's sickness sore shall never feel.
Explanation: Explanation :The fiery disease of hunger shall never touch him who habitually distributes his food to others.

Verse: ஈத்துவக்கும்	இன்பம்	அறியார்கொல்	தாமுடைமை			வைத்திழக்கும்	வன்க	ணவர்.
Translation: Translation :Delight of glad'ning human hearts with gifts do they not know. Men of unpitying eye, who hoard their wealth and lose it so?
Explanation: Explanation :Do the hard-eyed who lay up and lose their possessions not know the happiness which springs from the pleasure of giving ?

Verse: இரத்தலின்	இன்னாது	மன்ற	நிரப்பிய			தாமே	தமியர்	உணல்.
Translation: Translation :They keep their garners full, for self alone the board they spread;- 'Tis greater pain, be sure, than begging daily bread!
Explanation: Explanation :Solitary and unshared eating for the sake of filling up one's own riches is certainly much more unpleasant than begging.

Verse: சாதலின்	இன்னாத	தில்லை	இனிததூஉம்			ஈதல்	இயையாக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :'Tis bitter pain to die, 'Tis worse to live. For him who nothing finds to give!
Explanation: Explanation :Nothing is more unpleasant than death: yet even that is pleasant where charity cannot be exercised.

Verse: ஈதல்	இசைபட	வாழ்தல்	அதுவல்லது			ஊதியம்	இல்லை	உயிர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :See that thy life the praise of generous gifts obtain; Save this for living man exists no real gain.
Explanation: Explanation :Give to the poor and live with praise. There is no greater profit to man than that.

Verse: உரைப்பார்	உரைப்பவை	எல்லாம்	இரப்பார்க்கொன்று			ஈவார்மேல்	நிற்கும்	புகழ்.
Translation: Translation :The speech of all that speak agrees to crown The men that give to those that ask, with fair renown.
Explanation: Explanation :Whatsoever is spoken in the world will abide as praise upon that man who gives alms to the poor.

Verse: ஒன்றா	உலகத்து	உயர்ந்த	புகழல்லால்			பொன்றாது	நிற்பதொன்	றில்.
