Translation: Translation :Save praise alone that soars on high, Nought lives on earth that shall not die.
Explanation: Explanation :There is nothing that stands forth in the world imperishable, except fame, exalted in solitary greatness.

Verse: நிலவரை	நீள்புகழ்	ஆற்றின்	புலவரைப்			போற்றாது	புத்தேள்	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :If men do virtuous deeds by world-wide ample glory crowned, The heavens will cease to laud the sage for other gifts renowned.
Explanation: Explanation :If one has acquired extensive fame within the limits of this earth, the world of the Gods will no longer praise those sages who have attained that world.

Verse: நத்தம்போல்	கேடும்	உளதாகும்	சாக்காடும்			வித்தகர்க்	கல்லால்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Loss that is gain, and death of life's true bliss fulfilled, Are fruits which only wisdom rare can yield.
Explanation: Explanation :Prosperity to the body of fame, resulting in poverty to the body of flesh and the stability to the former arising from the death of the latter, are achievable only by the wise.

Verse: தோன்றின்	புகழொடு	தோன்றுக	அஃதிலார்			தோன்றலின்	தோன்றாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :If man you walk the stage, appear adorned with glory's grace; Save glorious you can shine, 'twere better hide your face.
Explanation: Explanation :If you are born (in this world), be born with qualities conductive to fame. From those who are destitute of them it will be better not to be born.

Verse: புகழ்பட	வாழாதார்	தந்நோவார்	தம்மை			இகழ்வாரை	நோவது	எவன்.
Translation: Translation :If you your days will spend devoid of goodly fame, When men despise, why blame them? You've yourself to blame.
Explanation: Explanation :Why do those who cannot live with praise, grieve those who despise them, instead of grieving themselves for their own inability.

Verse: வசையென்ப	வையத்தார்க்	கெல்லாம்	இசையென்னும்			எச்சம்	பெறாஅ	விடின்.
Translation: Translation :Fame is virtue's child, they say; if, then, You childless live, you live the scorn of men.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to beget fame will be esteemed a disgrace by the wise in this world.

Verse: வசையிலா	வண்பயன்	குன்றும்	இசையிலா			யாக்கை	பொறுத்த	நிலம்.
Translation: Translation :The blameless fruits of fields' increase will dwindle down, If earth the burthen bear of men without renown.
Explanation: Explanation :The ground which supports a body without fame will diminish in its rich produce.

Verse: வசையொழிய	வாழ்வாரே	வாழ்வார்	இசையொழிய			வாழ்வாரே	வாழா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who live without reproach, them living men we deem; Who live without renown, live not, though living men they seem.
Explanation: Explanation :Those live who live without disgrace. Those who live without fame live not.

Verse: அருட்செல்வம்	செல்வத்துள்	செல்வம்	பொருட்செல்வம்			பூரியார்	கண்ணும்	உள.
Translation: Translation :Wealth 'mid wealth is wealth 'kindliness'; Wealth of goods the vilest too possess.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of kindness is wealth of wealth, in as much as the wealth of property is possessed by the basest of men.

Verse: நல்லாற்றாள்	நாடி	அருளாள்க	பல்லாற்றால்			தேரினும்	அஃதே	துணை.
Translation: Translation :The law of 'grace' fulfil, by methods good due trial made, Though many systems you explore, this is your only aid.
Explanation: Explanation :(Stand) in the good path, consider, and be kind. Even considering according to the conflicting tenets of the different sects, kindness will be your best aid, (in the acquisition of heavenly bliss.)

Verse: அருள்சேர்ந்த	நெஞ்சினார்க்	கில்லை	இருள்சேர்ந்த			இன்னா	உலகம்	புகல்.
Translation: Translation :They in whose breast a 'gracious kindliness' resides, See not the gruesome world, where darkness drear abides.
Explanation: Explanation :They will never enter the world of darkness and wretchedness whose minds are the abode of kindness.

Verse: மன்னுயிர்	ஓம்பி	அருளாள்வார்க்கு	இல்லென்ப			தன்னுயிர்	அஞ்சும்	வினை.
Translation: Translation :Who for undying souls of men provides with gracious zeal, In his own soul the dreaded guilt of sin shall never feel.
Explanation: Explanation :(The wise) say that the evils, which his soul would dread, will never come upon the man who exercises kindness and protects the life (of other creatures)

Verse: அல்லல்	அருளாள்வார்க்கு	இல்லை	வளிவழங்கும்			மல்லன்மா	ஞாலங்	கரி.
Translation: Translation :The teeming earth's vast realm, round which the wild winds blow, Is witness, men of 'grace' no woeful want shall know.
Explanation: Explanation :This great rich earth over which the wind blows, is a witness that sorrow never comes upon the kind-hearted.

Verse: பொருள்நீங்கிப்	பொச்சாந்தார்	என்பர்	அருள்நீங்கி			அல்லவை	செய்தொழுகு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Gain of true wealth oblivious they eschew, Who 'grace' forsake, and graceless actions do.
Explanation: Explanation :(The wise) say that those who neglect kindness and practise cruelties, neglected virtue (in their former birth), and forgot (the sorrows which they must suffer.)

Verse: அருளில்லார்க்கு	அவ்வுலகம்	இல்லை	பொருளில்லார்க்கு			இவ்வுலகம்	இல்லாகி	யாங்கு.
Translation: Translation :As to impoverished men this present world is not; The 'graceless' in you world have neither part nor lot.
Explanation: Explanation :As this world is not for those who are without wealth, so that world is not for those who are without kindness.

Verse: பொருளற்றார்	பூப்பர்	ஒருகால்	அருளற்றார்			அற்றார்மற்	றாதல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Who lose the flower of wealth, when seasons change, again may bloom; Who lose 'benevolence', lose all; nothing can change their doom.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who are without wealth may, at some future time, become prosperous; those who are destitute of kindness are utterly destitute; for them there is no change.

Verse: தெருளாதான்	மெய்ப்பொருள்	கண்டற்றால்	தேரின்			அருளாதான்	செய்யும்	அறம்.
Translation: Translation :When souls unwise true wisdom's mystic vision see, The 'graceless' man may work true works of charity.
Explanation: Explanation :If you consider, the virtue of him who is without kindness is like the perception of the true being by him who is without wisdom.

Verse: வலியார்முன்	தன்னை	நினைக்கதான்	தன்னின்			மெலியார்மேல்	செல்லு	மிடத்து.
Translation: Translation :When weaker men you front with threat'ning brow, Think how you felt in presence of some stronger foe.
Explanation: Explanation :When a man is about to rush upon those who are weaker than himself, let him remember how he has stood (trembling) before those who are stronger than himself.

Verse: தன்னூன்	பெருக்கற்குத்	தான்பிறிது	ஊனுண்பான்			எங்ஙனம்	ஆளும்	அருள்.
Translation: Translation :How can the wont of 'kindly grace' to him be known, Who other creatures' flesh consumes to feed his own?
Explanation: Explanation :How can he be possessed of kindness, who to increase his own flesh, eats the flesh of other creatures.

Verse: பொருளாட்சி	போற்றாதார்க்கு	இல்லை	அருளாட்சி			ஆங்கில்லை	ஊன்தின்	பவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :No use of wealth have they who guard not their estate; No use of grace have they with flesh who hunger sate.
Explanation: Explanation :As those possess no property who do not take care of it, so those possess no kindness who feed on flesh.

Verse: படைகொண்டார்	நெஞ்சம்போல்	நன்னூக்காது	ஒன்றன்			உடல்சுவை	உண்டார்	மனம்.
Translation: Translation :Like heart of them that murderous weapons bear, his mind, Who eats of savoury meat, no joy in good can find.
Explanation: Explanation :Like the (murderous) mind of him who carries a weapon (in his hand), the mind of him who feasts with pleasure on the body of another (creature), has no regard for goodness.

Verse: ருளல்லது	யாதெனின்	கொல்லாமை	கோறல்			பொருளல்லது	அவ்வூன்	தினல்.
Translation: Translation :'What's grace, or lack of grace'? 'To kill' is this, that 'not to kill'; To eat dead flesh can never worthy end fulfil.
Explanation: Explanation :If it be asked what is kindness and what its opposite, the answer would be preservation and destruction of life; and therefore it is not right to feed on the flesh (obtained by taking away life).

Verse: உண்ணாமை	உள்ளது	உயிர்நிலை	ஊனுண்ண			அண்ணாத்தல்	செய்யாது	அளறு.
Translation: Translation :If flesh you eat not, life's abodes unharmed remain; Who eats, hell swallows him, and renders not again.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to eat flesh contributes to the continuance of life; therefore if a man eat flesh, hell will not open its mouth (to let him escape out, after he has once fallen in).

Verse: தினற்பொருட்டால்	கொல்லாது	உலகெனின்	யாரும்			விலைப்பொருட்டால்	ஊன்றருவா	ரில்.
Translation: Translation :'We eat the slain,' you say, by us no living creatures die; Who'd kill and sell, I pray, if none came there the flesh to buy?
Explanation: Explanation :If the world does not destroy life for the purpose of eating, then no one would sell flesh for the sake of money.

Verse: உண்ணாமை	வேண்டும்	புலாஅல்	பிறிதொன்றன்			புண்ணது	உணர்வார்ப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :With other beings' ulcerous wounds their hunger they appease; If this they felt, desire to eat must surely cease.
Explanation: Explanation :If men should come to know that flesh is nothing but the unclean ulcer of a body, let them abstain from eating it.

Verse: செயிரின்	தலைப்பிரிந்த	காட்சியார்	உண்ணார்			உயிரின்	தலைப்பிரிந்த	ஊன்.
Translation: Translation :Whose souls the vision pure and passionless perceive, Eat not the bodies men of life bereave.
Explanation: Explanation :The wise, who have freed themselves from mental delusion, will not eat the flesh which has been severed from an animal.

Verse: அவிசொரிந்	தாயிரம்	வேட்டலின்	ஒன்றன்			உயிர்செகுத்	துண்ணாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Than thousand rich oblations, with libations rare, Better the flesh of slaughtered beings not to share.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to kill and eat (the flesh of) an animal, is better than the pouring forth of ghee etc., in a thousand sacrifices.

Verse: கொல்லான்	புலாலை	மறுத்தானைக்	கைகூப்பி			எல்லா	உயிருந்	தொழும்.
Translation: Translation :Who slays nought,- flesh rejects- his feet before All living things with clasped hands adore.
Explanation: Explanation :All creatures will join their hands together, and worship him who has never taken away life, nor eaten flesh.

Verse: உற்றநோய்	நோன்றல்	உயிர்க்குறுகண்	செய்யாமை			அற்றே	தவத்திற்	குரு.
Translation: Translation :To bear due penitential pains, while no offence He causes others, is the type of 'penitence'.
Explanation: Explanation :The nature of religious discipline consists, in the endurance (by the ascetic) of the sufferings which it brings on himself, and in abstaining from giving pain to others.

Verse: தவமும்	தவமுடையார்க்கு	ஆகும்	அதனை			அஃதிலார்	மேற்கொள்	வது.
Translation: Translation :To 'penitents' sincere avails their 'penitence'; Where that is not, 'tis but a vain pretence.
Explanation: Explanation :Austerities can only be borne, and their benefits enjoyed, by those who have practised them (in a former birth); it will be useless for those who have not done so, to attempt to practise them (now).

Verse: துறந்தார்க்குத்	துப்புரவு	வேண்டி	மறந்தார்கொல்			மற்றை	யவர்கள்	தவம்.
Translation: Translation :Have other men forgotten 'penitence' who strive To earn for penitents the things by which they live?
Explanation: Explanation :It is to provide food etc, for the ascetics who have abandoned (the desire of earthly possessions) that other persons have forgotten (to practise) austerity ?

Verse: ஒன்னார்த்	தெறலும்	உவந்தாரை	ஆக்கலும்			எண்ணின்	தவத்தான்	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :Destruction to his foes, to friends increase of joy. The 'penitent' can cause, if this his thoughts employ.
Explanation: Explanation :If (the ascetic) desire the destruction of his enemies, or the aggrandizement of his friends, it will be effected by (the power of) his austerities.

Verse: வேண்டிய	வேண்டியாங்	கெய்தலால்	செய்தவம்			ஈண்டு	முயலப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :That what they wish may, as they wish, be won, By men on earth are works of painful 'penance' done.
Explanation: Explanation :Religious dislipline is practised in this world, because it secures the attainment of whatever one may wish to enjoy (in the world to come).

Verse: தவஞ்செய்வார்	தங்கருமஞ்	செய்வார்மற்	றல்லார்			அவஞ்செய்வார்	ஆசையுட்	பட்டு.
Translation: Translation :Who works of 'penance' do, their end attain, Others in passion's net enshared, toil but in vain.
Explanation: Explanation :Those discharge their duty who perform austerities; all others accomplish their own destruction, through the entanglement of the desire (of riches and sensual pleasure).

Verse: சுடச்சுடரும்	பொன்போல்	ஒளிவிடும்	துன்பஞ்			சுடச்சுட	நோற்கிற்	பவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :The hotter glows the fining fire, the gold the brighter shines; The pain of penitence, like fire, the soul of man refines.
Explanation: Explanation :Just as gold is purified as heated in the fire, will those shine, who have endured the burning of pain (in frequent austerities).

Verse: தன்னுயிர்	தான்அறப்	பெற்றானை	ஏனைய			மன்னுயி	ரெல்லாந்	தொழும்.
Translation: Translation :Who gains himself in utter self-control, Him worships every other living soul.
Explanation: Explanation :All other creatures will worship him who has attained the control of his own soul.

Verse: கூற்றம்	குதித்தலும்	கைகூடும்	நோற்றலின்			ஆற்றல்	தலைப்பட்	டவர்க்குல்.
Translation: Translation :E'en over death the victory he may gain, If power by penance won his soul obtain.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have attained the power which religious discipline confers, will be able also to pass the limit of Yama, (the God of death).

Verse: இலர்பல	ராகிய	காரணம்	நோற்பார்			சிலர்பலர்	நோலா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :The many all things lack! The cause is plain, The 'penitents' are few. The many shun such pain.
Explanation: Explanation :Because there are few who practise austerity and many who do not, there are many destitute and few rich in this world.

Verse: வஞ்ச	மனத்தான்	படிற்றொழுக்கம்	பூதங்கள்			ஐந்தும்	அகத்தே	நகும்.
Translation: Translation :Who with deceitful mind in false way walks of covert sin, The five-fold elements his frame compose, decide within.
Explanation: Explanation :The five elements (of his body) will laugh within him at the feigned conduct of the deceitful minded man.

Verse: வானுயர்	தோற்றம்	எவன்செய்யும்	தன்னெஞ்சம்			தான்அறி	குற்றப்	படின்.
Translation: Translation :What gain, though virtue's semblance high as heaven his fame exalt, If heart dies down through sense of self-detected fault?
Explanation: Explanation :What avails an appearance (of sanctity) high as heaven, if his mind suffers (the indulgence) of conscious sin.

Verse: வலியில்	நிலைமையான்	வல்லுருவம்	பெற்றம்			புலியின்தோல்	போர்த்துமேய்ந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :As if a steer should graze wrapped round with tiger's skin, Is show of virtuous might when weakness lurks within.
Explanation: Explanation :The assumed appearance of power, by a man who has no power (to restrain his senses and perform austerity), is like a cow feeding on grass covered with a tiger's skin.

Verse: தவமறைந்து	அல்லவை	செய்தல்	புதல்மறைந்து			வேட்டுவன்	புள்சிமிழ்த்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :'Tis as a fowler, silly birds to snare, in thicket lurks. When, clad in stern ascetic garb, one secret evil works.
Explanation: Explanation :He who hides himself under the mask of an ascetic and commits sins, like a sportsman who conceals himself in the thicket to catch birds.

Verse: பற்றற்றேம்	என்பார்	படிற்றொழுக்கம்	எற்றெற்றென்று			ஏதம்	பலவுந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :'Our souls are free,' who say, yet practise evil secretly, 'What folly have we wrought!' by many shames o'er-whelmed, shall cry.
Explanation: Explanation :The false conduct of those who say they have renounced all desire will one day bring them sorrows that will make them cry out, "Oh! what have we done, what have we done."

Verse: நெஞ்சின்	துறவார்	துறந்தார்போல்	வஞ்சித்து			வாழ்வாரின்	வன்கணார்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :In mind renouncing nought, in speech renouncing every tie, Who guileful live,- no men are found than these of 'harder eye'.
Explanation: Explanation :Amongst living men there are none so hard-hearted as those who without to saking (desire) in their heart, falsely take the appearance of those who have forsaken (it).

Verse: புறங்குன்றி	கண்டனைய	ரேனும்	அகங்குன்றி			முக்கிற்	கரியார்	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Outward, they shine as 'kunri' berry's scarlet bright; Inward, like tip of 'kunri' bead, as black as night.
Explanation: Explanation :(The world) contains persons whose outside appears (as fair) as the (red) berry of the Abrus, but whose inside is as black as the nose of that berry.

Verse: மனத்தது	மாசாக	மாண்டார்	நீராடி			மறைந்தொழுகு	மாந்தர்	பலர்.
Translation: Translation :Many wash in hollowed waters, living lives of hidden shame; Foul in heart, yet high upraised of men in virtuous fame.
Explanation: Explanation :There are many men of masked conduct, who perform their ablutions, and (make a show) of greatness, while their mind is defiled (with guilt).

Verse: கணைகொடிது	யாழ்கோடு	செவ்விதுஆங்	கன்ன			வினைபடு	பாலால்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Cruel is the arrow straight, the crooked lute is sweet, Judge by their deeds the many forms of men you meet.
Explanation: Explanation :As, in its use, the arrow is crooked, and the curved lute is straight, so by their deeds, (and not by their appearance) let (the uprightness or crookedness of) men be estimated.

Verse: மழித்தலும்	நீட்டலும்	வேண்டா	உலகம்			பழித்தது	ஒழித்து	விடின்.
Translation: Translation :What's the worth of shaven head or tresses long, If you shun what all the world condemns as wrong?
Explanation: Explanation :There is no need of a shaven crown, nor of tangled hair, if a man abstain from those deeds which the wise have condemned.

Verse: எள்ளாமை	வேண்டுவான்	என்பான்	எனைத்தொன்றும்			கள்ளாமை	காக்கதன்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :Who seeks heaven's joys, from impious levity secure, Let him from every fraud preserve his spirit pure.
Explanation: Explanation :Let him, who desires not to be despised, keep his mind from (the desire of) defrauding another of the smallest thing.

Verse: உள்ளத்தால்	உள்ளலும்	தீதே	பிறன்பொருளைக்			கள்ளத்தால்	கள்வேம்	எனல்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis sin if in the mind man but thought conceive; 'By fraud I will my neighbour of his wealth bereave.'
Explanation: Explanation :Even the thought (of sin) is sin; think not then of crafiily stealing the property of another.

Verse: களவினால்	ஆகிய	ஆக்கம்	அளவிறந்து			ஆவது	போலக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :The gain that comes by fraud, although it seems to grow With limitless increase, to ruin swift shall go.
Explanation: Explanation :The property, which is acquired by fraud, will entirely perish, even while it seems to increase.

Verse: களவின்கண்	கன்றிய	காதல்	விளைவின்கண்			வீயா	விழுமம்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :The lust inveterate of fraudful gain, Yields as its fruit undying pain.
Explanation: Explanation :The eager desire of defrauding others will, when it brings forth its fruit, produce undying sorrow.

Verse: அருள்கருதி	அன்புடைய	ராதல்	பொருள்கருதிப்			பொச்சாப்புப்	பார்ப்பார்கண்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :'Grace' is not in their thoughts, nor know they kind affection's power, Who neighbour's goods desire, and watch for his unguarded hour.
Explanation: Explanation :The study of kindness and the exercise of benevolence is not with those who watch for another's forgetfulness, though desire of his property.

Verse: அளவின்கண்	நின்றொழுகல்	ஆற்றார்	களவின்கண்			கன்றிய	காத	லவர்.
Translation: Translation :They cannot walk restrained in wisdom's measured bound, In whom inveterate lust of fraudful gain is found.
Explanation: Explanation :They cannot walk steadfastly, according to rule, who eagerly desire to defraud others.

Verse: களவென்னும்	காரறி	வாண்மை	அளவென்னும்			ஆற்றல்	புரிந்தார்கண்ட	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Practice of fraud's dark cunning arts they shun, Who long for power by 'measured wisdom' won.
Explanation: Explanation :That black-knowledge which is called fraud, is not in those who desire that greatness which is called rectitude.

Verse: அளவற஧ந்தார்	நெஞ்சத்	தறம்போல	நிற்கும்			களவறிந்தார்	நெஞ்சில்	கரவு.
Translation: Translation :As virtue dwells in heart that 'measured wisdom' gains; Deceit in hearts of fraudful men established reigns.
Explanation: Explanation :Deceit dwells in the mind of those who are conversant with fraud, even as virtue in the minds of those who are conversant with rectitude.

Verse: அளவல்ல	செய்தாங்கே	வீவர்	களவல்ல			மற்றைய	தேற்றா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who have no lore save that which fraudful arts supply, Acts of unmeasured vice committing straightway die.
Explanation: Explanation :Those, who are acquainted with nothing but fraud, will perish in the very commission of transgression.

Verse: கள்வார்க்குத்	தள்ளும்	உயிர்நிலை	கள்வார்க்குத்			தள்ளாது	புத்தே	ளுளகு.
Translation: Translation :The fraudful forfeit life and being here below; Who fraud eschew the bliss of heavenly beings know.
Explanation: Explanation :Even their body will fail the fraudulent; but even the world of the gods will not fail those who are free from fraud.

Verse: வாய்மை	எனப்படுவது	யாதெனின்	யாதொன்றும்			தீமை	இலாத	சொலல்.
Translation: Translation :You ask, in lips of men what 'truth' may be; 'Tis speech from every taint of evil free.
Explanation: Explanation :Truth is the speaking of such words as are free from the least degree of evil (to others).

Verse: பொய்மையும்	வாய்மை	யிடத்த	புரைதீர்ந்த			நன்மை	பயக்கும்	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :Falsehood may take the place of truthful word, If blessing, free from fault, it can afford.
Explanation: Explanation :Even falsehood has the nature of truth, if it confer a benefit that is free from fault.

Verse: தன்நெஞ்	சறிவது	பொய்யற்க	பொய்த்தபின்			தன்நெஞ்சே	தன்னைச்	சுடும்.
Translation: Translation :Speak not a word which false thy own heart knows Self-kindled fire within the false one's spirit glows.
Explanation: Explanation :Let not a man knowingly tell a lie; for after he has told the lie, his mind will burn him (with the memory of his guilt).

Verse: உள்ளத்தாற்	பொய்யா	தொழுகின்	உலகத்தார்			உள்ளத்து	ளெல்லாம்	உளன்.
Translation: Translation :True to his inmost soul who lives,- enshrined He lives in souls of all mankind.
Explanation: Explanation :He who, in his conduct, preserves a mind free from deceit, will dwell in the minds of all men.

Verse: மனத்தொடு	வாய்மை	மொழியின்	தவத்தொடு			தானஞ்செய்	வாரின்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Greater is he who speaks the truth with full consenting mind. Than men whose lives have penitence and charity combined.
Explanation: Explanation :He, who speaks truth with all his heart, is superior to those who make gifts and practise austerities.

Verse: பொய்யாமை	அன்ன	புகழில்லை	எய்யாமை			எல்லா	அறமுந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :No praise like that of words from falsehood free; This every virtue yields spontaneously.
Explanation: Explanation :There is no praise like the praise of never uttering a falsehood: without causing any suffering, it will lead to every virtue.

Verse: பொய்யாமை	பொய்யாமை	ஆற்றின்	அறம்பிற			செய்யாமை	செய்யாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :If all your life be utter truth, the truth alone, 'Tis well, though other virtuous acts be left undone.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man has the power to abstain from falsehood, it will be well with him, even though he practise no other virtue.

Verse: புறள்தூய்மை	நீரான்	அமையும்	அகந்தூய்மை			வாய்மையால்	காணப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Outward purity the water will bestow; Inward purity from truth alone will flow.
Explanation: Explanation :Purity of body is produced by water and purity of mind by truthfulness.

Verse: எல்லா	விளக்கும்	விளக்கல்ல	சான்றோர்க்குப்			பொய்யா	விளக்கே	விளக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Every lamp is not a lamp in wise men's sight; That's the lamp with truth's pure radiance bright.
Explanation: Explanation :All lamps of nature are not lamps; the lamp of truth is the lamp of the wise.

Verse: யாமெய்யாக்	கண்டவற்றுள்	இல்லை	எனைத்தொன்றும்			வாய்மையின்	நல்ல	பிற.
Translation: Translation :Of all good things we've scanned with studious care, There's nought that can with truthfulness compare.
Explanation: Explanation :Amidst all that we have seen (described) as real (excellence), there is nothing so good as truthfulness.

Verse: செல்லிடத்துக்	காப்பான்	சினங்காப்பான்	அல்லிடத்துக்			காக்கின்என்	காவாக்கா
Translation: Translation :Where thou hast power thy angry will to work, thy wrath restrain; Where power is none, what matter if thou check or give it rein?
Explanation: Explanation :He restrains his anger who restrains it when it can injure; when it cannot injure, what does it matter whether he restrain it, or not ?

Verse: செல்லா	இடத்துச்	சினந்தீது	செல்லிடத்தும்			இல்அதனின்	தீய	பிற.
Translation: Translation :Where power is none to wreak thy wrath, wrath importent is ill; Where thou hast power thy will to work, 'tis greater, evil still.
Explanation: Explanation :Anger is bad, even when it cannot injure; when it can injure; there is no greater evil.

Verse: மறத்தல்	வெகுளியை	யார்மாட்டும்	தீய			பிறத்தல்	அதனான்	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :If any rouse thy wrath, the trespass straight forget; For wrath an endless train of evils will beget.
Explanation: Explanation :Forget anger towards every one, as fountains of evil spring from it.

Verse: நகையும்	உவகையும்	கொல்லும்	சினத்தின்			பகையும்	உளவோ	பிற.
Translation: Translation :Wrath robs the face of smiles, the heart of joy, What other foe to man works such annoy?
Explanation: Explanation :Is there a greater enemy than anger, which kills both laughter and joy ?

Verse: தன்னைத்தான்	காக்கின்	சினங்காக்க	காவாக்கால்			தன்னையே	கொல்லுஞ்	சினம்.
Translation: Translation :If thou would'st guard thyself, guard against wrath alway; 'Gainst wrath who guards not, him his wrath shall slay.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man would guard himself, let him guard against anger; if he do not guard it, anger will kill him.

Verse: சினமென்னும்	சேர்ந்தாரைக்	கொல்லி	இனமென்னும்			ஏமப்	புணையைச்	சுடும்.
Translation: Translation :Wrath, the fire that slayeth whose draweth near, Will burn the helpful 'raft' of kindred dear.
Explanation: Explanation :The fire of anger will burn up even the pleasant raft of friendship.

Verse: சினத்தைப்	பொருளென்று	கொண்டவன்	கேடு			நிலத்தறைந்தான்	கைபிழையா	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :The hand that smites the earth unfailing feels the sting; So perish they who nurse their wrath as noble thing.
Explanation: Explanation :Destruction will come upon him who ragards anger as a good thing, as surely as the hand of him who strikes the ground will not fail.

Verse: இணர்எரி	தோய்வன்ன	இன்னா	செயினும்			புணரின்	வெகுளாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Though men should work thee woe, like touch of tongues of fire. 'Tis well if thou canst save thy soul from burning ire.
Explanation: Explanation :Though one commit things against you as painful (to bear) as if a bundle of fire had been thrust upon you, it will be well, to refrain, if possible, from anger.

Verse: உள்ளிய	தெல்லாம்	உடனெய்தும்	உள்ளத்தால்			உள்ளான்	வெகுளி	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :If man his soul preserve from wrathful fires, He gains with that whate'er his soul desires.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man never indulges anger in his heart, he will at once obtain whatever he has thought of.

Verse: இறந்தார்	இறந்தார்	அனையர்	சினத்தைத்			துறந்தார்	துறந்தார்	துணை.
Translation: Translation :Men of surpassing wrath are like the men who've passed away; Who wrath renounce, equals of all-renouncing sages they.
Explanation: Explanation :Those, who give way to excessive anger, are no better than dead men; but those, who are freed from it, are equal to those who are freed (from death).

Verse: சிறப்பீனும்	செல்வம்	பெறினும்	பிறர்க்குஇன்னா			செய்யாமை	மாசற்றார்	கோள்.
Translation: Translation :Though ill to neighbour wrought should glorious pride of wealth secure, No ill to do is fixed decree of men in spirit pure.
Explanation: Explanation :It is the determination of the spotless not to cause sorrow to others, although they could (by so causing) obtain the wealth which confers greatness.

Verse: கறுத்துஇன்னா	செய்தவக்	கண்ணும்	மறுத்தின்னா			செய்யாமை	மாசற்றார்	கோள்.
Translation: Translation :Though malice work its worst, planning no ill return, to endure, And work no ill, is fixed decree of men in spirit pure.
Explanation: Explanation :It is the determination of the spotless not to do evil, even in return, to those who have cherished enmity and done them evil.

Verse: செய்யாமல்	செற்றார்க்கும்	இன்னாத	செய்தபின்			உய்யா	விழுமந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Though unprovoked thy soul malicious foes should sting, Retaliation wrought inevitable woes will bring.
Explanation: Explanation :In an ascetic inflict suffering even on those who hate him, when he has not done them any evil, it will afterwards give him irretrievable sorrow.

Verse: இன்னாசெய்	தாரை	ஒறுத்தல்	அவர்நாண			நன்னயஞ்	செய்து	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :To punish wrong, with kindly benefits the doers ply; Thus shame their souls; but pass the ill unheeded by.
Explanation: Explanation :The (proper) punishment to those who have done evil (to you), is to put them to shame by showing them kindness, in return and to forget both the evil and the good done on both sides.

Verse: அறிவினான்	ஆகுவ	துண்டோ	பிறிதின்நோய்			தந்நோய்போல்	போற்றாக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :From wisdom's vaunted lore what doth the learner gain, If as his own he guard not others' souls from pain?
Explanation: Explanation :What benefit has he derived from his knowledge, who does not endeavour to keep off pain from another as much as from himself ?

Verse: இன்னா	எனத்தான்	உணர்ந்தவை	துன்னாமை			வேண்டும்	பிறன்கண்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :What his own soul has felt as bitter pain, From making others feel should man abstain.
Explanation: Explanation :Let not a man consent to do those things to another which, he knows, will cause sorrow.

Verse: எனைத்தானும்	எஞ்ஞான்றும்	யார்க்கும்	மனத்தானாம்			மாணாசெய்	யாமை	தலை.
Translation: Translation :To work no wilful woe, in any wise, through all the days, To any living soul, is virtue's highest praise.
Explanation: Explanation :It is the chief of all virtues not knowingly to do any person evil, even in the lowest degree, and at any time.

Verse: தன்னுயிர்ககு	ஏன்னாமை	தானறிவான்	என்கொலோ			மன்னுயிர்க்கு	இன்னா	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Whose soul has felt the bitter smart of wrong, how can He wrongs inflict on ever-living soul of man?
Explanation: Explanation :Why does a man inflict upon other creatures those sufferings, which he has found by experience are sufferings to himself ?

Verse: பிறர்க்கின்னா	முற்பகல்	செய்யின்	தமக்குஇன்னா			பிற்பகல்	தாமே	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :If, ere the noontide, you to others evil do, Before the eventide will evil visit you.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man inflict sorrow upon others in the morning, it will come upon him unsought in the very evening.

Verse: நோயெல்லாம்	நோய்செய்தார்	மேலவாம்	நோய்செய்யார்			நோயின்மை	வேண்டு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :O'er every evil-doer evil broodeth still; He evil shuns who freedom seeks from ill.
Explanation: Explanation :Sorrow will come upon those who cause pain to others; therfore those, who desire to be free from sorrow, give no pain to others.

Verse: அறவினை	யாதெனின்	கொல்லாமை	கோறல்			பிறவினை	எல்லாந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :What is the work of virtue? 'Not to kill'; For 'killing' leads to every work of ill.
Explanation: Explanation :Never to destroy life is the sum of all virtuous conduct. The destruction of life leads to every evil.

Verse: பகுத்துண்டு	பல்லுயிர்	ஓம்புதல்	நூலோர்			தொகுத்தவற்றுள்	எல்லாந்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Let those that need partake your meal; guard every-thing that lives; This the chief and sum of lore that hoarded wisdom gives.
Explanation: Explanation :The chief of all (the virtues) which authors have summed up, is the partaking of food that has been shared with others, and the preservation of the mainfold life of other creatures.

Verse: ஒன்றாக	நல்லது	கொல்லாமை	மற்றதன்			பின்சாரப்	பொய்யாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Alone, first of goods things, is 'not to slay'; The second is, no untrue word to say.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to destroy life is an incomparably (great) good next to it in goodness ranks freedom from falsehood.

Verse: நல்லாறு	எனப்படுவது	யாதெனின்	யாதொன்றும்			கொல்லாமை	சூழும்	நெறி.
Translation: Translation :You ask, What is the good and perfect way? 'Tis path of him who studies nought to slay.
Explanation: Explanation :Good path is that which considers how it may avoid killing any creature.

Verse: நிலைஅஞ்சி	நீத்தாருள்	எல்லாம்	கொலைஅஞ்சிக்			கொல்லாமை	சூழ்வான்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Of those who 'being' dread, and all renounce, the chief are they, Who dreading crime of slaughter, study nought to slay.
Explanation: Explanation :Of all those who, fearing the permanence of earthly births, have abandoned desire, he is the chief who, fearing (the guilt of) murder, considers how he may avoid the destruction of life.

Verse: கொல்லாமை	மேற்கொண்	டொழுகுவான்	வாழ்நாள்மேல்			செல்லாது	உயிருண்ணுங்	கூற்று.
Translation: Translation :Ev'n death that life devours, their happy days shall spare, Who law, 'Thou shall not kill', uphold with reverent care.
Explanation: Explanation :Yama, the destroyer of life, will not attack the life of him, who acts under the determination of never destroying life.

Verse: தன்னுயிர்	நீப்பினும்	செய்யற்க	தான்பிறிது			இன்னுயிர்	நீக்கும்	வினை.
Translation: Translation :Though thine own life for that spared life the price must pay, Take not from aught that lives gift of sweet life away.
Explanation: Explanation :Let no one do that which would destroy the life of another, although he should by so doing, lose his own life.

Verse: நன்றாகும்	ஆக்கம்	பெரிதெனினும்	சான்றோர்க்குக்			கொன்றாகும்	ஆக்கங்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :Though great the gain of good should seem, the wise Will any gain by staughter won despise.
Explanation: Explanation :The advantage which might flow from destroying life in sacrifice, is dishonourable to the wise (who renounced the world), even although it should be said to be productive of great good.

Verse: கொலைவினைய	ராகிய	மாக்கள்	புலைவினையர்			புன்மை	தெரிவா	ரகத்து.
Translation: Translation :Whose trade is 'killing', always vile they show, To minds of them who what is vileness know.
Explanation: Explanation :Men who destroy life are base men, in the estimation of those who know the nature of meanness.

Verse: உயிர்	உடம்பின்	நீக்கியார்	என்ப			செயிர்	உடம்பின்	செல்லாத்தீ	வாழ்க்கை			யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who lead a loathed life in bodies sorely pained, Are men, the wise declare, by guilt of slaughter stained.
Explanation: Explanation :(The wise) will say that men of diseased bodies, who live in degradation and in poverty, are those who separated the life from the body of animals (in a former birth).

Verse: நில்லாத	வற்றை	நிலையின	என்றுணரும்			புல்லறி	வாண்மை	கடை.
Translation: Translation :Lowest and meanest lore, that bids men trust secure, In things that pass away, as things that shall endure!
Explanation: Explanation :That ignorance which considers those things to be stable which are not so, is dishonourable (to the wise).

Verse: கூத்தாட்டு	அவைக்குழாத்	தற்றே	பெருஞ்செல்வம்			போக்கும்	அதுவிளிந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :As crowds round dancers fill the hall, is wealth's increase; Its loss, as throngs dispersing, when the dances cease.
Explanation: Explanation :The acquisition of wealth is like the gathering together of an assembly for a theatre; its expenditure is like the breaking up of that assembly.

Verse: அற்கா	இயல்பிற்றுச்	செல்வம்	அதுபெற்றால்			அற்குப	ஆங்கே	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Unenduring is all wealth; if you wealth enjoy, Enduring works in working wealth straightway employ.
Explanation: Explanation :Wealth is perishable; let those who obtain it immediately practise those (virtues) which are imperishable.

Verse: நாளென	ஒன்றுபோற்	காட்டி	உயிர்ஈரும்			வாளது	உணர்வார்ப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :As 'day' it vaunts itself; well understood, 'tis knife', That daily cuts away a portion from thy life.
Explanation: Explanation :Time, which shows itself (to the ignorant) as if it were something (real) is in the estimation of the wise (only) a saw which cuts down life.

Verse: நாச்செற்று	விக்குள்மேல்	வாராமுன்	நல்வினை			மேற்சென்று	செய்யப்	படும்
Translation: Translation :Before the tongue lie powerless, 'mid the gasp of gurgling breath, Arouse thyself, and do good deeds beyond the power of death.
Explanation: Explanation :Let virtuous deeds be done quickly, before the biccup comes making the tongue silent.

Verse: நெருநல்	உளனொருவன்	இன்றில்லை	என்னும்			பெருமை	உடைத்துஇவ்	வுலகு.
Translation: Translation :Existing yesterday, today to nothing hurled!- Such greatness owns this transitory world.
Explanation: Explanation :This world possesses the greatness that one who yesterday was is not today.

Verse: ஒருபொழுதும்	வாழ்வது	அறியார்	கருதுப			கோடியும்	அல்ல	பல.
Translation: Translation :Who know not if their happy lives shall last the day, In fancies infinite beguile the hours away!
Explanation: Explanation :Innumerable are the thoughts which occupy the mind of (the unwise), who know not that they shall live another moment.

Verse: குடம்பை	தனித்துஒழியப்	புள்பறந்	தற்றே			உடம்பொடு	உயிரிடை	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Birds fly away, and leave the nest deserted bare; Such is the short-lived friendship soul and body share.
Explanation: Explanation :The love of the soul to the body is like (the love of) a bird to its egg which it flies away from and leaves empty.

Verse: உறங்கு	வதுபோலுஞ்	சாக்காடு	உறங்கி			விழிப்பது	போலும்	பிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :Death is sinking into slumbers deep; Birth again is waking out of sleep.
Explanation: Explanation :Death is like sleep; birth is like awaking from it.

Verse: புக்கில்	அமைந்தின்று	கொல்லோ	உடம்பினுள்			துச்சில்	இருந்த	உயிர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :The soul in fragile shed as lodger courts repose:- Is it because no home's conclusive rest it knows?
Explanation: Explanation :It seems as if the soul, which takes a temporary shelter in a body, had not attained a home.

Verse: யாதனின்	யாதனின்	நீங்கியான்	நோதல்			அதனின்	அதனின்	இலன்.
Translation: Translation :From whatever, aye, whatever, man gets free, From what, aye, from that, no more of pain hath he!
Explanation: Explanation :Whatever thing, a man has renounced, by that thing; he cannot suffer pain.

Verse: வேண்டின்உண்	டாகத்	துறக்க	துறந்தபின்			ஈண்டுஇயற்	பால	பல.
Translation: Translation :'Renunciation' made- ev'n here true pleasures men acquire; 'Renounce' while time is yet, if to those pleasures you aspire.
Explanation: Explanation :After a man has renounced (all things), there will still be many things in this world (which he may enjoy); if he should desire them, let him, while it is time abandon. (the world).

Verse: அடல்வேண்டும்	ஐந்தன்	புலத்தை	விடல்வேண்டும்			வேண்டிய	வெல்லாம்	ஒருங்கு.
Translation: Translation :'Perceptions of the five' must all expire;- Relinquished in its order each desire
Explanation: Explanation :Let the five senses be destroyed; and at the same time, let everything be abandoned that (the ascetic) has (formerly) desired.

Verse: இயல்பாகும்	நோன்பிற்கொன்று	இன்மை	உடைமை			மயலாகும்	மற்றும்	பெயர்த்து.
Translation: Translation :'Privation absolute' is penance true; 'Possession' brings bewilderment anew.
Explanation: Explanation :To be altogether destitute is the proper condition of those who perform austerities; if they possess anything, it will change (their resolution) and bring them back to their confused state.

Verse: மற்றும்	தொடர்ப்பாடு	எவன்கொல்	பிறப்பறுக்கல்			உற்றார்க்கு	உடம்பும்	மிகை.
Translation: Translation :To those who sev'rance seek from being's varied strife, Flesh is burthen sore; what then other bonds of life?
Explanation: Explanation :What means the addition of other things those who are attempting to cut off (future) births, when even their body is too much (for them).

Verse: யான்	எனது	என்னும்	செருக்கு			அறுப்பான்	வானோர்க்கு	உயர்ந்த	உலகம்			புகும்.
Translation: Translation :Who kills conceit that utters 'I' and 'mine', Shall enter realms above the powers divine.
Explanation: Explanation :He who destroys the pride which says "I", "mine" will enter a world which is difficult even to the Gods to attain.

Verse: பற்றி	விடாஅ	இடும்பைகள்	பற்றினைப்			பற்றி	விடாஅ	தவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :Who cling to things that cling and eager clasp, Griefs cling to them with unrelaxing grasp.
Explanation: Explanation :Sorrows will never let go their hold of those who give not up their hold of desire.

Verse: தலைப்பட்டார்	தீரத்	துறந்தார்	மயங்கி			வலைப்பட்டார்	மற்றை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who thoroughly 'renounce' on highest height are set; The rest bewildered, lie entangled in the net.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have entirely renounced (all things and all desire) have obtained (absorption into God); all others wander in confusion, entangled in the net of (many) births.

Verse: பற்றற்ற	கண்ணே	பிறப்பறுக்கும்	மற்று			நிலையாமை	காணப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :When that which clings falls off, severed is being's tie; All else will then be seen as instability.
Explanation: Explanation :At the moment in which desire has been abandoned, (other) births will be cut off; when that has not been done, instability will be seen.

Verse: பற்றுக	பற்றற்றான்	பற்றினை	அப்பற்றைப்			பற்றுக	பற்று	விடற்கு.
Translation: Translation :Cling thou to that which He, to Whom nought clings, hath bid thee cling, Cling to that bond, to get thee free from every clinging thing.
Explanation: Explanation :Desire the desire of Him who is without desire; in order to renounce desire, desire that desire.

Verse: பொருளல்ல	வற்றைப்	பொருளென்று	உணரும்			மருளானாம்	மாணாப்	பிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :Of things devoid of truth as real things men deem;- Cause of degraded birth the fond delusive dream!
Explanation: Explanation :Inglorious births are produced by the confusion (of mind) which considers those things to be real which are not real.

Verse: இருள்நீங்கி	இன்பம்	பயக்கும்	மருள்நீங்கி			மாசறு	காட்சி	யவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :Darkness departs, and rapture springs to men who see, The mystic vision pure, from all delusion free.
Explanation: Explanation :A clear, undimmed vision of things will deliver its possessors from the darkness of future births, and confer the felicity (of heaven).

Verse: ஐயத்தின்	நீங்கித்	தெளிந்தார்க்கு	வையத்தின்			வானம்	நணிய	துடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :When doubts disperse, and mists of error roll Away, nearer is heav'n than earth to sage's soul.
Explanation: Explanation :Heaven is nearer than earth to those men of purified minds who are freed from from doubt.

Verse: ஐயுணர்வு	எய்தியக்	கண்ணும்	பயமின்றே			மெய்யுணர்வு	இல்லா	தவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :Five-fold perception gained, what benefits accrue To them whose spirits lack perception of the true?
Explanation: Explanation :Even those who have all the knowledge which can be attained by the five senses, will derive no benefit from it, if they are without a knowledge of the true nature of things.

Verse: எப்பொருள்	எத்தன்மைத்	தாயினும்	அப்பொருள்			மெய்ப்பொருள்	காண்பது	அறிவு.
Translation: Translation :Whatever thing, of whatsoever kind it be, 'Tis wisdom's part in each the very thing to see.
Explanation: Explanation :(True) knowledge is the perception concerning every thing of whatever kind, that that thing is the true thing.

Verse: கற்றீண்டு	மெய்ப்பொருள்	கண்டார்	தலைப்படுவர்			மற்றீண்டு	வாரா	நெறி.
Translation: Translation :Who learn, and here the knowledge of the true obtain, Shall find the path that hither cometh not again.
Explanation: Explanation :They, who in this birth have learned to know the True Being, enter the road which returns not into this world.

Verse: ஓர்த்துள்ளம்	உள்ளது	உணரின்	ஒருதலையாப்			பேர்த்துள்ள	வேண்டா	பிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :The mind that knows with certitude what is, and ponders well, Its thoughts on birth again to other life need not to dwell.
Explanation: Explanation :Let it not be thought that there is another birth for him whose mind having thoroughly considered (all it has been taught) has known the True Being.

Verse: பிறப்பென்னும்	பேதைமை	நீங்கச்	சிறப்பென்னும்			செம்பொருள்	காண்பது	அறிவு.
Translation: Translation :When folly, cause of births, departs; and soul can view The truth of things, man's dignity- 'tis wisdom true.
Explanation: Explanation :True knowledge consists in the removal of ignorance; which is (the cause of) births, and the perception of the True Being who is (the bestower of) heaven.

Verse: சார்புணர்ந்து	சார்பு	கெடஒழுகின்	மற்றழித்துச்			சார்தரா	சார்தரு	நோய்.
Translation: Translation :The true 'support' who knows- rejects 'supports' he sought before- Sorrow that clings all destroys, shall cling to him no more.
Explanation: Explanation :He who so lives as to know Him who is the support of all things and abandon all desire, will be freed from the evils which would otherwise cleave to him and destroy (his efforts after absorption).

Verse: காமம்	வெகுளி	மயக்கம்	இவ்முன்றன்			நாமம்	கெடக்கெடும்	நோய்.
Translation: Translation :When lust and wrath and error's triple tyranny is o'er, Their very names for aye extinct, then pain shall be no more.
Explanation: Explanation :If the very names of these three things, desire, anger, and confusion of mind, be destroyed, then will also perish the evils (which flow from them).

Verse: அவாஎன்ப	எல்லா	உயிர்க்கும்	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			தவாஅப்	பிறப்பீனும்	வித்து.
Translation: Translation :The wise declare, through all the days, to every living thing. That ceaseless round of birth from seed of strong desire doth spring.
Explanation: Explanation :(The wise) say that the seed, which produces unceasing births, at all times, to all creatures, is desire.

Verse: வேண்டுங்கால்	வேண்டும்	பிறவாமை	மற்றது			வேண்டாமை	வேண்ட	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :If desire you feel, freedom from changing birth require! 'I' will come, if you desire to 'scape, set free from all desire.
Explanation: Explanation :If anything be desired, freedom from births should be desired; that (freedom from births) will be attained by desiring to be without desire.

Verse: வேண்டாமை	அன்ன	விழுச்செல்வம்	ஈண்டில்லை			ஆண்டும்	அஃதொப்பது	இல்.
Translation: Translation :No glorious wealth is here like freedom from desire; To bliss like this not even there can soul aspire.
Explanation: Explanation :There is in this world no excellence equal to freedom from desire; and even in that world, there is nothing like it.

Verse: தூஉய்மை	என்பது	அவாவின்மை	மற்றது			வாஅய்மை	வேண்ட	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :Desire's decease as purity men know; That, too, from yearning search for truth will grow.
Explanation: Explanation :Purity (of mind) consists in freedom from desire; and that (freedom from desire) is the fruit of the love of truth.

Verse: அற்றவர்	என்பார்	அவாஅற்றார்	மற்றையார்			அற்றாக	அற்றது	இலர்.
Translation: Translation :Men freed from bonds of strong desire are free; None other share such perfect liberty.
Explanation: Explanation :They are said to be free (from future birth) who are freed from desire; all others (who, whatever else they may be free from, are not freed from desire) are not thus free.

Verse: அஞ்சுவ	தோரும்	அறனே	ஒருவனை			வஞ்சிப்ப	தோரும்	அவா.
Translation: Translation :Desire each soul beguiles; True virtue dreads its wiles.
Explanation: Explanation :It is the chief duty of (an ascetic) to watch against desire with (jealous) fear; for it has power to deceive (and destroy) him.

Verse: அவாவினை	ஆற்ற	அறுப்பின்	தவாவினை			தான்வேண்டு	மாற்றான்	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :Who thoroughly rids his life of passion-prompted deed, Deeds of unfailing worth shall do, which, as he plans, succeed.
Explanation: Explanation :If a man thoroughly cut off all desire, the deeds, which confer immortality, will come to him, in the path in which he seeks them.

Verse: அவாஇல்லார்க்	கில்லாகுந்	துன்பம்	அஃதுண்டேல்			தவாஅது	மேன்மேல்	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :Affliction is not known where no desires abide; Where these are, endless rises sorrow's tide.
Explanation: Explanation :There is no sorrow to those who are without desire; but where that is, (sorrow) will incessantly come, more and more.

Verse: இன்பம்	இடையறா	தீண்டும்	அவாவென்னும்			துன்பத்துள்	துன்பங்	கெடின்.
Translation: Translation :When dies away desire, that woe of woes Ev'n here the soul unceasing rapture knows.
Explanation: Explanation :Even while in this body, joy will never depart (from the mind, in which) desire, that sorrow of sorrows, has been destroyed.

Verse: ஆரா	இயற்கை	அவாநீப்பின்	அந்நிலையே			பேரா	இயற்கை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Drive from thy soul desire insatiate; Straight'way is gained the moveless blissful state.
Explanation: Explanation :The removal of desire, whose nature it is never to be satisfied, will immediately confer a nature that can never be changed.

Verse: ஆகூழால்	தோன்றும்	அசைவின்மை	கைப்பொருள்			போகூழால்	தோன்றும்	மடி.
Translation: Translation :Wealth-giving fate power of unflinching effort brings; From fate that takes away idle remissness springs.
Explanation: Explanation :Perseverance comes from a prosperous fate, and idleness from an adverse fate.

Verse: பேதைப்	படுக்கும்	இழவூழ்	அறிவகற்றும்			ஆகலூழ்	உற்றக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :The fate that loss ordains makes wise men's wisdom foolishness; The fate that gain bestows with ampler powers will wisdom bless.
Explanation: Explanation :An adverse fate produces folly, and a prosperous fate produces enlarged knowledge.

Verse: நுண்ணிய	நூல்பல	கற்பினும்	மற்றுந்தன்			உண்மை	யறிவே	மிகும்.
Translation: Translation :In subtle learning manifold though versed man be, 'The wisdom, truly his, will gain supremacy.
Explanation: Explanation :Although (a man) may study the most polished treatises, the knowledge which fate has decreed to him will still prevail.

Verse: இருவேறு	உலகத்து	இயற்கை	திருவேறு			தெள்ளிய	ராதலும்	வேறு.
Translation: Translation :Two fold the fashion of the world: some live in fortune's light; While other some have souls in wisdom's radiance bright.
Explanation: Explanation :There are (through fate) two different natures in the world, hence the difference (observable in men) in (their acquisition of) wealth, and in their attainment of knowledge.

Verse: நல்லவை	எல்லாஅந்	தீயவாம்	தீயவும்			நல்லவாம்	செல்வம்	செயற்கு.
Translation: Translation :All things that good appear will oft have ill success; All evil things prove good for gain of happiness.
Explanation: Explanation :In the acquisition of property, every thing favourable becomes unfavourable, and (on the other hand) everything unfavourable becomes favourable, (through the power of fate).

Verse: பரியினும்	ஆகாவாம்	பாலல்ல	உய்த்துச்			சொரியினும்	போகா	தம.
Translation: Translation :Things not your own will yield no good, howe'er you guard with pain; Your own, howe'er you scatter them abroad, will yours remain.
Explanation: Explanation :Whatever is not conferred by fate cannot be preserved although it be guarded with most painful care; and that, which fate has made his, cannot be lost, although one should even take it and throw it away.

Verse: வகுத்தான்	வகுத்த	வகையல்லால்	கோடி			தொகுத்தார்க்கு	துய்த்தல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Save as the 'sharer' shares to each in due degree, To those who millions store enjoyment scarce can be.
Explanation: Explanation :Even those who gather together millions will only enjoy them, as it has been determined by the disposer (of all things).

Verse: துறப்பார்மன்	துப்புர	வில்லார்	உறற்பால			ஊட்டா	கழியு	மெனின்.
Translation: Translation :The destitute with ascetics merit share, If fate to visit with predestined ills would spare.
Explanation: Explanation :The destitute will renounce desire (and become ascetics), if (fate) do not make them suffer the hindrances to which they are liable, and they pass away.

Verse: நன்றாங்கால்	நல்லவாக்	காண்பவர்	அன்றாங்கால்			அல்லற்	படுவ	தெவன்.
Translation: Translation :When good things come, men view them all as gain; When evils come, why then should they complain?
Explanation: Explanation :How is it that those, who are pleased with good fortune, trouble themselves when evil comes, (since both are equally the decree of fate) ?

Verse: ஊழிற்	பெருவலி	யாவுள	மற்றொன்று			சூழினுந்	தான்முந்	துறும்.
Translation: Translation :What powers so great as those of Destiny? Man's skill Some other thing contrives; but fate's beforehand still.
Explanation: Explanation :What is stronger than fate ? If we think of an expedient (to avert it), it will itself be with us before (the thought).

Verse: படைகுடி	கூழ்அமைச்சு	நட்பரண்	ஆறும்			உடையான்	அரசருள்	ஏறு.
Translation: Translation :An army, people, wealth, a minister, friends, fort: six things- Who owns them all, a lion lives amid the kings.
Explanation: Explanation :He who possesses these six things, an army, a people, wealth, ministers, friends and a fortress, is a lion among kings.

Verse: அஞ்சாமை	ஈகை	அறிவூக்கம்	இந்நான்கும்			எஞ்சாமை	வேந்தர்க்	கியல்பு.
Translation: Translation :Courage, a liberal hand, wisdom, and energy: these four Are qualities a king adorn for evermore.
Explanation: Explanation :Never to fail in these four things, fearlessness, liberality, wisdom, and energy, is the kingly character.

Verse: தூங்காமை	கல்வி	துணிவுடைமை	இம்மூன்றும்			நீங்கா	நிலனான்	பவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :A sleepless promptitude, knowledge, decision strong: These three for aye to rulers of the land belong.
Explanation: Explanation :These three things, viz., vigilance, learning, and bravery, should never be wanting in the ruler of a country.

Verse: அறனிழுக்கா	தல்லவை	நீக்கி	மறனிழுக்கா			மானம்	உடைய	தரசு.
Translation: Translation :Kingship, in virtue failing not, all vice restrains, In courage failing not, it honour's grace maintains.
Explanation: Explanation :He is a king who, with manly modesty, swerves not from virtue, and refrains from vice.

Verse: இயற்றலும்	ஈட்டலுங்	காத்தலும்	காத்த			வகுத்தலும்	வல்ல	தரசு.
Translation: Translation :A king is he who treasure gains, stores up, defends, And duly for his kingdom's weal expends.
Explanation: Explanation :He is a king who is able to acquire (wealth), to lay it up, to guard, and to distribute it.

Verse: காட்சிக்	கெளியன்	கடுஞ்சொல்லன்	அல்லனேல்			மீக்கூறும்	மன்னன்	நிலம்
Translation: Translation :Where king is easy of access, where no harsh word repels, That land's high praises every subject swells.
Explanation: Explanation :The whole world will exalt the country of the king who is easy of access, and who is free from harsh language.

Verse: இன்சொலால்	ஈத்தளிக்க	வல்லார்க்குத்	தன்சொலால்			தான்கண்	டனைத்திவ்	வுலகு.
Translation: Translation :With pleasant speech, who gives and guards with powerful liberal hand, He sees the world obedient all to his command.
Explanation: Explanation :The world will praise and submit itself to the mind of the king who is able to give with affability, and to protect all who come to him.

Verse: முறைசெய்து	காப்பாற்றும்	மன்னவன்	மக்கட்கு			இறையென்று	வைக்கப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who guards the realm and justice strict maintains, That king as god o'er subject people reigns.
Explanation: Explanation :That king, will be esteemed a God among men, who performs his own duties, and protects (his subjects).

Verse: செவிகைப்பச்	சொற்பொறுக்கும்	பண்புடை	வேந்தன்			கவிகைக்கீழ்த்	தங்கும்	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :The king of worth, who can words bitter to his ear endure, Beneath the shadow of his power the world abides secure.
Explanation: Explanation :The whole world will dwell under the umbrella of the king, who can bear words that embitter the ear.

Verse: கொடையளி	செங்கோல்	குடியோம்பல்	நான்கும்			உடையானாம்	வேந்தர்க்	கொளி.
Translation: Translation :Gifts, grace, right sceptre, care of people's weal; These four a light of dreaded kings reveal.
Explanation: Explanation :He is the light of kings who has there four things, beneficence, benevolence, rectitude, and care for his people.

Verse: கற்க	கசடறக்	கற்பவை	கற்றபின்			நிற்க	அதற்குத்	தக.
Translation: Translation :So learn that you may full and faultless learning gain, Then in obedience meet to lessons learnt remain.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a man learn thoroughly whatever he may learn, and let his conduct be worthy of his learning.

Verse: எண்ணென்ப	ஏனை	எழுத்தென்ப	இவ்விரண்டும்			கண்ணென்ப	வாழும்	உயிர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :The twain that lore of numbers and of letters give Are eyes, the wise declare, to all on earth that live.
Explanation: Explanation :Letters and numbers are the two eyes of man.

Verse: கண்ணுடையர்	என்பவர்	கற்றோர்	முகத்திரண்டு			புண்ணுடையர்	கல்லா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Men who learning gain have eyes, men say; Blockheads' faces pairs of sores display.
Explanation: Explanation :The learned are said to have eyes, but the unlearned have (merely) two sores in their face.

Verse: உவப்பத்	தலைக்கூடி	உள்ளப்	பிரிதல்			அனைத்தே	புலவர்	தொழில்.
Translation: Translation :You meet with joy, with pleasant thought you part; Such is the learned scholar's wonderous art!
Explanation: Explanation :It is the part of the learned to give joy to those whom they meet, and on leaving, to make them think (Oh! when shall we meet them again.)

Verse: உடையார்முன்	இல்லார்போல்	ஏக்கற்றுங்	கற்றார்			கடையரே	கல்லா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :With soul submiss they stand, as paupers front a rich man's face; Yet learned men are first; th'unlearned stand in lowest place.
Explanation: Explanation :The unlearned are inferior to the learned, before whom they stand begging, as the destitute before the wealthy.

Verse: தொட்டனைத்	தூறும்	மணற்கேணி	மாந்தர்க்குக்			கற்றனைத்	தூறும்	அறிவு.
Translation: Translation :In sandy soil, when deep you delve, you reach the springs below; The more you learn, the freer streams of wisdom flow.
Explanation: Explanation :Water will flow from a well in the sand in proportion to the depth to which it is dug, and knowledge will flow from a man in proportion to his learning.

Verse: யாதானும்	நாடாமால்	ஊராமால்	என்னொருவன்			சாந்துணையுங்	கல்லாத	வாறு.
Translation: Translation :The learned make each land their own, in every city find a home; Who, till they die; learn nought, along what weary ways they roam!
Explanation: Explanation :How is it that any one can remain without learning, even to his death, when (to the learned man) every country is his own (country), and every town his own (town) ?

Verse: ஒருமைக்கண்	தான்கற்ற	கல்வி	ஒருவற்கு			எழுமையும்	ஏமாப்	புடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :The man who store of learning gains, In one, through seven worlds, bliss attains.
Explanation: Explanation :The learning, which a man has acquired in one birth, will yield him pleasure during seven births.

Verse: தாமின்	புறுவது	உலகின்	புறக்கண்டு			காமுறுவர்	கற்றறிந்	தார்.
Translation: Translation :Their joy is joy of all the world, they see; thus more The learners learn to love their cherished lore.
Explanation: Explanation :The learned will long (for more learning), when they see that while it gives pleasure to themselves, the world also derives pleasure from it.

Verse: கேடில்	விழுச்செல்வம்	கல்வி	யொருவற்கு			மாடல்ல	மற்றை	யவை.
Translation: Translation :Learning is excellence of wealth that none destroy; To man nought else affords reality of joy.
Explanation: Explanation :Learning is the true imperishable riches; all other things are not riches.

Verse: அரங்கின்றி	வட்டாடி	யற்றே	நிரம்பிய			நூலின்றிக்	கோட்டி	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Like those at draughts would play without the chequered square, Men void of ample lore would counsels of the learned share.
Explanation: Explanation :To speak in an assembly (of the learned) without fullness of knowledge, is like playing at chess (on a board) without squares.

Verse: கல்லாதான்	சொற்கா	முறுதல்	முலையிரண்டும்			இல்லாதாள்	பெண்காமுற்	றற்று.
Translation: Translation :Like those who doat on hoyden's undeveloped charms are they, Of learning void, who eagerly their power of words display.
Explanation: Explanation :The desire of the unlearned to speak (in an assembly), is like a woman without breasts desiring (the enjoyment of ) woman-hood.

Verse: கல்லா	தவரும்	நனிநல்லர்	கற்றார்முன்			சொல்லா	திருக்கப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :The blockheads, too, may men of worth appear, If they can keep from speaking where the learned hear!
Explanation: Explanation :The unlearned also are very excellent men, if they know how to keep silence before the learned.

Verse: கல்லாதான்	ஒட்பம்	கழியநன்	றாயினும்			கொள்ளார்	அறிவுடை	யார்.
Translation: Translation :From blockheads' lips, when words of wisdom glibly flow, The wise receive them not, though good they seem to show.
Explanation: Explanation :Although the natural knowledge of an unlearned man may be very good, the wise will not accept for true knowledge.

Verse: கல்லா	ஒருவன்	தகைமை	தலைப்பெய்து			சொல்லாடச்	சோர்வு	படும்.
Translation: Translation :As worthless shows the worth of man unlearned, When council meets, by words he speaks discerned.
Explanation: Explanation :The self-conceit of an unlearned man will fade away, as soon as he speaks in an assembly (of the learned).

Verse: உளரென்னும்	மாத்திரையர்	அல்லால்	பயவாக்			களரனையர்	கல்லா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :'They are': so much is true of men untaught; But, like a barren field, they yield us nought!
Explanation: Explanation :The unlearned are like worthless barren land: all that can be said of them is, that they exist.

Verse: நுண்மாண்	நுழைபுலம்	இல்லான்	எழில்நலம்			மண்மாண்	புனைபாவை	யற்று.
Translation: Translation :Who lack the power of subtle, large, and penetrating sense, Like puppet, decked with ornaments of clay, their beauty's vain pretence.
Explanation: Explanation :The beauty and goodness of one who is destitute of knowledge by the study of great and exquisite works, is like (the beauty and goodness) of a painted earthen doll.

Verse: நல்லார்கண்	பட்ட	வறுமையின்	இன்னாதே			கல்லார்கண்	பட்ட	திரு.
Translation: Translation :To men unlearned, from fortune's favour greater-evil springs Than poverty to men of goodly wisdom brings.
Explanation: Explanation :Wealth, gained by the unlearned, will give more sorrow than the poverty which may come upon the learned.

Verse: மேற்பிறந்தா	ராயினும்	கல்லாதார்	கீழ்ப்பிறந்தும்			கற்றார்	அனைத்திலர்	பாடு.
Translation: Translation :Lower are men unlearned, though noble be their race, Than low-born men adorned with learning's grace.
Explanation: Explanation :The unlearned, though born in a high caste, are not equal in dignity to the learned; though they may have been born in a low caste.

Verse: விலங்கொடு	மக்கள்	அனையர்	இலங்குநூல்			கற்றாரோடு	ஏனை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Learning's irradiating grace who gain, Others excel, as men the bestial train.
Explanation: Explanation :As beasts by the side of men, so are other men by the side of those who are learned in celebrated works.

Verse: செல்வத்துட்	செல்வஞ்	செவிச்செல்வம்	அச்செல்வம்			செல்வத்து	ளெல்லாந்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Wealth of wealth is wealth acquired be ear attent; Wealth mid all wealth supremely excellent.
Explanation: Explanation :Wealth (gained) by the ear is wealth of wealth; that wealth is the chief of all wealth.

Verse: செவுக்குண	வில்லாத	போழ்து	சிறிது			வயிற்றுக்கும்	ஈயப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :When 'tis no longer time the listening ear to feed With trifling dole of food supply the body's need.
Explanation: Explanation :When there is no food for the ear, give a little also to the stomach.

Verse: செவியுணவிற்	கேள்வி	யுடையார்	அவியுணவின்			ஆன்றாரோ	டொப்பர்	நிலத்து.
Translation: Translation :Who feed their ear with learned teachings rare, Are like the happy gods oblations rich who share.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who in this world enjoy instruction which is the food of the ear, are equal to the Gods, who enjoy the food of the sacrifices.

Verse: கற்றில	னாயினுங்	கேட்க	அஃதொருவற்கு			ஒற்கத்தின்	ஊற்றாந்	துணை.
Translation: Translation :Though learning none hath he, yet let him hear alway: In weakness this shall prove a staff and stay.
Explanation: Explanation :Although a man be without learning, let him listen (to the teaching of the learned); that will be to him a staff in adversity.

Verse: இழுக்கல்	உடையுழி	ஊற்றுக்கோல்	அற்றே			ஒழுக்க	முடையார்வாய்ச்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :Like staff in hand of him in slippery ground who strays Are words from mouth of those who walk in righteous ways.
Explanation: Explanation :The words of the good are like a staff in a slippery place.

Verse: எனைத்தானும்	நல்லவை	கேட்க	அனைத்தானும்			ஆன்ற	பெருமை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Let each man good things learn, for e'en as he Shall learn, he gains increase of perfect dignity.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a man listen, never so little, to good (instruction), even that will bring him great dignity.

Verse: பிழைத்துணர்ந்தும்	பேதைமை	சொல்லா	ரிழைத்துணர்ந்			தீண்டிய	கேள்வி	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Not e'en through inadvertence speak they foolish word, With clear discerning mind who've learning's ample lessons heard.
Explanation: Explanation :Not even when they have imperfectly understood (a matter), will those men speak foolishly, who have profoundly studied and diligently listened (to instruction).

Verse: கேட்பினுங்	கேளாத்	தகையவே	கேள்வியால்			தோட்கப்	படாத	செவி.
Translation: Translation :Where teaching hath not oped the learner's ear, The man may listen, but he scarce can hear.
Explanation: Explanation :The ear which has not been bored by instruction, although it hears, is deaf.

Verse: நுணங்கிய	கேள்விய	ரல்லார்	வணங்கிய			வாயின	ராதல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :'Tis hard for mouth to utter gentle, modest word, When ears discourse of lore refined have never heard.
Explanation: Explanation :It is a rare thing to find modesty, a reverend mouth- with those who have not received choice instruction.

Verse: செவியிற்	சுவையுணரா	வாயுணர்வின்	மாக்கள்			அவியினும்	வாழினும்	என்.
Translation: Translation :His mouth can taste, but ear no taste of joy can give! What matter if he die, or prosperous live?
Explanation: Explanation :What does it matter whether those men live or die, who can judge of tastes by the mouth, and not by the ear ?

Verse: அறிவற்றங்	காக்குங்	கருவி	செறுவார்க்கும்			உள்ளழிக்க	லாகா	அரண்.
Translation: Translation :True wisdom wards off woes, A circling fortress high; Its inner strength man's eager foes Unshaken will defy.
Explanation: Explanation :Wisdom is a weapon to ward off destruction; it is an inner fortress which enemies cannot destroy.

Verse: சென்ற	இடத்தால்	செலவிடா	தீதொரீஇ			நன்றின்பால்	உய்ப்ப	தறிவு.
Translation: Translation :Wisdom restrains, nor suffers mind to wander where it would; From every evil calls it back, and guides in way of good.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to permit the mind to go where it lists, to keep it from evil, and to employ it in good, this is wisdom.

Verse: எப்பொருள்	யார்யார்வாய்க்	கேட்பினும்	அப்பொருள்			மெய்ப்பொருள்	காண்ப	தறிவு.
Translation: Translation :Though things diverse from divers sages' lips we learn, 'Tis wisdom's part in each the true thing to discern.
Explanation: Explanation :To discern the truth in every thing, by whomsoever spoken, is wisdom.

Verse: எண்பொருள	வாகச்	செலச்சொல்லித்	தான்பிறர்வாய்			நுண்பொருள்	காண்ப	தறிவு.
Translation: Translation :Wisdom hath use of lucid speech, words that acceptance win, And subtle sense of other men's discourse takes in.
Explanation: Explanation :To speak so as that the meaning may easily enter the mind of the hearer, and to discern the subtlest thought which may lie hidden in the words of others, this is wisdom.

Verse: உலகம்	தழீஇய	தொட்பம்	மலர்தலும்			கூம்பலும்	இல்ல	தறிவு.
Translation: Translation :Wisdom embraces frank the world, to no caprice exposed; Unlike the lotus flower, now opened wide, now petals strictly closed.
Explanation: Explanation :To secure the friendship of the great is true wisdom; it is (also) wisdom to keep (that friendship unchanged, and) not opening and closing (like the lotus flower).

Verse: எவ்வ	துறைவது	உலகம்	உலகத்தோடு			அவ்வ	துறைவ	தறிவு.
Translation: Translation :As dwells the world, so with the world to dwell In harmony- this is to wisely live and well.
Explanation: Explanation :To live as the world lives, is wisdom.

Verse: அறிவுடையார்	ஆவ	தறிவார்	அறிவிலார்			அஃதறி	கல்லா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :The wise discern, the foolish fail to see, And minds prepare for things about to be.
Explanation: Explanation :The wise are those who know beforehand what will happen; those who do not know this are the unwise.

Verse: அஞ்சுவ	தஞ்சாமை	பேதைமை	அஞ்சுவது			அஞ்சல்	அறிவார்	தொழில்.
Translation: Translation :Folly meets fearful ills with fearless heart; To fear where cause of fear exists is wisdom's part.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to fear what ought to be feared, is folly; it is the work of the wise to fear what should be feared.

Verse: எதிரதாக்	காக்கும்	அறிவினார்க்	கில்லை			அதிர	வருவதோர்	நோய்.
Translation: Translation :The wise with watchful soul who coming ills foresee; From coming evil's dreaded shock are free.
Explanation: Explanation :No terrifying calamity will happen to the wise, who (foresee) and guard against coming evils.

Verse: அறிவுடையார்	எல்லா	முடையார்	அறிவிலார்			என்னுடைய	ரேனும்	இலர்.
Translation: Translation :The wise is rich, with ev'ry blessing blest; The fool is poor, of everything possessed.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who possess wisdom, possess every thing; those who have not wisdom, whatever they may possess, have nothing.

Verse: செருக்குஞ்	சினமும்	சிறுமையும்	இல்லார்			பெருக்கம்	பெருமித	நீர்த்து.
Translation: Translation :Who arrogance, and wrath, and littleness of low desire restrain, To sure increase of lofty dignity attain.
Explanation: Explanation :Truly great is the excellence of those (kings) who are free from pride, anger, and lust.

Verse: இவறலும்	மாண்பிறந்த	மானமும்	மாணா			உவகையும்	ஏதம்	இறைக்கு.
Translation: Translation :A niggard hand, o'erweening self-regard, and mirth Unseemly, bring disgrace to men of kingly brith.
Explanation: Explanation :Avarice, undignified pride, and low pleasures are faults in a king.

Verse: தினைத்துணையாங்	குற்றம்	வரினும்	பனைத்துணையாக்			கொள்வர்	பழிநாணு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Though small as millet-seed the fault men deem; As palm tree vast to those who fear disgrace 'twill seem.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who fear guilt, if they commit a fault small as a millet seed, will consider it to be as large as a palmyra tree.

Verse: குற்றமே	காக்க	பொருளாகக்	குற்றமே			அற்றந்	த்ரூஉம்	பகை.
Translation: Translation :Freedom from faults is wealth; watch heedfully 'Gainst these, for fault is fatal enmity.
Explanation: Explanation :Guard against faults as a matter (of great consequence; for) faults are a deadly enemy.

Verse: வருமுன்னர்க்	காவாதான்	வாழ்க்கை	எரிமுன்னர்			வைத்தூறு	போலக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :His joy who guards not 'gainst the coming evil day, Like straw before the fire shall swift consume away.
Explanation: Explanation :The prosperity of him who does not timely guard against faults, will perish like straw before fire.

Verse: தன்குற்றம்	நீக்கிப்	பிறர்குற்றங்	காண்கிற்பின்			என்குற்ற	மாகும்	இறைக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Faultless the king who first his own faults cures, and then Permits himself to scan faults of other men.
Explanation: Explanation :What fault will remain in the king who has put away his own evils, and looks after the evils of others.

Verse: செயற்பால	செய்யா	திவறியான்	செல்வம்			உயற்பால	தன்றிக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who leaves undone what should be done, with niggard mind, His wealth shall perish, leaving not a wrack behind.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of the avaricious man, who does not expend it for the purposes for which he ought to expend it will waste away and not continue.

Verse: பற்றுள்ளம்	என்னும்	இவறன்மை	எற்றுள்ளும்			எண்ணப்	படுவதொன்	றன்று.
Translation: Translation :The greed of soul that avarice men call, When faults are summed, is worst of all.
Explanation: Explanation :Griping avarice is not to be reckoned as one among other faults; (it stands alone - greater than all).

Verse: வியவற்க	எஞ்ஞான்றும்	தன்னை	நயவற்க			நன்றி	பயவா	வினை.
Translation: Translation :Never indulge in self-complaisant mood, Nor deed desire that yields no gain of good.
Explanation: Explanation :Let no (one) praise himself, at any time; let him not desire to do useless things.

Verse: காதல	காதல்	அறியாமை	உய்க்கிற்பின்			ஏதில	ஏதிலார்	நூல்.
Translation: Translation :If, to your foes unknown, you cherish what you love, Counsels of men who wish you harm will harmless prove.
Explanation: Explanation :If (a king) enjoys, privately the things which he desires, the designs of his enemies will be useless.

Verse: அறனறிந்து	மூத்த	அறிவுடையார்	கேண்மை			திறனறிந்து	தேர்ந்து	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :As friends the men who virtue know, and riper wisdom share, Their worth weighed well, the king should choose with care.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a king) ponder well its value, and secure the friendship of men of virtue and of mature knowledge.

Verse: உற்றநோய்	நீக்கி	உறாஅமை	முற்காக்கும்			பெற்றியார்ப்	பேணிக்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Cherish the all-accomplished men as friends, Whose skill the present ill removes, from coming ill defends.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a king) procure and kindly care for men who can overcome difficulties when they occur, and guard against them before they happen.

Verse: அரியவற்று	ளெல்லாம்	அரிதே	பெரியாரைப்			பேணித்	தமராக்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :To cherish men of mighty soul, and make them all their own, Of kingly treasures rare, as rarest gift is known.
Explanation: Explanation :To cherish great men and make them his own, is the most difficult of all difficult things.

Verse: தம்மிற்	பெரியார்	தமரா	ஒழுகுதல்			வன்மையு	ளெல்லாந்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :To live with men of greatness that their own excels, As cherished friends, is greatest power that with a monarch dwells.
Explanation: Explanation :So to act as to make those men, his own, who are greater than himself is of all powers the highest.

Verse: சூழ்வார்கண்	ணாக	ஒழுகலான்	மன்னவன்			சூழ்வாரைக்	சூழ்ந்து	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :The king, since counsellors are monarch's eyes, Should counsellors select with counsel wise.
Explanation: Explanation :As a king must use his ministers as eyes (in managing his kingdom), let him well examine their character and qualifications before he engages them.

Verse: தக்கா	ரினத்தனாய்த்	தானொழுக	வல்லானைச்			செற்றார்	செயக்கிடந்த	தில்.
Translation: Translation :The king, who knows to live with worthy men allied, Has nought to fear from any foeman's pride.
Explanation: Explanation :There will be nothing left for enemies to do, against him who has the power of acting (so as to secure) the fellowship of worthy men.

Verse: இடிக்குந்	துணையாரை	யாள்வரை	யாரே			கெடுக்குந்	தகைமை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :What power can work his fall, who faithful ministers Employs, that thunder out reproaches when he errs.
Explanation: Explanation :Who are great enough to destroy him who has servants that have power to rebuke him ?

Verse: இடிப்பாரை	இல்லாத	ஏமரா	மன்னன்			கெடுப்பா	ரிலானுங்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :The king with none to censure him, bereft of safeguards all, Though none his ruin work, shall surely ruined fall.
Explanation: Explanation :The king, who is without the guard of men who can rebuke him, will perish, even though there be no one to destroy him.

Verse: முதலிலார்க	ஊதிய	மில்லை	மதலையாஞ்			சார்பிலார்க்	கில்லை	நிலை.
Translation: Translation :Who owns no principal, can have no gain of usury; Who lacks support of friends, knows no stability.
Explanation: Explanation :There can be no gain to those who have no capital; and in like manner there can be no permanence to those who are without the support of adherents.

Verse: பல்லார்	பகைகொளலிற்	பத்தடுத்த	தீமைத்தே			நல்லார்	தொடர்கை	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Than hate of many foes incurred, works greater woe Ten-fold, of worthy men the friendship to forego.
Explanation: Explanation :It is tenfold more injurious to abandon the friendship of the good, than to incur the hatred of the many.

Verse: சிற்றினம்	அஞ்சும்	பெருமை	சிறுமைதான்			சுற்றமாச்	சூழ்ந்து	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :The great of soul will mean association fear; The mean of soul regard mean men as kinsmen dear.
Explanation: Explanation :(True) greatness fears the society of the base; it is only the low - minded who will regard them as friends.

Verse: நிலத்தியல்பால்	நீர்திரிந்	தற்றாகும்	மாந்தர்க்கு			இனத்தியல்ப	தாகும்	அறிவு.
Translation: Translation :The waters' virtues change with soil through which they flow; As man's companionship so will his wisdom show.
Explanation: Explanation :As water changes (its nature), from the nature of the soil (in which it flows), so will the character of men resemble that of their associates.

Verse: மனத்தானாம்	மாந்தர்க்	குணர்ச்சி	இனத்தானாம்			இன்னான்	எனப்படுஞ்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :Perceptions manifold in men are of the mind alone; The value of the man by his companionship is known.
Explanation: Explanation :The power of knowing is from the mind; (but) his character is from that of his associates.

Verse: மனத்து	ளதுபோலக்	காட்டி	ஒருவற்கு			இனத்துள	தாகும்	அறிவு.
Translation: Translation :Man's wisdom seems the offspring of his mind; 'Tis outcome of companionship we find.
Explanation: Explanation :Wisdom appears to rest in the mind, but it really exists to a man in his companions.

Verse: மனந்தூய்மை	செய்வினை	தூய்மை	இரண்டும்			இனந்தூய்மை	தூவா	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :Both purity of mind, and purity of action clear, Leaning no staff of pure companionship, to man draw near.
Explanation: Explanation :Chaste company is the staff on which come, these two things, viz, purity of mind and purity of conduct.

Verse: மனந்தூயார்க்	கெச்சம்நன்	றாகும்	இனந்தூயார்க்கு			இல்லைநன்	றாகா	வினை.
Translation: Translation :From true pure-minded men a virtuous race proceeds; To men of pure companionship belong no evil deeds.
Explanation: Explanation :To the pure-minded there will be a good posterity. By those whose associates are pure, no deeds will be done that are not good.

Verse: மனநலம்	மன்னுயிர்க்	காக்கம்	இனநலம்			எல்லாப்	புகழும்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Goodness of mind to lives of men increaseth gain; And good companionship doth all of praise obtain.
Explanation: Explanation :Goodness of mind will give wealth, and good society will bring with it all praise, to men.

Verse: மனநலம்	நன்குடைய	ராயினும்	சான்றோர்க்கு			இனநலம்	ஏமாப்	புடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :To perfect men, though minds right good belong, Yet good companionship is confirmation strong.
Explanation: Explanation :Although they may have great (natural) goodness of mind, yet good society will tend to strengthen it.

Verse: மனநலத்தின்	ஆகும்	மறுமைமற்	றஃதும்			இனநலத்தின்	ஏமாப்	புடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Although to mental goodness joys of other life belong, Yet good companionship is confirmation strong.
Explanation: Explanation :Future bliss is (the result) of goodness of mind; and even this acquires strength from the society of the good.

Verse: நல்லினத்தி	னூங்குந்	துணையில்லை	தீயினத்தின்			அல்லற்	படுப்பதூஉம்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Than good companionship no surer help we know; Than bad companionship nought causes direr woe.
Explanation: Explanation :There is no greater help than the company of the good; there is no greater source of sorrow than the company of the wicked.

Verse: அழிவதூஉம்	ஆவதூஉம்	ஆகி	வழிபயக்கும்			ஊதியமும்	சூழ்ந்து	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Expenditure, return, and profit of the deed In time to come; weigh these- than to the act proceed.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a man reflect on what will be lost, what will be acquired and (from these) what will be his ultimate gain, and (then, let him) act.

Verse: தெரிந்த	இனத்தொடு	தேர்ந்தெண்ணிச்	செய்வார்க்கு			அரும்பொருள்	யாதொன்றும்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :With chosen friends deliberate; next use the private thought; Then act. By those who thus proceed all works with ease are wrought.
