Explanation: Explanation :There is nothing too difficult to (be attained by) those who, before they act, reflect well themselves, and thoroughly consider (the matter) with chosen friends.

Verse: ஆக்கம்	கருதி	முதலிழக்கும்	செய்வினை			ஊக்கார்	அறிவுடை	யார்.
Translation: Translation :To risk one's all and lose, aiming at added gain, Is rash affair, from which the wise abstain.
Explanation: Explanation :Wise men will not, in the hopes of profit, undertake works that will consume their principal.

Verse: தெளிவி	லதனைத்	தொடங்கார்	இளிவென்னும்			ஏதப்பாடு	அஞ்சு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :A work of which the issue is not clear, Begin not they reproachful scorn who fear.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who fear reproach will not commence anything which has not been (thoroughly considered) and made clear to them.

Verse: வகையறச்	சூழா	தெழுதல்	பகைவரைப்			பாத்திப்	படுப்பதோ	ராறு.
Translation: Translation :With plans not well matured to rise against your foe, Is way to plant him out where he is sure to grow!
Explanation: Explanation :One way to promote the prosperity of an enemy, is (for a king) to set out (to war) without having thoroughly weighed his ability (to cope with its chances).

Verse: செய்தக்க	அல்ல	செயக்கெடும்	செய்தக்க			செய்யாமை	யானுங்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis ruin if man do an unbefitting thing; Fit things to leave undone will equal ruin bring.
Explanation: Explanation :He will perish who does not what is not fit to do; and he also will perish who does not do what it is fit to do.

Verse: எண்ணித்	துணிக	கருமம்	துணிந்தபின்			எண்ணுவம்	என்பது	இழுக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Think, and then dare the deed! Who cry, 'Deed dared, we'll think,' disgraced shall be.
Explanation: Explanation :Consider, and then undertake a matter; after having undertaken it, to say "We will consider," is folly.

Verse: ஆற்றின்	வருந்தா	வருத்தம்	பலர்நின்று			போற்றினும்	பொத்துப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :On no right system if man toil and strive, Though many men assist, no work can thrive.
Explanation: Explanation :The work, which is not done by suitable methods, will fail though many stand to uphold it.

Verse: நன்றாற்ற	லுள்ளுந்	தவுறுண்டு	அவரவர்			பண்பறிந்	தாற்றாக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :Though well the work be done, yet one mistake is made, To habitudes of various men when no regard is paid.
Explanation: Explanation :There are failures even in acting well, when it is done without knowing the various dispositions of men.

Verse: எள்ளாத	எண்ணிச்	செயல்வேண்டும்	தம்மோடு			கொள்ளாத	கொள்ளாது	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :Plan and perform no work that others may despise; What misbeseems a king the world will not approve as wise.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a man reflect, and do things which bring no reproach; the world will not approve, with him, of things which do not become of his position to adopt.

Verse: வினைவலியும்	தன்வலியும்	மாற்றான்	வலியும்			துணைவலியும்	தூக்கிச்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :The force the strife demands, the force he owns, the force of foes, The force of friends; these should he weigh ere to the war he goes.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (one) weigh well the strength of the deed (he purposes to do), his own strength, the strength of his enemy, and the strength of the allies (of both), and then let him act.

Verse: ஒல்வ	தறிவது	அறிந்ததன்	கண்தங்கிச்			செல்வார்க்குச்	செல்லாதது	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Who know what can be wrought, with knowledge of the means, on this, Their mind firm set, go forth, nought goes with them amiss.
Explanation: Explanation :There is nothing which may not be accomplished by those who, before they attack (an enemy), make themselves acquainted with their own ability, and with whatever else is (needful) to be known, and apply themselves wholly to their object.

Verse: உடைத்தம்	வலியறியார்	ஊக்கத்தின்	ஊக்கி			இடைக்கண்	முரிந்தார்	பலர்.
Translation: Translation :Ill-deeming of their proper powers, have many monarchs striven, And midmost of unequal conflict fallen asunder riven.
Explanation: Explanation :There are many who, ignorant of their (want of) power (to meet it), have haughtily set out to war, and broken down in the midst of it.

Verse: அமைந்தாங்	கொழுகான்	அளவறியான்	தன்னை			வியந்தான்	விரைந்து	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who not agrees with those around, no moderation knows, In self-applause indulging, swift to ruin goes.
Explanation: Explanation :He will quickly perish who, ignorant of his own resources flatters himself of his greatness, and does not live in peace with his neighbours.

Verse: பீலிபெய்	சாகாடும்	அச்சிறும்	அப்பண்டஞ்			சால	மிகுத்துப்	பெயின்.
Translation: Translation :With peacock feathers light, you load the wain; Yet, heaped too high, the axle snaps in twain.
Explanation: Explanation :The axle tree of a bandy, loaded only with peacocks' feathers will break, if it be greatly overloaded.

Verse: நுனிக்கொம்பர்	ஏறினார்	அஃதிறந்	தூக்கின்			உயிர்க்கிறுதி	ஆகி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who daring climbs, and would himself upraise Beyond the branch's tip, with life the forfeit pays.
Explanation: Explanation :There will be an end to the life of him who, having climbed out to the end of a branch, ventures to go further.

Verse: ஆற்றின்	அறவறிந்து	ஈக	அதுபொருள்			போற்றி	வழங்கு	நெறி.
Translation: Translation :With knowledge of the measure due, as virtue bids you give! That is the way to guard your wealth, and seemly live.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a man know the measure of his ability (to give), and let him give accordingly; such giving is the way to preserve his property.

Verse: ஆகாறு	அளவிட்டி	தாயினுங்	கேடில்லை			போகாறு	அகலாக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :Incomings may be scant; but yet, no failure there, If in expenditure you rightly learn to spare.
Explanation: Explanation :Even though the income (of a king) be small, it will not cause his (ruin), if his outgoings be not larger than his income.

Verse: அளவற஧ந்து	வாழாதான்	வாழ்க்கை	உளபோல			இல்லாகித்	தோன்றாக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who prosperous lives and of enjoyment knows no bound, His seeming wealth, departing, nowhere shall be found.
Explanation: Explanation :The prosperity of him who lives without knowing the measure (of his property), will perish, even while it seems to continue.

Verse: உளவரை	தூக்காத	ஒப்புர	வாண்மை			வளவரை	வல்லைக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Beneficence that measures not its bound of means, Will swiftly bring to nought the wealth on which it leans.
Explanation: Explanation :The measure of his wealth will quickly perish, whose liberality weighs not the measure of his property.

Verse: பகல்வெல்லும்	கூகையைக்	காக்கை	இகல்வெல்லும்			வேந்தர்க்கு	வேண்டும்	பொழுது.
Translation: Translation :A crow will conquer owl in broad daylight; The king that foes would crush, needs fitting time to fight.
Explanation: Explanation :A crow will overcome an owl in the day time; so the king who would conquer his enemy must have (a suitable) time.

Verse: பருவத்தோடு	ஒட்ட	ஒழுகல்	திருவினைத்			தீராமை	ஆர்க்குங்	கயிறு.
Translation: Translation :The bond binds fortune fast is ordered effort made, Strictly observant still of favouring season's aid.
Explanation: Explanation :Acting at the right season, is a cord that will immoveably bind success (to a king).

Verse: அருவினை	யென்ப	உளவோ	கருவியான்			காலம்	அற஧ந்து	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :Can any work be hard in very fact, If men use fitting means in timely act?
Explanation: Explanation :Is there anything difficult for him to do, who acts, with (the right) instruments at the right time ?

Verse: ஞாலம்	கருதினுங்	கைகூடுங்	காலம்			கருதி	இடத்தாற்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :The pendant world's dominion may be won, In fitting time and place by action done.
Explanation: Explanation :Though (a man) should meditate (the conquest of) the world, he may accomplish it if he acts in the right time, and at the right place.

Verse: காலம்	கருதி	இருப்பர்	கலங்காது			ஞாலம்	கருது	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who think the pendant world itself to subjugate, With mind unruffled for the fitting time must wait.
Explanation: Explanation :They who thoughtfully consider and wait for the (right) time (for action), may successfully meditate (the conquest of) the world.

Verse: ஊக்க	முடையான்	ஒடுக்கம்	பொருதகர்			தாக்கற்குப்	பேருந்	தகைத்து.
Translation: Translation :The men of mighty power their hidden energies repress, As fighting ram recoils to rush on foe with heavier stress.
Explanation: Explanation :The self-restraint of the energetic (while waiting for a suitable opportunity), is like the drawing back of a fighting-ram in order to butt.

Verse: பொள்ளென	ஆங்கே	புறம்வேரார்	காலம்பார்த்து			உள்வேர்ப்பர்	ஒள்ளி	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :The glorious once of wrath enkindled make no outward show, At once; they bide their time, while hidden fires within them glow.
Explanation: Explanation :The wise will not immediately and hastily shew out their anger; they will watch their time, and restrain it within.

Verse: செறுநரைக்	காணின்	சுமக்க	இறுவரை			காணின்	கிழக்காம்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :If foes' detested form they see, with patience let them bear; When fateful hour at last they spy,- the head lies there.
Explanation: Explanation :If one meets his enemy, let him show him all respect, until the time for his destruction is come; when that is come, his head will be easily brought low.

Verse: எய்தற்	கரியது	இயைந்தக்கால்	அந்நிலையே			செய்தற்	கரிய	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :When hardest gain of opportunity at last is won, With promptitude let hardest deed be done.
Explanation: Explanation :If a rare opportunity occurs, while it lasts, let a man do that which is rarely to be accomplished (but for such an opportunity).

Verse: கொக்கொக்க	கூம்பும்	பருவத்து	மற்றதன்			குத்தொக்க	சீர்த்த	இடத்து.
Translation: Translation :As heron stands with folded wing, so wait in waiting hour; As heron snaps its prey, when fortune smiles, put forth your power.
Explanation: Explanation :At the time when one should use self-control, let him restrain himself like a heron; and, let him like it, strike, when there is a favourable opportunity.

Verse: தொடங்கற்க	எவ்வினையும்	எள்ளற்க	முற்றும்			இடங்கண்ட	பின்அல்	லது.
Translation: Translation :Begin no work of war, depise no foe, Till place where you can wholly circumvent you know.
Explanation: Explanation :Let not (a king) despise (an enemy), nor undertake any thing (against him), until he has obtained (a suitable) place for besieging him.

Verse: முரண்சேர்ந்த	மொய்ம்பி	னவர்க்கும்	அரண்சேர்ந்தாம்			ஆக்கம்	பலவுந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Though skill in war combine with courage tried on battle-field, The added gain of fort doth great advantage yield.
Explanation: Explanation :Even to those who are men of power and expedients, an attack in connection with a fortification will yield many advantages.

Verse: ஆற்றாரும்	ஆற்றி	அடுப	இடனறிந்து			போற்றார்கண்	போற்றிச்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :E'en weak ones mightily prevail, if place of strong defence, They find, protect themselves, and work their foes offence.
Explanation: Explanation :Even the powerless will become powerful and conquer, if they select a proper field (of action), and guard themselves, while they make war on their enemies.

Verse: எண்ணியார்	எண்ணம்	இழப்பர்	இடனறிந்து			துன்னியார்	துன்னிச்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :The foes who thought to triumph, find their thoughts were vain, If hosts advance, seize vantage ground, and thence the fight maintain.
Explanation: Explanation :If they who draw near (to fight) choose a suitable place to approach (their enemy), the latter, will have to relinquish the thought which they once entertained, of conquering them.

Verse: நெடும்புனலுள்	வெல்லும்	முதலை	அடும்புனலின்			நீங்கின்	அதனைப்	பிற.
Translation: Translation :The crocodile prevails in its own flow of water wide, If this it leaves, 'tis slain by anything beside.
Explanation: Explanation :In deep water, a crocodile will conquer (all other animals); but if it leave the water, other animals will conquer it.

Verse: கடலோடா	கால்வல்	நெடுந்தேர்	கடலோடும்			நாவாயும்	ஓடா	நிலத்து.
Translation: Translation :The lofty car, with mighty wheel, sails not o'er watery main, The boat that skims the sea, runs not on earth's hard plain.
Explanation: Explanation :Wide chariots, with mighty wheels, will not run on the ocean; neither will ships that the traverse ocean, move on the earth.

Verse: அஞ்சாமை	அல்லால்	துணைவேண்டா	எஞ்சாமை			எண்ணி	இடத்தால்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :Save their own fearless might they need no other aid, If in right place they fight, all due provision made.
Explanation: Explanation :You will need no other aid than fearlessness, if you thoroughly reflect (on what you are to do), and select (a suitable) place for your operations.

Verse: சிறுபடையான்	செல்லிடம்	சேரின்	உறுபடையான்			ஊக்கம்	அழிந்து	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :If lord of army vast the safe retreat assail Of him whose host is small, his mightiest efforts fail.
Explanation: Explanation :The power of one who has a large army will perish, if he goes into ground where only a small army can act.

Verse: சிறைநலனும்	சீரும்	இலரெனினும்	மாந்தர்			உறைநிலத்தோடு	ஒட்டல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Though fort be none, and store of wealth they lack, 'Tis hard a people's homesteads to attack!
Explanation: Explanation :It is a hazardous thing to attack men in their own country, although they may neither have power nor a good fortress.

Verse: காலாழ்	களரில்	நரியடும்	கண்ணஞ்சா			வேலாள்	முகத்த	களிறு.
Translation: Translation :The jackal slays, in miry paths of foot-betraying fen, The elephant of fearless eye and tusks transfixing armed men.
Explanation: Explanation :A fox can kill a fearless, warrior-faced elephant, if it go into mud in which its legs sink down.

Verse: அறம்பொருள்	இன்பம்	உயிரச்சம்	நான்கின்			திறந்தெரிந்து	தேறப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :How treats he virtue, wealth and pleasure? How, when life's at stake, Comports himself? This four-fold test of man will full assurance make.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a minister) be chosen, after he has been tried by means of these four things, viz,-his virtue, (love of) money, (love of) sexual pleasure, and tear of (losing) life.

Verse: குடிப்பிறந்து	குற்றத்தின்	நீங்கி	வடுப்பரியும்			நாணுடையான்	சுட்டே	தெளிவு.
Translation: Translation :Of noble race, of faultless worth, of generous pride That shrinks from shame or stain; in him may king confide.
Explanation: Explanation :(The king's) choice should (fall) on him, who is of good family, who is free from faults, and who has the modesty which fears the wounds (of sin).

Verse: அரியகற்று	ஆசற்றார்	கண்ணும்	தெரியுங்கால்			இன்மை	அரிதே	வெளிறு.
Translation: Translation :Though deeply learned, unflecked by fault, 'tis rare to see, When closely scanned, a man from all unwisdom free.
Explanation: Explanation :When even men, who have studied the most difficult works, and who are free from faults, are (carefully) examined, it is a rare thing to find them without ignorance.

Verse: குணம்நாடிக்	குற்றமும்	நாடி	அவற்றுள்			மிகைநாடி	மிக்க	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Weigh well the good of each, his failings closely scan, As these or those prevail, so estimate the man.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a king) consider (a man's) good qualities, as well as his faults, and then judge (of his character) by that which prevails.

Verse: பெருமைக்கும்	ஏனைச்	சிறுமைக்கும்	தத்தம்			கருமமே	கட்டளைக்	கல்.
Translation: Translation :Of greatness and of meanness too, The deeds of each are touchstone true.
Explanation: Explanation :A man's deeds are the touchstone of his greatness and littleness.

Verse: அற்றாரைத்	தேறுதல்	ஓம்புக	மற்றவர்			பற்றிலர்	நாணார்	பழி.
Translation: Translation :Beware of trusting men who have no kith of kin; No bonds restrain such men, no shame deters from sin.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a king) avoid choosing men who have no relations; such men have no attachment, and therefore have no fear of crime.

Verse: காதன்மை	கந்தா	அறிவறியார்த்	தேறுதல்			பேதைமை	எல்லாந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :By fond affection led who trusts in men of unwise soul, Yields all his being up to folly's blind control.
Explanation: Explanation :To choose ignorant men, through partiality, is the height of folly.

Verse: தேரான்	பிறனைத்	தெளிந்தான்	வழிமுறை			தீரா	இடும்பை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Who trusts an untried stranger, brings disgrace, Remediless, on all his race.
Explanation: Explanation :Sorrow that will not leave even his posterity will come upon him chooses a stranger whose character he has not known.

Verse: தேறற்க	யாரையும்	தேராது	தேர்ந்தபின்			தேறுக	தேறும்	பொருள்.
Translation: Translation :Trust no man whom you have not fully tried, When tested, in his prudence proved confide.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a king) choose no one without previous consideration; after he has made his choice, let him unhesitatingly select for each such duties as are appropriate.

Verse: தேரான்	தெளிவும்	தெளிந்தான்கண்	ஐயுறவும்			தீரா	இடும்பை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Trust where you have not tried, doubt of a friend to feel, Once trusted, wounds inflict that nought can heal.
Explanation: Explanation :To make choice of one who has not been examined, and to entertain doubts respecting one who has been chosen, will produce irremediable sorrow.

Verse: நன்மையும்	தீமையும்	நாடி	நலம்புரிந்த			தன்மையான்	ஆளப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who good and evil scanning, ever makes the good his joy; Such man of virtuous mood should king employ.
Explanation: Explanation :He should be employed (by a king), whose nature leads him to choose the good, after having weighed both the evil and the good in any undertaking.

Verse: வாரி	பெருக்கி	வளம்படுத்து	உற்றவை			ஆராய்வான்	செய்க	வினை.
Translation: Translation :Who swells the revenues, spreads plenty o'er the land, Seeks out what hinders progress, his the workman's hand.
Explanation: Explanation :Let him do (the king's) work who can enlarge the sources (of revenue), increase wealth and considerately prevent the accidents (which would destroy it).

Verse: அன்பறிவு	தேற்றம்	அவாவின்மை	இந்நான்கும்			நன்குடையான்	கட்டே	தெளிவு.
Translation: Translation :A loyal love with wisdom, clearness, mind from avarice free; Who hath these four good gifts should ever trusted be.
Explanation: Explanation :Let the choice (of a king) fall upon him who largely possesses these four things, love, knowledge, a clear mind and freedom from covetousness.

Verse: எனைவகையான்	தேறியக்	கண்ணும்	வினைவகையான்			வேறாகும்	மாந்தர்	பலர்.
Translation: Translation :Even when tests of every kind are multiplied, Full many a man proves otherwise, by action tried!
Explanation: Explanation :Even when (a king) has tried them in every possible way, there are many men who change, from the nature of the works (in which they may be employed).

Verse: அறிந்தாற்றிச்	செய்கிற்பாற்கு	அல்லால்	வினைதான்			சிறந்தானென்று	ஏவற்பாற்	றன்று.
Translation: Translation :No specious fav'rite should the king's commission bear, But he that knows, and work performs with patient care.
Explanation: Explanation :(A king's) work can only be accomplished by a man of wisdom and patient endurance; it is not of a nature to be given to one from mere personal attachment.

Verse: செய்வானை	நாடி	வினைநாடிக்	காலத்தோடு			எய்த	உணர்ந்து	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Let king first ask, 'Who shall the deed perform?' and 'What the deed?' Of hour befitting both assured, let every work proceed.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a king) act, after having considered the agent (whom he is to employ), the deed (he desires to do), and the time which is suitable to it.

Verse: இதனை	இதனால்	இவன்முடிக்கும்	என்றாய்ந்து			அதனை	அவன்கண்	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :'This man, this work shall thus work out,' let thoughtful king command; Then leave the matter wholly in his servant's hand.
Explanation: Explanation :After having considered, "this man can accomplish this, by these means", let (the king) leave with him the discharge of that duty.

Verse: வினைக்குரிமை	நாடிய	பின்றை	அவனை			அதற்குரிய	னாகச்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :As each man's special aptitude is known, Bid each man make that special work his own.
Explanation: Explanation :Having considered what work a man is fit for, let (the king) employ him in that work.

Verse: வினைக்கண்	வினையுடையான்	கேண்மைவே	றாக			நினைப்பானை	நீங்கும்	திரு.
Translation: Translation :Fortune deserts the king who ill can bear, Informal friendly ways of men his tolls who share.
Explanation: Explanation :Prosperity will leave (the king) who doubts the friendship of the man who steadily labours in the discharge of his duties.

Verse: நாடோறும்	நாடுக	மன்னன்	வினைசெய்வான்			கோடாமை	கோடா	துலகு.
Translation: Translation :Let king search out his servants' deeds each day; When these do right, the world goes rightly on its way.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a king daily examine the conduct of his servants; if they do not act crookedly, the world will not act crookedly.

Verse: பற்றற்ற	கண்ணும்	பழைமைபா	ராட்டுதல்			சுற்றத்தார்	கண்ணே	உள.
Translation: Translation :When wealth is fled, old kindness still to show, Is kindly grace that only kinsmen know.
Explanation: Explanation :Even when (a man's) property is all gone, relatives will act towards him with their accustomed (kindness).

Verse: விருப்பறாச்	சுற்றம்	இயையின்	அருப்பறா			ஆக்கம்	பலவும்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :The gift of kin's unfailing love bestows Much gain of good, like flower that fadeless blows.
Explanation: Explanation :If (a man's) relatives remain attached to him with unchanging love, it will be a source of ever-increasing wealth.

Verse: அளவளா	வில்லாதான்	வாழ்க்கை	குளவளாக்			கோடின்றி	நீர்நிறைந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :His joy of life who mingles not with kinsmen gathered round, Is lake where streams pour in, with no encircling bound.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of one who does not mingle freely with his relatives, will be like the filling of water in a spacious tank that has no banks.

Verse: சுற்றத்தால்	சுற்றப்	படஒழுகல்	செல்வந்தான்			பெற்றத்தால்	பெற்ற	பயன்.
Translation: Translation :The profit gained by wealth's increase, Is living compassed round by relatives in peace.
Explanation: Explanation :To live surrounded by relatives, is the advantage to be derived from the acquisition of wealth.

Verse: கொடுத்தலும்	இன்சொலும்	ஆற்றின்	அடுக்கிய			சுற்றத்தால்	சுற்றப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who knows the use of pleasant words, and liberal gifts can give, Connections, heaps of them, surrounding him shall live.
Explanation: Explanation :He will be surrounded by numerous relatives who manifests generosity and affability.

Verse: பெருங்கொடையான்	பேணான்	வெகுளி	அவனின்			மருங்குடையார்	மாநிலத்து	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Than one who gifts bestows and wrath restrains, Through the wide world none larger following gains.
Explanation: Explanation :No one, in all the world, will have so many relatives (about him), as he who makes large gift, and does not give way to anger.

Verse: காக்கை	கரவா	கரைந்துண்ணும்	ஆக்கமும்			அன்னநீ	ரார்க்கே	உள.
Translation: Translation :The crows conceal not, call their friends to come, then eat; Increase of good such worthy ones shall meet.
Explanation: Explanation :The crows do not conceal (their prey), but will call out for others (to share with them) while they eat it; wealth will be with those who show a similar disposition (towards their relatives).

Verse: பொதுநோக்கான்	வேந்தன்	வரிசையா	நோக்கின்			அதுநோக்கி	வாழ்வார்	பலர்.
Translation: Translation :Where king regards not all alike, but each in his degree, 'Neath such discerning rule many dwell happily.
Explanation: Explanation :Many relatives will live near a king, when they observe that he does not look on all alike, but that he looks on each man according to his merit.

Verse: தமராகிக்	தற்றுறந்தார்	சுற்றம்	அமராமைக்			காரணம்	இன்றி	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :Who once were his, and then forsook him, as before Will come around, when cause of disagreement is no more.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have been friends and have afterwards forsaken him, will return and join themselves (to him), when the cause of disagreement is not to be found in him.

Verse: உழைப்பிரிந்து	காரணத்தின்	வந்தானை	வேந்தன்			இழைத்திருந்து	எண்ணிக்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Who causeless went away, then to return, for any cause, ask leave; The king should sift their motives well, consider, and receive!
Explanation: Explanation :When one may have left him, and for some cause has returned to him, let the king fulfil the object (for which he has come back) and thoughtfully receive him again.

Verse: இறந்த	வெகுளியின்	தீதே	சிறந்த			உவகை	மகிழ்ச்சியிற்	சோர்வு.
Translation: Translation :'Tis greater ill, it rapture of o'erweening gladness to the soul Bring self-forgetfulness than if transcendent wrath control.
Explanation: Explanation :More evil than excessive anger, is forgetfulness which springs from the intoxication of great joy.

Verse: பொச்சாப்புக்	கொல்லும்	புகழை	அறிவினை			நிச்ச	நிரப்புக்கொன்	றாங்கு.
Translation: Translation :Perpetual, poverty is death to wisdom of the wise; When man forgets himself his glory dies!
Explanation: Explanation :Forgetfulness will destroy fame, even as constant poverty destroys knowledge.

Verse: பொச்சாப்பார்க்	கில்லை	புகழ்மை	அதுஉலகத்து			எப்பால்நூ	லோர்க்கும்	துணிவு.
Translation: Translation :'To self-oblivious men no praise'; this rule Decisive wisdom sums of every school.
Explanation: Explanation :Thoughtlessness will never acquire fame; and this tenet is upheld by all treatises in the world.

Verse: அச்ச	முடையார்க்கு	அரணில்லை	ஆங்கில்லை			பொச்சாப்	புடையார்க்கு	நன்கு.
Translation: Translation :'To cowards is no fort's defence'; e'en so The self-oblivious men no blessing know.
Explanation: Explanation :Just as the coward has no defence (by whatever fortifications ha may be surrounded), so the thoughtless has no good (whatever advantages he may possess).

Verse: முன்னுறக்	காவாது	இழுக்கியான்	தன்பிழை			பின்னூறு	இரங்கி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :To him who nought foresees, recks not of anything, The after woe shall sure repentance bring.
Explanation: Explanation :The thoughtless man, who provides not against the calamities that may happen, will afterwards repent for his fault.

Verse: இழுக்காமை	யார்மாட்டும்	என்றும்	வழுக்காமை			வாயின்	அதுவொப்பது	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Towards all unswerving, ever watchfulness of soul retain, Where this is found there is no greater gain.
Explanation: Explanation :There is nothing comparable with the possession of unfailing thoughtfulness at all times; and towards all persons.

Verse: அரியஎன்று	ஆகாத	இல்லைபொச்	சாவாக்			கருவியால்	போற்றிச்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :Though things are arduous deemed, there's nought may not be won, When work with mind's unslumbering energy and thought is done.
Explanation: Explanation :There is nothing too difficult to be accomplished, if a man set about it carefully, with unflinching endeavour.

Verse: புகழ்ந்தவை	போற்றிச்	செயல்வேண்டும்	செய்யாது			இகழ்ந்தார்க்கு	எழுமையும்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Let things that merit praise thy watchful soul employ; Who these despise attain through sevenfold births no joy.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a man) observe and do these things which have been praised (by the wise); if he neglects and fails to perform them, for him there will be no (happiness) throughout the seven births.

Verse: இகழ்ச்சியின்	கெட்டாரை	உள்ளுக	தாந்தம்			மகிழ்ச்சியின்	மைந்துறும்	போழ்து.
Translation: Translation :Think on the men whom scornful mind hath brought to nought, When exultation overwhelms thy wildered thought.
Explanation: Explanation :Let (a king) think of those who have been ruined by neglect, when his mind is elated with joy.

Verse: உள்ளியது	எய்தல்	எளிதுமன்	மற்றுந்தான்			உள்ளியது	உள்ளப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis easy what thou hast in mind to gain, If what thou hast in mind thy mind retain.
Explanation: Explanation :It is easy for (one) to obtain whatever he may think of, if he can again think of it.

Verse: ஓர்ந்துகண்	ணோடாது	இறைபுரிந்து	யார்மாட்டும்			தேர்ந்துசெய்	வஃதே	முறை.
Translation: Translation :Search out, to no one favour show; with heart that justice loves Consult, then act; this is the rule that right approves.
Explanation: Explanation :To examine into (the crimes which may be committed), to show no favour (to any one), to desire to act with impartiality towards all, and to inflict (such punishments) as may be wisely resolved on, constitute rectitude.

Verse: வானோக்கி	வாழும்	உலகெல்லாம்	மன்னவன்			கோல்நோக்கி	வாழுங்	குடி.
Translation: Translation :All earth looks up to heav'n whence raindrops fall; All subjects look to king that ruleth all.
Explanation: Explanation :When there is rain, the living creation thrives; and so when the king rules justly, his subjects thrive.

Verse: அந்தணர்	நூற்கும்	அறத்திற்கும்	ஆதியாய்			நின்றது	மன்னவன்	கோல்.
Translation: Translation :Learning and virtue of the sages spring, From all-controlling sceptre of the king.
Explanation: Explanation :The sceptre of the king is the firm support of the Vedas of the Brahmin, and of all virtues therein described.

Verse: குடிதழீஇக்	கோலோச்சும்	மாநில	மன்னன்			அடிதழீஇ	நிற்கும்	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :Whose heart embraces subjects all, lord over mighty land Who rules, the world his feet embracing stands.
Explanation: Explanation :The world will constantly embrace the feet of the great king who rules over his subjects with love.

Verse: இயல்புளிக்	கோலோச்சும்	மன்னவன்	நாட்ட			பெயலும்	விளையுளும்	தொக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Where king, who righteous laws regards, the sceptre wields, There fall the showers, there rich abundance crowns the fields.
Explanation: Explanation :Rain and plentiful crops will ever dwell together in the country of the king who sways his sceptre with justice.

Verse: வேலன்று	வென்றி	தருவது	மன்னவன்			கோலதூஉங்	கோடா	தெனின்.
Translation: Translation :Not lance gives kings the victory, But sceptre swayed with equity.
Explanation: Explanation :It is not the javelin that gives victory, but the king's sceptre, if it do no injustice.

Verse: இறைகாக்கும்	வையகம்	எல்லாம்	அவனை			முறைகாக்கும்	முட்டாச்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :The king all the whole realm of earth protects; And justice guards the king who right respects.
Explanation: Explanation :The king defends the whole world; and justice, when administered without defect, defends the king.

Verse: எண்பதத்தான்	ஓரா	முறைசெய்யா	மன்னவன்			தண்பதத்தான்	தானே	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Hard of access, nought searching out, with partial hand The king who rules, shall sink and perish from the land.
Explanation: Explanation :The king who gives not facile audience (to those who approach him), and who does not examine and pass judgment (on their complaints), will perish in disgrace.

Verse: குடிபுறங்	காத்தோம்பிக்	குற்றம்	கடிதல்			வடுவன்று	வேந்தன்	தொழில்.
Translation: Translation :Abroad to guard, at home to punish, brings No just reproach; 'tis work assigned to kings.
Explanation: Explanation :In guarding his subjects (against injury from others), and in preserving them himself; to punish crime is not a fault in a king, but a duty.

Verse: கொலையிற்	கொடியாரை	வேந்தொறுத்தல்	பைங்கூழ்			களைகட்	டதனொடு	நேர்.
Translation: Translation :By punishment of death the cruel to restrain, Is as when farmer frees from weeds the tender grain.
Explanation: Explanation :For a king to punish criminals with death, is like pulling up the weeds in the green corn.

Verse: கொலைமேற்கொண்	டாரிற்	கொடிதே	அலைமேற்கொண்டு			அல்லவை	செய்தொழுகும்	வேந்து.
Translation: Translation :Than one who plies the murderer's trade, more cruel is the king Who all injustice works, his subjects harassing.
Explanation: Explanation :The king who gives himself up to oppression and acts unjustly (towards his subjects) is more cruel than the man who leads the life of a murderer.

Verse: வேலொடு	நின்றான்	இடுவென்	றதுபோலும்			கோலொடு	நின்றான்	இரவு.
Translation: Translation :As 'Give' the robber cries with lance uplift, So kings with sceptred hand implore a gift.
Explanation: Explanation :The request (for money) of him who holds the sceptre is like the word of a highway robber who stands with a weapon in hand and says "give up your wealth".

Verse: நாடொறும்	நாடி	முறைசெய்யா	மன்னவன்			நாடொறும்	நாடு	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who makes no daily search for wrongs, nor justly rules, that king Doth day by day his realm to ruin bring.
Explanation: Explanation :The country of the king who does not daily examine into the wrongs done and distribute justice, will daily fall to ruin.

Verse: கூழுங்	குடியும்	ஒருங்கிழக்கும்	கோல்கோடிச்			சூழாது	செய்யும்	அரசு.
Translation: Translation :Whose rod from right deflects, who counsel doth refuse, At once his wealth and people utterly shall lose.
Explanation: Explanation :The king, who, without reflecting (on its evil consequences), perverts justice, will lose at once both his wealth and his subjects.

Verse: அல்லற்பட்டு	ஆற்றாது	அழுதகண்	ணீரன்றே			செல்வத்தைத்	தேய்க்கும்	படை
Translation: Translation :His people's tears of sorrow past endurance, are not they Sharp instruments to wear the monarch's wealth away?
Explanation: Explanation :Will not the tears, shed by a people who cannot endure the oppression which they suffer (from their king), become a saw to waste away his wealth ?

Verse: மன்னர்க்கு	மன்னுதல்	செங்கோன்மை	அஃதின்றேல்			மன்னாவாம்	மன்னர்க்	கொளி.
Translation: Translation :To rulers' rule stability is sceptre right; When this is not, quenched is the rulers' light.
Explanation: Explanation :Righteous government gives permanence to (the fame of) kings; without that their fame will have no endurance.

Verse: துளியின்மை	ஞாலத்திற்கு	எற்றற்றே	வேந்தன்			அளியின்மை	வாழும்	உயிர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :As lack of rain to thirsty lands beneath, Is lack of grace in kings to all that breathe.
Explanation: Explanation :As is the world without rain, so live a people whose king is without kindness.

Verse: இன்மையின்	இன்னாது	உடைமை	முறைசெய்யா			மன்னவன்	கோற்கீழ்ப்	படின்.
Translation: Translation :To poverty it adds a sharper sting, To live beneath the sway of unjust king.
Explanation: Explanation :Property gives more sorrow than poverty, to those who live under the sceptre of a king without justice.

Verse: முறைகோடி	மன்னவன்	செய்யின்	உறைகோடி			ஒல்லாது	வானம்	பெயல்.
Translation: Translation :Where king from right deflecting, makes unrighteous gain, The seasons change, the clouds pour down no rain.
Explanation: Explanation :If the king acts contrary to justice, rain will become unseasonable, and the heavens will withhold their showers.

Verse: ஆபயன்	குன்றும்	அறுதொழிலோர்	நூல்மறப்பர்			காவலன்	காவான்	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :Where guardian guardeth not, udder of kine grows dry, And Brahmans' sacred lore will all forgotten lie.
Explanation: Explanation :If the guardian (of the country) neglects to guard it, the produce of the cows will fail, and the men of six duties viz., the Brahmins will forget the vedas.

Verse: தக்காங்கு	நாடித்	தலைச்செல்லா	வண்ணத்தால்			ஒத்தாங்கு	ஒறுப்பது	வேந்து.
Translation: Translation :Who punishes, investigation made in due degree, So as to stay advance of crime, a king is he.
Explanation: Explanation :He is a king who having equitably examined (any injustice which has been brought to his notice), suitably punishes it, so that it may not be again committed.

Verse: கடிதோச்சி	மெல்ல	எறிக	நெடிதாக்கம்			நீங்காமை	வேண்டு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :For length of days with still increasing joys on Heav'n who call, Should raise the rod with brow severe, but let it gently fall.
Explanation: Explanation :Let the king, who desires that his prosperity may long remain, commence his preliminary enquires with strictness, and then punish with mildness.

Verse: வெருவந்த	செய்தொழுகும்	வெங்கோல	னாயின்			ஒருவந்தம்	ஒல்லைக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Where subjects dread of cruel wrongs endure, Ruin to unjust king is swift and sure.
Explanation: Explanation :The cruel-sceptred king, who acts so as to put his subjects in fear, will certainly and quickly come to ruin.

Verse: இறைகடியன்	என்றுரைக்கும்	இன்னாச்சொல்	வேந்தன்			உறைகடுகி	ஒல்லைக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :'Ah! cruel is our king', where subjects sadly say, His age shall dwindle, swift his joy of life decay.
Explanation: Explanation :The king who is spoken of as cruel will quickly perish; his life becoming shortened.

Verse: அருஞ்செவ்வி	இன்னா	முகத்தான்	பெருஞ்செல்வம்			பேஎய்கண்	டன்னது	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Whom subjects scarce may see, of harsh forbidding countenance; His ample wealth shall waste, blasted by demon's glance.
Explanation: Explanation :The great wealth of him who is difficult of access and possesses a sternness of countenance, is like that which has been obtained by a devil.

Verse: கடுஞ்சொல்லன்	கண்ணிலன்	ஆயின்	நெடுஞ்செல்வம்			நீடின்றி	ஆங்கே	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :The tyrant, harsh in speach and hard of eye, His ample joy, swift fading, soon shall die.
Explanation: Explanation :The abundant wealth of the king whose words are harsh and whose looks are void of kindness, will instantly perish instead of abiding long, with him.

Verse: கடுமொழியும்	கையிகந்த	தண்டமும்	வேந்தன்			அடுமுரண்	தேய்க்கும்	அரம்.
Translation: Translation :Harsh words and punishments severe beyond the right, Are file that wears away the monarch's conquering might.
Explanation: Explanation :Severe words and excessive punishments will be a file to waste away a king's power for destroying (his enemies).

Verse: இனத்தாற்றி	எண்ணாத	வேந்தன்	சினத்தாற்றிச்			சீறிற்	சிறுகும்	திரு.
Translation: Translation :Who leaves the work to those around, and thinks of it no more; If he in wrathful mood reprove, his prosperous days are o'er!
Explanation: Explanation :The prosperity of that king will waste away, who without reflecting (on his affairs himself), commits them to his ministers, and (when a failure occurs) gives way to anger, and rages against them.

Verse: செருவந்த	போழ்திற்	சிறைசெய்யா	வேந்தன்			வெருவந்து	வெய்து	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who builds no fort whence he may foe defy, In time of war shall fear and swiftly die.
Explanation: Explanation :The king who has not provided himself with a place of defence, will in times of war be seized with fear and quickly perish.

Verse: கல்லார்ப்	பிணிக்கும்	கடுங்கோல்	அதுவல்லது			இல்லை	நிலக்குப்	பொறை.
Translation: Translation :Tyrants with fools their counsels share: Earth can no heavier burthen bear!
Explanation: Explanation :The earth bears up no greater burden than ignorant men whom a cruel sceptre attaches to itself (as the ministers of its evil deeds).

Verse: கண்ணோட்டம்	என்னும்	கழிபெருங்	காரிகை			உண்மையான்	உண்டிவ்	வுலகு.
Translation: Translation :Since true benignity, that grace exceeding great, resides In kingly souls, world in happy state abides.
Explanation: Explanation :The world exists through that greatest ornament (of princes), a gracious demeanour.

Verse: கண்ணோட்டத்	துள்ளது	உலகியல்	அஃதிலார்			உண்மை	நிலக்குப்	பொறை.
Translation: Translation :The world goes on its wonted way, since grace benign is there; All other men are burthen for the earth to bear.
Explanation: Explanation :The prosperity of the world springs from the kindliness, the existence of those who have no (kindliness) is a burden to the earth.

Verse: பண்என்னாம்	பாடற்கு	இயைபின்றேல்	கண்என்னாம்			கண்ணோட்டம்	இல்லாத	கண்.
Translation: Translation :Where not accordant with the song, what use of sounding chords? What gain of eye that no benignant light affords?
Explanation: Explanation :Of what avail is a song if it be inconsistent with harmony ? what is the use of eyes which possess no kindliness.

Verse: உளபோல்	முகத்தெவன்	செய்யும்	அளவினால்			கண்ணோட்டம்	இல்லாத	கண்.
Translation: Translation :The seeming eye of face gives no expressive light, When not with duly meted kindness bright.
Explanation: Explanation :Beyond appearing to be in the face, what good do they do, those eyes in which is no well-regulated kindness ?

Verse: கண்ணிற்கு	அணிகலம்	கண்ணோட்டம்	அஃதின்றேல்			புண்ணென்று	உணரப்	படும்
Translation: Translation :Benignity is eyes' adorning grace; Without it eyes are wounds disfiguring face.
Explanation: Explanation :Kind looks are the ornaments of the eyes; without these they will be considered (by the wise) to be merely two sores.

Verse: மண்ணோ	டியைந்த	மரத்தனையர்	கண்ணோ			டியைந்துகண்	ணோடா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Whose eyes 'neath brow infixed diffuse no ray Of grace; like tree in earth infixed are they.
Explanation: Explanation :They resemble the trees of the earth, who although they have eyes, never look kindly (on others).

Verse: கண்ணோட்டம்	இல்லவர்	கண்ணிலர்	கண்ணுடையார்			கண்ணோட்டம்	இன்மையும்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Eyeless are they whose eyes with no benignant lustre shine; Who've eyes can never lack the light of grace benign.
Explanation: Explanation :Men without kind looks are men without eyes; those who (really) have eyes are also not devoid of kind looks.

Verse: கருமம்	சிதையாமல்	கண்ணோட	வல்லார்க்கு			உரிமை	உடைத்திவ்	வுலகு.
Translation: Translation :Who can benignant smile, yet leave no work undone; By them as very own may all the earth be won.
Explanation: Explanation :The world is theirs (kings) who are able to show kindness, without injury to their affairs, (administration of justice).

Verse: ஒறுத்தாற்றும்	பண்பினார்	கண்ணும்கண்	ணோடிப்			பொறுத்தாற்றும்	பண்பே	தலை.
Translation: Translation :To smile on those that vex, with kindly face, Enduring long, is most excelling grace.
Explanation: Explanation :Patiently to bear with, and show kindness to those who grieve us, is the most excellent of all dispositions.

Verse: பெயக்கண்டும்	நஞ்சுண்	டமைவர்	நயத்தக்க			நாகரிகம்	வேண்டு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :They drink with smiling grace, though poison interfused they see, Who seek the praise of all-esteemed courtesy.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who desire (to cultivate that degree of) urbanity which all shall love, even after swallowing the poison served to them by their friends, will be friendly with them.

Verse: ஒற்றும்	உரைசான்ற	நூலும்	இவையிரண்டும்			தெற்றென்க	மன்னவன்	கண்.
Translation: Translation :These two: the code renowned and spies, In these let king confide as eyes.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a king consider as his eyes these two things, a spy and a book (of laws) universally esteemed.

Verse: எல்லார்க்கும்	எல்லாம்	நிகழ்பவை	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			வல்லறிதல்	வேந்தன்	தொழில்.
Translation: Translation :Each day, of every subject every deed, 'Tis duty of the king to learn with speed.
Explanation: Explanation :It is the duty of a king to know quickly (by a spy) what all happens, daily, amongst all men.

Verse: ஒற்றினான்	ஒற்றிப்	பொருள்தெரியா	மன்னவன்			கொற்றங்	கொளக்கிடந்தது	இல்.
Translation: Translation :By spies who spies, not weighing things they bring, Nothing can victory give to that unwary king.
Explanation: Explanation :There is no way for a king to obtain conquests, who knows not the advantage of discoveries made by a spy.

Verse: வினைசெய்வார்	தம்சுற்றம்	வேண்டாதார்	என்றாங்கு			அனைவரையும்	ஆராய்வது	ஒற்று.
Translation: Translation :His officers, his friends, his enemies, All these who watch are trusty spies.
Explanation: Explanation :He is a spy who watches all men, to wit, those who are in the king's employment, his relatives, and his enemies.

Verse: கடாஅ	உருவொடு	கண்ணஞ்சாது	யாண்டும்			உகாஅமை	வல்லதே	ஒற்று.
Translation: Translation :Of unsuspected mien and all-unfearing eyes, Who let no secret out, are trusty spies.
Explanation: Explanation :A spy is one who is able to assume an appearance which may create no suspicion (in the minds of others), who fears no man's face, and who never reveals (his purpose).

Verse: துறந்தார்	படிவத்த	ராகி	இறந்தாராய்ந்து			என்செயினும்	சோர்விலது	ஒற்று.
Translation: Translation :As monk or devotee, through every hindrance making way, A spy, whate'er men do, must watchful mind display.
Explanation: Explanation :He is a spy who, assuming the appearance of an ascetic, goes into (whatever place he wishes), examines into (all, that is needful), and never discovers himself, whatever may be done to him.

Verse: மறைந்தவை	கேட்கவற்	றாகி	அறிந்தவை			ஐயப்பாடு	இல்லதே	ஒற்று.
Translation: Translation :A spy must search each hidden matter out, And full report must render, free from doubt.
Explanation: Explanation :A spy is one who is able to discover what is hidden and who retains no doubt concerning what he has known.

Verse: ஒற்றொற்றித்	தந்த	பொருளையும்	மற்றுமோர்			ஒற்றினால்	ஒற்றிக்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Spying by spies, the things they tell To test by other spies is well.
Explanation: Explanation :Let not a king receive the information which a spy has discovered and made known to him, until he has examined it by another spy.

Verse: ஒற்றெற்	றுணராமை	ஆள்க	உடன்மூவர்			சொற்றொக்க	தேறப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :One spy must not another see: contrive it so; And things by three confirmed as truth you know.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a king employ spies so that one may have no knowledge of the other; and when the information of three agrees together, let him receive it.

Verse: சிறப்பறிய	ஒற்ற஧ன்கண்	செய்யற்க	செய்யின்			புறப்படுத்தான்	ஆகும்	மறை.
Translation: Translation :Reward not trusty spy in others' sight, Or all the mystery will come to light.
Explanation: Explanation :Let not a king publicly confer on a spy any marks of his favour; if he does, he will divulge his own secret.

Verse: உடையர்	எனப்படுவது	ஊக்கம்	அஃதில்லார்			உடையது	உடையரோ	மற்று.
Translation: Translation :'Tis energy gives men o'er that they own a true control; They nothing own who own not energy of soul.
Explanation: Explanation :Energy makes out the man of property; as for those who are destitute of it, do they (really) possess what they possess ?

Verse: உள்ளம்	உடைமை	உடைமை	பொருளுடைமை			நில்லாது	நீங்கி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :The wealth of mind man owns a real worth imparts, Material wealth man owns endures not, utterly departs.
Explanation: Explanation :The possession of (energy of) mind is true property; the possession of wealth passes away and abides not.

Verse: க்கம்	இழந்தேமென்று	அல்லாவார்	ஊக்கம்			ஒருவந்தம்	கைத்துடை	யார்.
Translation: Translation :'Lost is our wealth,' they utter not this cry distressed, The men of firm concentred energy of soul possessed.
Explanation: Explanation :They who are possessed of enduring energy will not trouble themselves, saying, "we have lost our property."

Verse: க்கம்	அதர்வினாய்ச்	செல்லும்	அசைவிலா			ஊக்க	முடையா	னுழை.
Translation: Translation :The man of energy of soul inflexible, Good fortune seeks him out and comes a friend to dwell.
Explanation: Explanation :Wealth will find its own way to the man of unfailing energy.

Verse: வெள்ளத்	தனைய	மலர்நீட்டம்	மாந்தர்தம்			உள்ளத்	தனையது	உயர்வு.
Translation: Translation :With rising flood the rising lotus flower its stem unwinds; The dignity of men is measured by their minds.
Explanation: Explanation :The stalks of water-flowers are proportionate to the depth of water; so is men's greatness proportionate to their minds.

Verse: உள்ளுவ	தெல்லாம்	உயர்வுள்ளல்	மற்றது			தள்ளினுந்	தள்ளாமை	நீர்த்து.
Translation: Translation :Whate'er you ponder, let your aim be loftly still, Fate cannot hinder always, thwart you as it will.
Explanation: Explanation :In all that a king thinks of, let him think of his greatness; and if it should be thrust from him (by fate), it will have the nature of not being thrust from him.

Verse: சிதைவிடத்து	ஒல்கார்	உரவோர்	புதையம்பிற்			பட்டுப்பா	டூன்றுங்	களிறு.
Translation: Translation :The men of lofty mind quail not in ruin's fateful hour, The elephant retains his dignity mind arrows' deadly shower.
Explanation: Explanation :The strong minded will not faint, even when all is lost; the elephant stands firm, even when wounded by a shower of arrows.

Verse: உள்ளம்	இலாதவர்	எய்தார்	உலகத்து			வள்ளியம்	என்னுஞ்	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :The soulless man can never gain Th' ennobling sense of power with men.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have no (greatness of) mind, will not acquire the joy of saying in the world, "we have excercised liaberality".

Verse: பரியது	கூர்ங்கோட்டது	ஆயினும்	யானை			஦வ்ருஉம்	புலிதாக்	குறின்.
Translation: Translation :Huge bulk of elephant with pointed tusk all armed, When tiger threatens shrinks away alarmed!
Explanation: Explanation :Although the elephant has a large body, and a sharp tusk, yet it fears the attack of the tiger.

Verse: உரமொருவற்கு	உள்ள	வெறுக்கைஅஃ	தில்லார்			மரம்மக்க	ளாதலே	வேறு.
Translation: Translation :Firmness of soul in man is real excellance; Others are trees, their human form a mere pretence.
Explanation: Explanation :Energy is mental wealth; those men who are destitute of it are only trees in the form of men.

Verse: குடியென்னும்	குன்றா	விளக்கம்	மடியென்னும்			மாசூர	மாய்ந்து	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Of household dignity the lustre beaming bright, Flickers and dies when sluggish foulness dims its light.
Explanation: Explanation :By the darkness, of idleness, the indestructible lamp of family (rank) will be extinguished.

Verse: மடியை	மடியா	ஒழுகல்	குடியைக்			குடியாக	வேண்டு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Let indolence, the death of effort, die, If you'd uphold your household's dignity.
Explanation: Explanation :Let those, who desire that their family may be illustrious, put away all idleness from their conduct.

Verse: மடிமடிக்	கொண்டொழுகும்	பேதை	பிறந்த			குடிமடியும்	தன்னினும்	முந்து.
Translation: Translation :Who fosters indolence within his breast, the silly elf! The house from which he springs shall perish ere himself.
Explanation: Explanation :The (lustre of the) family of the ignorant man, who acts under the influence of destructive laziness will perish, even before he is dead.

Verse: குடிமடிந்து	குற்றம்	பெருகும்	மடிமடிந்து			மாண்ட	உஞற்றி	லவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :His family decays, and faults unheeded thrive, Who, sunk in sloth, for noble objects doth not strive.
Explanation: Explanation :Family (greatness) will be destroyed, and faults will increase, in those men who give way to laziness, and put forth no dignified exertions.

Verse: நெடுநீர்	மறவி	மடிதுயில்	நான்கும்			கெடுநீரார்	காமக்	கலன்.
Translation: Translation :Delay, oblivion, sloth, and sleep: these four Are pleasure-boat to bear the doomed to ruin's shore.
Explanation: Explanation :Procrastination, forgetfulness, idleness, and sleep, these four things, form the vessel which is desired by those destined to destruction.

Verse: படியுடையார்	பற்றமைந்தக்	கண்ணும்	மடியுடையார்			மாண்பயன்	எய்தல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Though lords of earth unearned possessions gain, The slothful ones no yield of good obtain.
Explanation: Explanation :It is a rare thing for the idle, even when possessed of the riches of kings who ruled over the whole earth, to derive any great benefit from it.

Verse: இடிபுரிந்து	எள்ளுஞ்சொல்	கேட்பர்	மடிபுரிந்து			மாண்ட	உஞற்றி	லவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who hug their sloth, nor noble works attempt, Shall bear reproofs and words of just contempt.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who through idleness, and do not engage themselves in dignified exertion, will subject themselves to rebukes and reproaches.

Verse: மடிமை	குடிமைக்கண்	தங்கின்தன்	ஒன்னார்க்கு			அடிமை	புகுத்தி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :If sloth a dwelling find mid noble family, Bondsmen to them that hate them shall they be.
Explanation: Explanation :If idleness take up its abode in a king of high birth, it will make him a slave of his enemies.

Verse: குடியாண்மை	யுள்வந்த	குற்றம்	ஒருவன்			மடியாண்மை	மாற்றக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Who changes slothful habits saves Himself from all that household rule depraves.
Explanation: Explanation :When a man puts away idleness, the reproach which has come upon himself and his family will disappear.

Verse: மடியிலா	மன்னவன்	எய்தும்	அடியளந்தான்			தாஅய	தெல்லாம்	ஒருங்கு.
Translation: Translation :The king whose life from sluggishness is rid, Shall rule o'er all by foot of mighty god bestrid.
Explanation: Explanation :The king who never gives way to idleness will obtain entire possession of (the whole earth) passed over by him who measured (the worlds) with His foot.

Verse: அருமை	உடைத்தென்று	அசாவாமை	வேண்டும்			பெருமை	முயற்சி	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Say not, 'Tis hard', in weak, desponding hour, For strenuous effort gives prevailing power.
Explanation: Explanation :Yield not to the feebleness which says, "this is too difficult to be done"; labour will give the greatness (of mind) which is necessary (to do it).

Verse: வினைக்கண்	வினைகெடல்	ஓம்பல்	வினைக்குறை			தீர்ந்தாரின்	தீர்ந்தன்று	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :In action be thou, 'ware of act's defeat; The world leaves those who work leave incomplete!
Explanation: Explanation :Take care not to give up exertion in the midst of a work; the world will abandon those who abandon their unfinished work.

Verse: தாளாண்மை	என்னும்	தகைமைக்கண்	தங்கிற்றே			வேளாண்மை	என்னுஞ்	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :In strenuous effort doth reside The power of helping others: noble pride!
Explanation: Explanation :The lustre of munificence will dwell only with the dignity of laboriousness or efforts.

Verse: தாளாண்மை	இல்லாதான்	வேளாண்மை	பேடிகை			வாளாண்மை	போலக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Beneficent intent in men by whom no strenuous work is wrought, Like battle-axe in sexless being's hand availeth nought.
Explanation: Explanation :The liberality of him, who does not labour, will fail, like the manliness of a hermaphrodite, who has a sword in its hand.

Verse: இன்பம்	விழையான்	வினைவிழைவான்	தன்கேளிர்			துன்பம்	துடைத்தூன்றும்	தூண்.
Translation: Translation :Whose heart delighteth not in pleasure, but in action finds delight, He wipes away his kinsmen's grief and stands the pillar of their might.
Explanation: Explanation :He who desires not pleasure, but desires labour, will be a pillar to sustain his relations, wiping away their sorrows.

Verse: முயற்சி	திருவினை	ஆக்கும்	முயற்றின்மை			இன்மை	புகுத்தி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :Effort brings fortune's sure increase, Its absence brings to nothingness.
Explanation: Explanation :Labour will produce wealth; idleness will bring poverty.

Verse: மடியுளாள்	மாமுகடி	என்ப	மடியிலான்			தாளுளான்	தாமரையி	னாள்.
Translation: Translation :In sluggishness is seen misfortune's lurid form, the wise declare; Where man unslothful toils, she of the lotus flower is there!
Explanation: Explanation :They say that the black Mudevi (the goddess of adversity) dwells with laziness, and the Latchmi (the goddess of prosperity) dwells with the labour of the industrious.

Verse: பொறியின்மை	யார்க்கும்	பழியன்று	அறிவறிந்து			ஆள்வினை	இன்மை	பழி.
Translation: Translation :'Tis no reproach unpropitious fate should ban; But not to do man's work is foul disgrace to man!
Explanation: Explanation :Adverse fate is no disgrace to any one; to be without exertion and without knowing what should be known, is disgrace.

Verse: தெய்வத்தான்	ஆகா	தெனினும்	முயற்சிதன்			மெய்வருத்தக்	கூலி	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Though fate-divine should make your labour vain; Effort its labour's sure reward will gain.
Explanation: Explanation :Although it be said that, through fate, it cannot be attained, yet labour, with bodily exertion, will yield its reward.

Verse: ஊழையும்	உப்பக்கம்	காண்பர்	உலைவின்றித்			தாழாது	உஞற்று	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who strive with undismayed, unfaltering mind, At length shall leave opposing fate behind.
Explanation: Explanation :They who labour on, without fear and without fainting will see even fate (put) behind their back.

Verse: இடுக்கண்	வருங்கால்	நகுக	அதனை			அடுத்தூர்வது	அஃதொப்ப	தில்.
Translation: Translation :Smile, with patient, hopeful heart, in troublous hour; Meet and so vanquish grief; nothing hath equal power.
Explanation: Explanation :If troubles come, laugh; there is nothing like that, to press upon and drive away sorrow.

Verse: வெள்ளத்	தனைய	இடும்பை	அறிவுடையான்			உள்ளத்தின்	உள்ளக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Though sorrow, like a flood, comes rolling on, When wise men's mind regards it,- it is gone.
Explanation: Explanation :A flood of troubles will be overcome by the (courageous) thought which the minds of the wise will entertain, even in sorrow.

Verse: இடும்பைக்கு	இடும்பை	படுப்பர்	இடும்பைக்கு			இடும்பை	படாஅ	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who griefs confront with meek, ungrieving heart, From them griefs, put to grief, depart.
Explanation: Explanation :They give sorrow to sorrow, who in sorrow do not suffer sorrow.

Verse: மடுத்தவா	யெல்லாம்	பகடன்னான்	உற்ற			இடுக்கண்	இடர்ப்பாடு	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Like bullock struggle on through each obstructed way; From such an one will troubles, troubled, roll away.
Explanation: Explanation :Troubles will vanish (i.e., will be troubled) before the man who (struggles against difficulties) as a buffalo (drawing a cart) through deep mire.

Verse: அடுக்கி	வரினும்	அழிவிலான்	உற்ற			இடுக்கண்	இடுக்கட்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :When griefs press on, but fail to crush the patient heart, Then griefs defeated, put to grief, depart.
Explanation: Explanation :The troubles of that man will be troubled (and disappear) who, however thickly they may come upon him, does not abandon (his purpose).

Verse: அற்றேமென்று	அல்லற்	படுபவோ	பெற்றேமென்று			ஓம்புதல்	தேற்றா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who boasted not of wealth, nor gave it all their heart, Will not bemoan the loss, when prosperous days depart.
Explanation: Explanation :Will those men ever cry out in sorrow, "we are destitute" who, (in their prosperity), give not way to (undue desire) to keep their wealth.

Verse: இலக்கம்	உடம்பிடும்பைக்	கென்று	கலக்கத்தைக்			கையாறாக்	கொள்ளாதாம்	மேல்.
Translation: Translation :'Man's frame is sorrow's target', the noble mind reflects, Nor meets with troubled mind the sorrows it expects.
Explanation: Explanation :The great will not regard trouble as trouble, knowing that the body is the butt of trouble.

Verse: இன்பம்	விழையான்	இடும்பை	இயல்பென்பான்			துன்பம்	உறுதல்	இலன்.
Translation: Translation :He seeks not joy, to sorrow man is born, he knows; Such man will walk unharmed by touch of human woes.
Explanation: Explanation :That man never experiences sorrow, who does not seek for pleasure, and who considers distress to be natural (to man).

Verse: இன்பத்துள்	இன்பம்	விழையாதான்	துன்பத்துள்			துன்பம்	உறுதல்	இலன்.
Translation: Translation :Mid joys he yields not heart to joys' control. Mid sorrows, sorrow cannot touch his soul.
Explanation: Explanation :He does not suffer sorrow, in sorrow who does not look for pleasure in pleasure.

Verse: இன்னாமை	இன்பம்	எனக்கொளின்	ஆகுந்தன்			ஒன்னார்	விழையுஞ்	சிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :Who pain as pleasure takes, he shall acquire The bliss to which his foes in vain aspire.
Explanation: Explanation :The elevation, which even his enemies will esteem, will be gained by him, who regards pain as pleasure.

Verse: கருவியும்	காலமும்	செய்கையும்	செய்யும்			அருவினையும்	மாண்டது	அமைச்சு.
Translation: Translation :A minister is he who grasps, with wisdom large, Means, time, work's mode, and functions rare he must discharge.
Explanation: Explanation :The minister is one who can make an excellent choice of means, time, manner of execution, and the difficult undertaking (itself).

Verse: வன்கண்	குடிகாத்தல்	கற்றறிதல்	ஆள்வினையோடு			ஐந்துடன்	மாண்டது	அமைச்சு.
Translation: Translation :A minister must greatness own of guardian power, determined mind, Learn'd wisdom, manly effort with the former five combined.
Explanation: Explanation :The minister is one who in addition to the aforesaid five things excels in the possession of firmness, protection of subjects, clearness by learning, and perseverance.

Verse: பிரித்தலும்	பேணிக்	கொளலும்	பிரிந்தார்ப்			பொருத்தலும்	வல்ல	தமைச்சு.
Translation: Translation :A minister is he whose power can foes divide, Attach more firmly friends, of severed ones can heal the breaches wide.
Explanation: Explanation :The minister is one who can effect discord (among foes), maintain the good-will of his friends and restore to friendship those who have seceded (from him).

Verse: தெரிதலும்	தேர்ந்து	செயலும்	ஒருதலையாச்			சொல்லலும்	வல்லது	அமைச்சு.
Translation: Translation :A minister has power to see the methods help afford, To ponder long, then utter calm conclusive word.
Explanation: Explanation :The minister is one who is able to comprehend (the whole nature of an undertaking), execute it in the best manner possible, and offer assuring advice (in time of necessity).

Verse: அறனறிந்து	ஆன்றமைந்த	சொல்லான்எஞ்	ஞான்றுந்			திறனறிந்தான்	தேர்ச்சித்	துணை.
Translation: Translation :The man who virtue knows, has use of wise and pleasant words. With plans for every season apt, in counsel aid affords.
Explanation: Explanation :He is the best helper (of the king) who understanding the duties, of the latter, is by his special learning, able to tender the fullest advice, and at all times conversant with the best method (of performing actions).

Verse: மதிநுட்பம்	நூலோடு	உடையார்க்கு	அதிநுட்பம்			யாவுள	முன்நிற்	பவை.
Translation: Translation :When native subtilty combines with sound scholastic lore, 'Tis subtilty surpassing all, which nothing stands before.
Explanation: Explanation :What (contrivances) are there so acute as to resist those who possess natural acuteness in addition to learning ?.

Verse: செயற்கை	அற஧ந்தக்	கடைத்தும்	உலகத்து			இயற்கை	அறிந்து	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Though knowing all that books can teach, 'tis truest tact To follow common sense of men in act.
Explanation: Explanation :Though you are acquainted with the (theoretical) methods (of performing an act), understand the ways of the world and act accordingly.

Verse: அறிகொன்று	அறியான்	எனினும்	உறுதி			உழையிருந்தான்	கூறல்	கடன்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis duty of the man in place aloud to say The very truth, though unwise king may cast his words away.
Explanation: Explanation :Although the king be utterly ignorant, it is the duty of the minister to give (him) sound advice.

Verse: பழுதெண்ணும்	மந்திரியின்	பக்கததுள்	தெவ்வோர்			எழுபது	கோடி	உறும்.
Translation: Translation :A minister who by king's side plots evil things Worse woes than countless foemen brings.
Explanation: Explanation :Far better are seventy crores of enemies (for a king) than a minister at his side who intends (his) ruin.

Verse: முறைப்படச்	சூழ்ந்தும்	முடிவிலவே	செய்வர்			திறப்பாடு	இலாஅ	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :For gain of end desired just counsel nought avails To minister, when tact in execution fails.
Explanation: Explanation :Those ministers who are destitute of (executive) ability will fail to carry out their projects, although they may have contrived aright.

Verse: நாநலம்	என்னும்	நலனுடைமை	அந்நலம்			யாநலத்து	உள்ளதூஉம்	அன்று.
Translation: Translation :A tongue that rightly speaks the right is greatest gain, It stands alone midst goodly things that men obtain.
Explanation: Explanation :The possession of that goodness which is called the goodness of speech is (even to others) better than any other goodness.

Verse: ஆக்கமுங்	கேடும்	அதனால்	வருதலால்			காத்தோம்பல்	சொல்லின்கட்	சோர்வு.
Translation: Translation :Since gain and loss in life on speech depend, From careless slip in speech thyself defend.
Explanation: Explanation :Since (both) wealth and evil result from (their) speech, ministers should most carefully guard themselves against faultiness therein.

Verse: கேட்டார்ப்	பிணிக்கும்	தகையவாய்க்	கேளாரும்			வேட்ப	மொழிவதாம்	சொல்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis speech that spell-bound holds the listening ear, While those who have not heard desire to hear.
Explanation: Explanation :The (minister's) speech is that which seeks (to express) elements as bind his friends (to himself) and is so delivered as to make even his enemies desire (his friendship).

Verse: திறனறிந்து	சொல்லுக	சொல்லை	அறனும்			பொருளும்	அதனினூஉங்கு	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Speak words adapted well to various hearers' state; No higher virtue lives, no gain more surely great.
Explanation: Explanation :Understand the qualities (of your hearers) and (then) make your speech; for superior to it, there is neither virtue nor wealth.

Verse: சொல்லுக	சொல்லைப்	பிறிதோர்சொல்	அச்சொல்லை			வெல்லுஞ்சொல்	இன்மை	அறிந்து.
Translation: Translation :Speak out your speech, when once 'tis past dispute That none can utter speech that shall your speech refute.
Explanation: Explanation :Deliver your speech, after assuring yourself that no counter speech can defeat your own.

Verse: வேட்பத்தாஞ்	சொல்லிப்	பிறர்சொல்	பயன்கோடல்			மாட்சியின்	மாசற்றார்	கோள்.
Translation: Translation :Charming each hearer's ear, of others' words to seize the sense, Is method wise of men of spotless excellence.
Explanation: Explanation :It is the opinion of those who are free from defects in diplomacy that the minister should speak so as to make his hearers desire (to hear more) and grasp the meaning of what he hears himself.

Verse: சொலல்வல்லன்	சோர்விலன்	அஞ்சான்	அவனை			இகல்வெல்லல்	யார்க்கும்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Mighty in word, of unforgetful mind, of fearless speech, 'Tis hard for hostile power such man to overreach.
Explanation: Explanation :It is impossible for any one to conquer him by intrique who possesses power of speech, and is neither faulty nor timid.

Verse: விரைந்து	தொழில்கேட்கும்	ஞாலம்	நிரந்தினிது			சொல்லுதல்	வல்லார்ப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :Swiftly the listening world will gather round, When men of mighty speech the weighty theme propound.
Explanation: Explanation :If there be those who can speak on various subjects in their proper order and in a pleasing manner, the world would readily accept them.

Verse: பலசொல்லக்	காமுறுவர்	மன்றமா	சற்ற			சிலசொல்லல்	தேற்றா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who have not skill ten faultless words to utter plain, Their tongues will itch with thousand words man's ears to pain.
Explanation: Explanation :They will desire to utter many words, who do not know how to speak a few faultless ones.

Verse: இண்ருழ்த்தும்	நாறா	மலரனையர்	கற்றது			உணர	விரித்துரையா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :Like scentless flower in blooming garland bound Are men who can't their lore acquired to other's ears expound.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who are unable to set forth their acquirements (before others) are like flowers blossoming in a cluster and yet without fragrance.

Verse: துணைநலம்	ஆக்கம்	த்ருஉம்	வினைநலம்			வேண்டிய	எல்லாந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :The good external help confers is worldly gain; By action good men every needed gift obtain.
Explanation: Explanation :The efficacy of support will yield (only) wealth; (but) the efficacy of action will yield all that is desired.

Verse: என்றும்	ஒருவுதல்	வேண்டும்	புகழொடு			நன்றி	பயவா	வினை.
Translation: Translation :From action evermore thyself restrain Of glory and of good that yields no gain.
Explanation: Explanation :Ministers should at all times avoid acts which, in addition to fame, yield no benefit (for the future).

Verse: ஒஓதல்	வேண்டும்	ஒளிமாழ்கும்	செய்வினை			ஆஅதும்	என்னு	மவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who tell themselves that nobler things shall yet be won All deeds that dim the light of glory must they shun.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who say, "we will become (better)" should avoid the performance of acts that would destroy (their fame).

Verse: இடுக்கண்	படினும்	இளிவந்த	செய்யார்			நடுக்கற்ற	காட்சி	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Though troubles press, no shameful deed they do, Whose eyes the ever-during vision view.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have infallible judgement though threatened with peril will not do acts which have brought disgrace (on former ministers).

Verse: எற்றென்று	இரங்குவ	செய்யற்க	செய்வானேல்			மற்றன்ன	செய்யாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :Do nought that soul repenting must deplore, If thou hast sinned, 'tis well if thou dost sin no more.
Explanation: Explanation :Let a minister never do acts of which he would have to grieve saying, "what is this I have done"; (but) should he do (them), it were good that he grieved not.

Verse: ஈன்றாள்	பசிகாண்பான்	ஆயினுஞ்	செய்யற்க			சான்றோர்	பழிக்கும்	வினை.
Translation: Translation :Though her that bore thee hung'ring thou behold, no deed Do thou, that men of perfect soul have crime decreed.
Explanation: Explanation :Though a minister may see his mother starve; let him do not act which the wise would (treat with contempt).

Verse: பழிமலைந்து	எய்திய	ஆக்கத்தின்	சான்றோர்			கழிநல்	குரவே	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Than store of wealth guilt-laden souls obtain, The sorest poverty of perfect soul is richer gain.
Explanation: Explanation :Far more excellent is the extreme poverty of the wise than wealth obtained by heaping up of sinful deeds.

Verse: கடிந்த	கடிந்தொரார்	செய்தார்க்கு	அவைதாம்			முடிந்தாலும்	பீழை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :To those who hate reproof and do forbidden thing. What prospers now, in after days shall anguish bring.
Explanation: Explanation :The actions of those, who have not desisted from doing deeds forbidden (by the great), will, even if they succeed, cause them sorrow.

Verse: அழக்கொண்ட	எல்லாம்	அழப்போம்	இழப்பினும்			பிற்பயக்கும்	நற்பா	லவை.
Translation: Translation :What's gained through tears with tears shall go; From loss good deeds entail harvests of blessings grow.
Explanation: Explanation :All that has been obtained with tears (to the victim) will depart with tears (to himself); but what has been by fair means; though with loss at first, will afterwards yield fruit.

Verse: சலத்தால்	பொருள்செய்தே	மார்த்தல்	பசுமண்			கலத்துள்நீர்	பெய்திரீஇ	யற்று.
Translation: Translation :In pot of clay unburnt he water pours and would retain, Who seeks by wrong the realm in wealth and safety to maintain.
Explanation: Explanation :(For a minister) to protect (his king) with wealth obtained by foul means is like preserving a vessel of wet clay by filling it with water.

Verse: வினைத்திட்பம்	என்பது	ஒருவன்	மனத்திட்பம்			மற்றைய	எல்லாம்	பிற.
Translation: Translation :What men call 'power in action' know for 'power of mind' Externe to man all other aids you find.
Explanation: Explanation :Firmness in action is (simply) one's firmness of mind; all other (abilities) are not of this nature.

Verse: ஊறொரால்	உற்றபின்	ஒல்காமை	இவ்விரண்டின்			ஆறென்பர்	ஆய்ந்தவர்	கோள்.
Translation: Translation :'Each hindrance shun', 'unyielding onward press, If obstacle be there,' These two define your way, so those that search out truth declare.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to perform a ruinous act, and not to be discouraged by the ruinous termination of an act, are the two maxims which, the wise say, from the principles of those who have investigated the subject.

Verse: கடைக்கொட்கச்	செய்தக்க	தாண்மை	இடைக்கொட்கின்			எற்றா	விழுமந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Man's fitting work is known but by success achieved; In midst the plan revealed brings ruin ne'er to be retrieved.
Explanation: Explanation :So to perform an act as to publish it (only) at its termination is (true) manliness; for to announce it beforehand, will cause irremediable sorrow.

Verse: சொல்லுதல்	யார்க்கும்	எளிய	அரியவாம்			சொல்லிய	வண்ணம்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Easy to every man the speech that shows the way; Hard thing to shape one's life by words they say!
Explanation: Explanation :To say (how an act is to be performed) is (indeed) easy for any one; but far difficult it is to do according to what has been said.

Verse: வீறெய்தி	மாண்டார்	வினைத்திட்பம்	வேந்தன்கண்			ஊறெய்தி	உள்ளப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :The power in act of men renowned and great, With king acceptance finds and fame through all the state.
Explanation: Explanation :The firmness in action of those who have become great by the excellence (of their counsel) will, by attaining its fulfilment in the person of the king, be esteemed (by all).

Verse: எண்ணிய	எண்ணியாங்கு	எய்து	எண்ணியார்			திண்ணியர்	ஆகப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :Whate'er men think, ev'n as they think, may men obtain, If those who think can steadfastness of will retain.
Explanation: Explanation :If those who have planned (an undertaking) possess firmness (in executing it) they will obtain what they have desired even as they have desired it.

Verse: உருவுகண்டு	எள்ளாமை	வேண்டும்	உருள்பெருந்தேர்க்கு			அச்சாணி	அன்னார்	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Despise not men of modest bearing; Look not at form, but what men are: For some there live, high functions sharing, Like linch-pin of the mighty car!
Explanation: Explanation :Let none be despised for (their) size; (for) the world has those who resemble the linch-pin of the big rolling car.

Verse: கலங்காது	கண்ட	வினைக்கண்	துளங்காது			தூக்கங்	கடிந்து	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :What clearly eye discerns as right, with steadfast will, And mind unslumbering, that should man fulfil.
Explanation: Explanation :An act that has been firmly resolved on must be as firmly carried out without delay.

Verse: துன்பம்	உறவரினும்	செய்க	துணிவாற்றி			இன்பம்	பயக்கும்	வினை.
Translation: Translation :Though toil and trouble face thee, firm resolve hold fast, And do the deeds that pleasure yield at last.
Explanation: Explanation :Though it should cause increasing sorrow (at the outset), do with firmness the act that yield bliss (in the end).

Verse: எனைத்திட்பம்	எய்தியக்	கண்ணும்	வினைத்திட்பம்			வேண்டாரை	வேண்டாது	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :The world desires not men of every power possessed, Who power in act desire not,- crown of all the rest.
Explanation: Explanation :The great will not esteem those who esteem not firmness of action, whatever other abilities the latter may possess.

Verse: சூழ்ச்சி	முடிவு	துணிவெய்தல்	அத்துணிவு			தாழ்ச்சியுள்	தங்குதல்	தீது.
Translation: Translation :Resolve is counsel's end, If resolutions halt In weak delays, still unfulfilled, 'tis grievous fault.
Explanation: Explanation :Consultation ends in forming a resolution (to act); (but) delay in the execution of that resolve is an evil.

Verse: தூங்குக	தூங்கிச்	செயற்பால	தூங்கற்க			தூங்காது	செய்யும்	வினை.
Translation: Translation :Slumber when sleepy work's in hand: beware Thou slumber not when action calls for sleepless care!
Explanation: Explanation :Sleep over such (actions) as may be slept over; (but) never over such as may not be slept over.

Verse: ஙல்லும்வா	யெல்லாம்	வினைநன்றே	ஒல்லாக்கால்			செல்லும்வாய்	நோக்கிச்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :When way is clear, prompt let your action be; When not, watch till some open path you see.
Explanation: Explanation :Whenever it is possible (to overcome your enemy) the act (of fighting) is certainly good; if not, endeavour to employ some more successful method.

Verse: வினைபகை	என்றிரண்டின்	எச்சம்	நினையுங்கால்			தீயெச்சம்	போலத்	தெறும்.
Translation: Translation :With work or foe, when you neglect some little thing, If you reflect, like smouldering fire, 'twill ruin bring.
Explanation: Explanation :When duly considered, the incomplete execution of an undertaking and hostility will grow and destroy one like the (unextinguished) remnant of a fire.

Verse: பொருள்கருவி	காலம்	வினையிடனொடு	ஐந்தும்			இருள்தீர	எண்ணிச்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Treasure and instrument and time and deed and place of act: These five, till every doubt remove, think o'er with care exact.
Explanation: Explanation :Do an act after a due consideration of the (following) five, viz. money, means, time, execution and place.

Verse: முடிவும்	இடையூறும்	முற்றியாங்கு	எய்தும்			படுபயனும்	பார்த்துச்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Accomplishment, the hindrances, large profits won By effort: these compare,- then let the work be done.
Explanation: Explanation :An act is to be performed after considering the exertion required, the obstacles to be encountered, and the great profit to be gained (on its completion).

Verse: செய்வினை	செய்வான்	செயன்முறை	அவ்வினை			உள்ளறிவான்	உள்ளம்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Who would succeed must thus begin: first let him ask The thoughts of them who thoroughly know the task.
Explanation: Explanation :The method of performance for one who has begun an act is to ascertain the mind of him who knows the secret thereof.

Verse: வினையான்	வினையாக்கிக்	கோடல்	நனைகவுள்			யானையால்	யானையாத்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :By one thing done you reach a second work's accomplishment; So furious elephant to snare its fellow brute is sent.
Explanation: Explanation :To make one undertaking the means of accomplishing another (similar to it) is like making one rutting elephant the means of capturing another.

Verse: நட்டார்க்கு	நல்ல	செயலின்	விரைந்ததே			ஒட்டாரை	ஒட்டிக்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Than kindly acts to friends more urgent thing to do, Is making foes to cling as friends attached to you.
Explanation: Explanation :One should rather hasten to secure the alliance of the foes (of one's foes) than perform good offices to one's friends.

Verse: உறைசிறியார்	உள்நடுங்கல்	அஞ்சிக்	குறைபெறின்			கொள்வர்	பெரியார்ப்	பணிந்து.
Translation: Translation :The men of lesser realm, fearing the people's inward dread, Accepting granted terms, to mightier ruler bow the head.
Explanation: Explanation :Ministers of small states, afraid of their people being frightened, will yield to and acknowledge their superior foes, if the latter offer them a chance of reconciliation.

Verse: அன்புடைமை	ஆன்ற	குடிப்பிறத்தல்	வேந்தவாம்			பண்புடைமை	தூதுரைப்பான்	பண்பு.
Translation: Translation :Benevolence high birth, the courtesy kings love:- These qualities the envoy of a king approve.
Explanation: Explanation :The qualification of an ambassador are affection (for his relations) a fitting birth, and the possession of attributes pleasing to royalty.

Verse: அன்பறிவு	ஆராய்ந்த	சொல்வன்மை	தூதுரைப்பார்க்கு			இன்றி	யமையாத	மூன்று.
Translation: Translation :Love, knowledge, power of chosen words, three things, Should he possess who speaks the words of kings.
Explanation: Explanation :Love (to his sovereign), knowledge (of his affairs), and a discriminating power of speech (before other sovereigns) are the three sine qua non qualifications of an ambassador.

Verse: நூலாருள்	நூல்வல்லன்	ஆகுதல்	வேலாருள்			வென்றி	வினையுரைப்பான்	பண்பு.
Translation: Translation :Mighty in lore amongst the learned must he be, Midst jav'lin-bearing kings who speaks the words of victory.
Explanation: Explanation :To be powerful in politics among those who are learned (in ethics) is the character of him who speaks to lance-bearing kings on matters of triumph (to his own sovereign).

Verse: அறிவுரு	வாராய்ந்த	கல்விஇம்	மூன்றன்			செறிவுடையான்	செல்க	வினைக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Sense, goodly grace, and knowledge exquisite. Who hath these three for envoy's task is fit.
Explanation: Explanation :He may go on a mission (to foreign rulers) who has combined in him all these three. viz., (natural) sense, an attractive bearing and well-tried learning.

Verse: தொகச்சொல்லித்	தூவாத	நீக்கி	நகச்சொல்லி			நன்றி	பயப்பதாந்	தூது.
Translation: Translation :In terms concise, avoiding wrathful speech, who utters pleasant word, An envoy he who gains advantage for his lord.
Explanation: Explanation :He is an ambassador who (in the presence of foreign rulers) speaks briefly, avoids harshness, talks so as to make them smile, and thus brings good (to his own sovereign).

Verse: கற்றுக்கண்	அஞ்சான்	செலச்சொல்லிக்	காலத்தால்			தக்கது	அறிவதாம்	தூது.
Translation: Translation :An envoy meet is he, well-learned, of fearless eye Who speaks right home, prepared for each emergency.
Explanation: Explanation :He is an ambassador who having studied (politics) talks impressively, is not afraid of angry looks, and knows (to employ) the art suited to the time.

Verse: கடனறிந்து	காலங்	கருதி	இடனறிந்து			எண்ணி	உரைப்பான்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :He is the best who knows what's due, the time considered well, The place selects, then ponders long ere he his errand tell.
Explanation: Explanation :He is chief (among ambassadors) who understands the proper decorum (before foreign princes), seeks the (proper) occasion, knows the (most suitable) place, and delivers his message after (due) consideration.

Verse: தூய்மை	துணைமை	துணிவுடைமை	இம்மூன்றின்			வாய்மை	வழியுரைப்பான்	பண்பு.
