Translation: Translation :Integrity, resources, soul determined, truthfulness. Who rightly speaks his message must these marks possess.
Explanation: Explanation :The qualifications of him who faithfully delivers his (sovereign's) message are purity, the support (of foreign ministers), and boldness, with truthfulness in addition to the (aforesaid) three.

Verse: விடுமாற்றம்	வேந்தர்க்கு	உரைப்பான்	வடுமாற்றம்			வாய்சேரா	வன்கணவன்.
Translation: Translation :His faltering lips must utter no unworthy thing, Who stands, with steady eye, to speak the mandates of his king.
Explanation: Explanation :He alone is fit to communicate (his sovereign's) reply, who possesses the firmness not to utter even inadvertently what may reflect discredit (on the latter).

Verse: இறுதி	பயப்பினும்	எஞ்சாது	இறைவற்கு			உறுதி	பயப்பதாம்	தூது.
Translation: Translation :Death to the faithful one his embassy may bring; To envoy gains assured advantage for his king.
Explanation: Explanation :He is the ambassador who fearlessly seeks his sovereign's good though it should cost him his life (to deliver his message).

Verse: அகலாது	அணுகாது	தீக்காய்வார்	போல்க			இகல்வேந்தர்ச்	சேர்ந்தொழுகு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Who warm them at the fire draw not too near, nor keep too much aloof; Thus let them act who dwell beneath of warlike kings the palace-roof.
Explanation: Explanation :Ministers who serve under fickle-minded monarchs should, like those who warm themselves at the fire, be neither (too) far, nor (too) near.

Verse: மன்னர்	விழைப	விழையாமை	மன்னரால்			மன்னிய	ஆக்கந்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :To those who prize not state that kings are wont to prize, The king himself abundant wealth supplies.
Explanation: Explanation :For ministers not to cover the things desired by their kings will through the kings themselves yield them everlasting wealth.

Verse: போற்றின்	அரியவை	போற்றல்	கடுத்தபின்			தேற்றுதல்	யார்க்கும்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :Who would walk warily, let him of greater faults beware; To clear suspicions once aroused is an achievement rare.
Explanation: Explanation :Ministers who would save themselves should avoid (the commission of) serious errors for if the king's suspicion is once roused, no one can remove it.

Verse: செவிச்சொல்லும்	சேர்ந்த	நகையும்	அவித்தொழுகல்			ஆன்ற	பெரியா	ரகத்து.
Translation: Translation :All whispered words and interchange of smiles repress, In presence of the men who kingly power possess.
Explanation: Explanation :While in the presence of the sovereign, ministers should neither whisper to nor smile at others.

Verse: எப்பொருளும்	ஓரார்	தொடரார்மற்	றப்பொருளை			விட்டக்கால்	கேட்க	மறை.
Translation: Translation :Seek not, ask not, the secret of the king to hear; But if he lets the matter forth, give ear!
Explanation: Explanation :(When the king is engaged) in secret counsel (with others), ministers should neither over-hear anything whatever nor pry into it with inquisitive questions, but (wait to) listen when it is divulged (by the king himself).

Verse: குறிப்பறிந்து	காலங்	கருதி	வெறுப்பில			வேண்டுப	வேட்பச்	சொலல்.
Translation: Translation :Knowing the signs, waiting for fitting time, with courteous care, Things not displeasing, needful things, declare.
Explanation: Explanation :Knowing the (king's disposition and seeking the right time, (the minister) should in a pleasing manner suggest things such as are desirable and not disagreeable.

Verse: வேட்பன	சொல்லி	வினையில	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			கேட்பினும்	சொல்லா	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Speak pleasant things, but never utter idle word; Not though by monarch's ears with pleasure heard.
Explanation: Explanation :Ministers should (always) give agreeable advice but on no occasion recommend useless actions, though requested (to do so).

Verse: இளையர்	இனமுறையர்	என்றிகழார்	நின்ற			ஒளியோடு	ஒழுகப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Say not, 'He's young, my kinsman,' despising thus your king; But reverence the glory kingly state doth bring.
Explanation: Explanation :Ministers should behave in accordance with the (Divine) light in the person of kings and not despise them saying, "He is our junior (in age) and connected with our family!".

Verse: கொளப்பட்டேம்	என்றெண்ணிக்	கொள்ளாத	செய்யார்			துளக்கற்ற	காட்சி	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :'We've gained his grace, boots nought what graceless acts we do', So deem not sages who the changeless vision view.
Explanation: Explanation :Those whose judgement is firm will not do what is disagreeable (to the sovereign) saying (within themselves) "We are esteemed by the king".

Verse: பழையம்	எனக்கருதிப்	பண்பல்ல	செய்யும்			கெழுதகைமை	கேடு	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Who think 'We're ancient friends' and do unseemly things; To these familiarity sure ruin brings.
Explanation: Explanation :The (foolish) claim with which a minister does unbecoming acts because of his (long) familiarity (with the king) will ensure his ruin.

Verse: கூறாமை	நோக்க஧க்	குறிப்பறிவான்	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			மாறாநீர்	வையக்	கணி.
Translation: Translation :Who knows the sign, and reads unuttered thought, the gem is he, Of earth round traversed by the changeless sea.
Explanation: Explanation :The minister who by looking (at the king) understands his mind without being told (of it), will be a perpetual ornament to the world which is surrounded by a never-drying sea.

Verse: ஐயப்	படாஅது	அகத்தது	உணர்வானைத்			தெய்வத்தோ	டொப்பக்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Undoubting, who the minds of men can scan, As deity regard that gifted man.
Explanation: Explanation :He is to be esteemed a god who is able to ascertain without a doubt what is within (one's mind).

Verse: குறிப்பிற்	குறிப்புணர்	வாரை	உறுப்பினுள்			யாது	கொடுத்தும்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Who by the sign the signs interprets plain, Give any member up his aid to gain.
Explanation: Explanation :The king should ever give whatever (is asked) of his belongings and secure him who, by the indications (of his own mind) is able to read those of another.

Verse: குறித்தது	கூறாமைக்	கொள்வாரோ	டேனை			உறுப்போ	ரனையரால்	வேறு.
Translation: Translation :Who reads what's shown by signs, though words unspoken be, In form may seem as other men, in function nobler far is he.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who understand one's thoughts without being informed (thereof) and those who do not, may (indeed) resemble one another bodily; still are they different (mentally).

Verse: குறிப்பிற்	குறிப்புணரா	வாயின்	உறுப்பினுள்			என்ன	பயத்தவோ	கண்.
Translation: Translation :By sign who knows not sings to comprehend, what gain, 'Mid all his members, from his eyes does he obtain?
Explanation: Explanation :Of what use are the eyes amongst one's members, if they cannot by their own indications dive those of another ?.

Verse: அடுத்தது	காட்டும்	பளிங்குபோல்	நெஞ்சம்			கடுத்தது	காட்டும்	முகம்.
Translation: Translation :As forms around in crystal mirrored clear we find, The face will show what's throbbing in the mind.
Explanation: Explanation :As the mirror reflects what is near so does the face show what is uppermost in the mind.

Verse: முகத்தின்	முதுக்குறைந்தது	உண்டோ	உவப்பினும்			காயினும்	தான்முந்	துறும்.
Translation: Translation :Than speaking countenance hath aught more prescient skill? Rejoice or burn with rage, 'tis the first herald still!
Explanation: Explanation :Is there anything so full of knowledge as the face ? (No.) it precedes the mind, whether (the latter is) pleased or vexed.

Verse: முகம்நோக்கி	நிற்க	அமையும்	அகம்நோக்கி			உற்ற	துணர்வார்ப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :To see the face is quite enough, in presence brought, When men can look within and know the lurking thought.
Explanation: Explanation :If the king gets those who by looking into his mind can understand (and remove) what has occurred (to him) it is enough that he stand looking at their face.

Verse: பகைமையும்	கேண்மையும்	கண்ணுரைக்கும்	கண்ணின்			வகைமை	உணர்வார்ப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :The eye speaks out the hate or friendly soul of man; To those who know the eye's swift varying moods to scan.
Explanation: Explanation :If a king gets ministers who can read the movements of the eye, the eyes (of foreign kings) will (themselves) reveal (to him) their hatred or friendship.

Verse: நுண்ணியம்	என்பார்	அளக்குங்கோல்	காணுங்கால்			கண்ணல்லது	இல்லை	பிற.
Translation: Translation :The men of keen discerning soul no other test apply (When you their secret ask) than man's revealing eye.
Explanation: Explanation :The measuring-rod of those (ministers) who say "we are acute" will on inquiry be found to be their (own) eyes and nothing else.

Verse: அவையறிநது	ஆராய்ந்து	சொல்லுக	சொல்லின்			தொகையறிந்த	தூய்மை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Men pure in heart, who know of words the varied force, Should to their audience known adapt their well-arranged discourse.
Explanation: Explanation :Let the pure who know the arrangement of words speak with deliberation after ascertaining (the nature of) the court (then assembled).

Verse: இடைதெரிந்து	நன்குணர்ந்து	சொல்லுக	சொல்லின்			நடைதெரிந்த	நன்மை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Good men to whom the arts of eloquence are known, Should seek occasion meet, and say what well they've made their own.
Explanation: Explanation :Let the good who know the uses of words speak with a clear knowledge after ascertaining the time (suited to the court).

Verse: அவையறியார்	சொல்லல்மேற்	கொள்பவர்	சொல்லின்			வகையறியார்	வல்லதூஉம்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Unversed in councils, who essays to speak. Knows not the way of suasive words,- and all is weak.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who undertake to speak without knowing the (nature of the) court are ignorant of the quality of words as well as devoid of the power (of learning).

Verse: ஒளியார்முன்	ஒள்ளிய	ராதல்	வெளியார்முன்			வான்சுதை	வண்ணம்	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Before the bright ones shine as doth the light! Before the dull ones be as purest stucco white!
Explanation: Explanation :Ministers should be lights in the assembly of the enlightned, but assume the pure whiteness of mortar (ignorance) in that of fools.

Verse: நன்றென்ற	வற்றுள்ளும்	நன்றே	முதுவருள்			முந்து	கிளவாச்	செறிவு.
Translation: Translation :Midst all good things the best is modest grace, That speaks not first before the elders' face.
Explanation: Explanation :The modesty by which one does not rush forward and speak in (an assembly of) superiors is the best among all (one's) good qualities.

Verse: ஆற்றின்	நிலைதளர்ந்	தற்றே	வியன்புலம்			ஏற்றுணர்வார்	முன்னர்	இழுக்கு.
Translation: Translation :As in the way one tottering falls, is slip before The men whose minds are filled with varied lore.
Explanation: Explanation :(For a minister) to blunder in the presence of those who have acquired a vast store of learning and know (the value thereof) is like a good man stumbling (and falling away) from the path (of virtue).

Verse: கற்றறிந்தார்	கல்வி	விளங்கும்	கசடறச்			சொல்தெரிதல்	வல்லார்	அகத்து.
Translation: Translation :The learning of the learned sage shines bright To those whose faultless skill can value it aright.
Explanation: Explanation :The learning of those who have read and understood (much) will shine in the assembly of those who faultlessly examine (the nature of) words.

Verse: உணர்வ	துடையார்முன்	சொல்லல்	வளர்வதன்			பாத்தியுள்	நீர்சொரிந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :To speak where understanding hearers you obtain, Is sprinkling water on the fields of growing grain!
Explanation: Explanation :Lecturing to those who have the ability to understand (for themselves) is like watering a bed of plants that are growing (of themselves).

Verse: புல்லவையுள்	பொச்சாந்தும்	சொல்லற்க	நல்லவையுள்			நன்குசலச்	சொல்லு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :In councils of the good, who speak good things with penetrating power, In councils of the mean, let them say nought, e'en in oblivious hour.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who are able to speak good things impressively in an assembly of the good should not even forgetfully speak them in that of the low.

Verse: அங்கணத்துள்	உக்க	அமிழ்தற்றால்	தங்கணத்தார்			அல்லார்முன்	கோட்டி	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Ambrosia in the sewer spilt, is word Spoken in presence of the alien herd.
Explanation: Explanation :To utter (a good word) in the assembly of those who are of inferior rank is like dropping nectar on the ground.

Verse: வகையறிந்து	வல்லவை	வாய்சோரார்	சொல்லின்			தொகையறிந்த	தூய்மை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :Men, pure in heart, who know of words the varied force, The mighty council's moods discern, nor fail in their discourse.
Explanation: Explanation :The pure who know the classification of words having first ascertained the nature (of the court) will not (through fear) falter in their speech before the powerful body.

Verse: கற்றாருள்	கற்றார்	எனப்படுவர்	கற்றார்முன்			கற்ற	செலச்சொல்லு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Who what they've learned, in penetrating words heve learned to say, Before the learn'd among the learn'd most learn'd are they.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who can agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned will be regarded as the most learned among the learned.

Verse: பகையகத்துச்	சாவார்	எளியர்	அரியர்			அவையகத்து	அஞ்சா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :Many encountering death in face of foe will hold their ground; Who speak undaunted in the council hall are rarely found.
Explanation: Explanation :Many indeed may (fearlessly) die in the presence of (their) foes; (but) few are those who are fearless in the assembly (of the learned).

Verse: கற்றார்முன்	கற்ற	செலச்சொல்லித்	தாம்கற்ற			மிக்காருள்	மிக்க	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :What you have learned, in penetrating words speak out before The learn'd; but learn what men more learn'd can teach you more.
Explanation: Explanation :(Ministers) should agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned and acquire more (knowledge) from their superiors (in learning).

Verse: ஆற்றின்	அளவறிந்து	கற்க	அவையஞ்சா			மாற்றங்	கொடுத்தற்	பொருட்டு.
Translation: Translation :By rule, to dialectic art your mind apply, That in the council fearless you may make an apt reply.
Explanation: Explanation :In order to reply fearlessly before a foreign court, (ministers) should learn logic according to the rules (of grammar).

Verse: வாளொடென்	வன்கண்ணர்	அல்லார்க்கு	நூலொடென்			நுண்ணவை	அஞ்சு	பவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :To those who lack the hero's eye what can the sword avail? Or science what, to those before the council keen who quail?
Explanation: Explanation :What have they to do with a sword who are not valiant, or they with learning who are afraid of an intelligent assembly ?

Verse: பகையகத்துப்	பேடிகை	ஒள்வாள்	அவையகத்து			அஞ்சு	மவன்கற்ற	நூல்.
Translation: Translation :As shining sword before the foe which 'sexless being' bears, Is science learned by him the council's face who fears.
Explanation: Explanation :The learning of him who is diffident before an assembly is like the shining sword of an hermaphrodite in the presence of his foes.

Verse: பல்லவை	கற்றும்	பயமிலரே	நல்லவையுள்			நன்கு	செலச்சொல்லா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :Though many things they've learned, yet useless are they all, To man who cannot well and strongly speak in council hall.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who cannot agreeably speak good things before a good assembly are indeed unprofitable persons inspite of all their various acquirements.

Verse: கல்லா	தவரின்	கடையென்ப	கற்றறிந்தும்			நல்லா	ரவையஞ்சு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Who, though they've learned, before the council of the good men quake, Than men unlearn'd a lower place must take.
Explanation: Explanation :They who, though they have learned and understood, are yet afraid of the assembly of the good, are said to be inferior (even) to the illiterate.

Verse: உளரெனினும்	இல்லாரொடு	ஒப்பர்	களன்அஞ்சிக்			கற்ற	செலச்சொல்லா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :Who what they've learned, in penetrating words know not to say, The council fearing, though they live, as dead are they.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who through fear of the assembly are unable to set forth their learning in an interesting manner, though alive, are yet like the dead.

Verse: தள்ளா	விளையுளும்	தக்காரும்	தாழ்விலாச்			செல்வரும்	சேர்வது	நாடு.
Translation: Translation :Where spreads fertility unfailing, where resides a band, Of virtuous men, and those of ample wealth, call that a 'land'
Explanation: Explanation :A kingdom is that in which (those who carry on) a complete cultivation, virtuous persons, and merchants with inexhaustible wealth, dwell together.

Verse: பெரும்பொருளால்	பெட்டக்க	தாகி	அருங்கேட்டால்			ஆற்ற	விளைவது	நாடு.
Translation: Translation :That is a 'land' which men desire for wealth's abundant share, Yielding rich increase, where calamities are rare.
Explanation: Explanation :A kingdom is that which is desire for its immense wealth, and which grows greatly in prosperity, being free from destructive causes.

Verse: பொறையொருங்கு	மேல்வருங்கால்	தாங்கி	இறைவற்கு			இறையொருங்கு	நேர்வது	நாடு.
Translation: Translation :When burthens press, it bears; Yet, With unfailing hand To king due tribute pays: that is the 'land'
Explanation: Explanation :A kingdom is that which can bear any burden that may be pressed on it (from adjoining kingdoms) and (yet) pay the full tribute to its sovereign.

Verse: உறுபசியும்	ஓவாப்	பிணியும்	செறுபகையும்			சேரா	தியல்வது	நாடு.
Translation: Translation :That is a 'land' whose peaceful annals know, Nor famine fierce, nor wasting plague, nor ravage of the foe.
Explanation: Explanation :A kingdom is that which continues to be free from excessive starvation, irremediable epidemics, and destructive foes.

Verse: பல்குழுவும்	பாழ்செய்யும்	உட்பகையும்	வேந்தலைக்கும்			கொல்குறும்பும்	இல்லத
Translation: Translation :From factions free, and desolating civil strife, and band Of lurking murderers that king afflict, that is the 'land'.
Explanation: Explanation :A kingdom is that which is without various (irregular) associations, destructive internal enemies, and murderous savages who (sometimes) harass the sovereign.

Verse: கேடறியாக்	கெட்ட	இடத்தும்	வளங்குன்றா			நாடென்ப	நாட்டின்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Chief of all lands is that, where nought disturbs its peace; Or, if invaders come, still yields its rich increase.
Explanation: Explanation :The learned say that the best kingdom is that which knows no evil (from its foes), and, if injured (at all), suffers no diminution in its fruitfulness.

Verse: இருபுனலும்	வாய்ந்த	மலையும்	வருபுனலும்			வல்லரணும்	நாட்டிற்கு	உறுப்பு.
Translation: Translation :Waters from rains and springs, a mountain near, and waters thence; These make a land, with fortress' sure defence.
Explanation: Explanation :The constituents of a kingdom are the two waters (from above and below), well situated hills and an undestructible fort.

Verse: பிணியின்மை	செல்வம்	விளைவின்பம்	ஏமம்			அணியென்ப	நாட்டிவ்	வைந்து.
Translation: Translation :A country's jewels are these five: unfailing health, Fertility, and joy, a sure defence, and wealth.
Explanation: Explanation :Freedom from epidemics, wealth, produce, happiness and protection (to subjects); these five, the learned, say, are the ornaments of a kingdom.

Verse: நாடென்ப	நாடா	வளத்தன	நாடல்ல			நாட	வளந்தரு	நாடு.
Translation: Translation :That is a land that yields increase unsought, That is no land whose gifts with toil are bought.
Explanation: Explanation :The learned say that those are kingdom whose wealth is not laboured for, and those not, whose wealth is only obtained through labour.

Verse: ஆங்கமை	வெய்தியக்	கண்ணும்	பயமின்றே			வேந்தமை	வில்லாத	நாடு.
Translation: Translation :Though blest with all these varied gifts' increase, A land gains nought that is not with its king at peace.
Explanation: Explanation :Although in possession of all the above mentioned excellences, these are indeed of no use to a country, in the absence of harmony between the sovereign and the sujects.

Verse: ஆற்று	பவர்க்கும்	அரண்பொருள்	அஞ்சித்தற்			போற்று	பவர்க்கும்	பொருள்.
Translation: Translation :A fort is wealth to those who act against their foes; Is wealth to them who, fearing, guard themselves from woes.
Explanation: Explanation :A fort is an object of importance to those who march (against their foes) as well as to those who through fear (of pursuers) would seek it for shelter.

Verse: மணிநீரும்	மண்ணும்	மலையும்	அணிநிழற்			காடும்	உடைய	தரண்.
Translation: Translation :A fort is that which owns fount of waters crystal clear, An open space, a hill, and shade of beauteous forest near.
Explanation: Explanation :A fort is that which has everlasting water, plains, mountains and cool shady forests.

Verse: உயர்வகலம்	திண்மை	அருமைஇந்	நான்கின்			அமைவரண்	என்றுரைக்கும்	நூல்.
Translation: Translation :Height, breadth, strength, difficult access: Science declares a fort must these possess.
Explanation: Explanation :The learned say that a fortress is an enclosure having these four (qualities) viz., height, breadth, strength and inaccessibility.

Verse: சிறுகாப்பிற்	பேரிடத்த	தாகி	உறுபகை			ஊக்கம்	அழிப்ப	தரண்.
Translation: Translation :A fort must need but slight defence, yet ample be, Defying all the foeman's energy.
Explanation: Explanation :A fort is that which has an extensive space within, but only small places to be guarded, and such as can destroy the courage of besieging foes.

Verse: கொளற்கரிதாய்க்	கொண்டகூழ்த்	தாகி	அகத்தார்			நிலைக்கெளிதாம்	நீரது	அரண்.
Translation: Translation :Impregnable, containing ample stores of food, A fort for those within, must be a warlike station good.
Explanation: Explanation :A fort is that which cannot be captured, which abounds in suitable provisions, and affords a position of easy defence to its inmates.

Verse: எல்லாப்	பொருளும்	உடைத்தாய்	இடத்துதவும்			நல்லாள்	உடையது	அரண்.
Translation: Translation :A fort, with all munitions amply stored, In time of need should good reserves afford.
Explanation: Explanation :A fort is that which has all (needful) things, and excellent heroes that can help it against destruction (by foes).

Verse: முற்றியும்	முற்றா	தெறிந்தும்	அறைப்படுத்தும்			பற்றற்	கரியது	அரண்.
Translation: Translation :A fort should be impregnable to foes who gird it round, Or aim there darts from far, or mine beneath the ground.
Explanation: Explanation :A fort is that which cannot be captured by blockading, assaulting, or undermining it.

Verse: முற்றாற்றி	முற்றி	யவரையும்	பற்றாற்றிப்			பற்றியார்	வெல்வது	அரண்.
Translation: Translation :Howe'er the circling foe may strive access to win, A fort should give the victory to those who guard within.
Explanation: Explanation :That is a fort whose inmates are able to overcome without losing their ground, even abler men who have besieged it.

Verse: முனைமுகத்து	மாற்றலர்	சாய	வினைமுகத்து			வீறெய்தி	மாண்ட	தரண்.
Translation: Translation :At outset of the strife a fort should foes dismay; And greatness gain by deeds in every glorious day.
Explanation: Explanation :A fort is that which derives excellence from the stratagems made (by its inmates) to defeat their enemies in the battlefield.

Verse: எனைமாட்சித்	தாகியக்	கண்ணும்	வினைமாட்சி			இல்லார்கண்	இல்லது	அரண்.
Translation: Translation :Howe'er majestic castled walls may rise, To craven souls no fortress strength supplies.
Explanation: Explanation :Although a fort may possess all (the above-said) excellence, it is, as it were without these, if its inmates possess not the excellence of action.

Verse: பொருளல்	லவரைப்	பொருளாகச்	செய்யும்			பொருளல்லது	இல்லை	பொருள்.
Translation: Translation :Nothing exists save wealth, that can Change man of nought to worthy man.
Explanation: Explanation :Besides wealth there is nothing that can change people of no importance into those of (some) importance.

Verse: இல்லாரை	எல்லாரும்	எள்ளுவர்	செல்வரை			எல்லாரும்	செய்வர்	சிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :Those who have nought all will despise; All raise the wealthy to the skies.
Explanation: Explanation :All despise the poor; (but) all praise the rich.

Verse: பொருளென்னும்	பொய்யா	விளக்கம்	இருளறுக்கும்			எண்ணிய	தேயத்துச்	சென்று.
Translation: Translation :Wealth, the lamp unfailing, speeds to every land, Dispersing darkness at its lord's command.
Explanation: Explanation :The imperishable light of wealth goes into regions desired (by its owner) and destroys the darkness (of enmity therein).

Verse: அறன்ஈனும்	இன்பமும்	ஈனும்	திறனறிந்து			தீதின்றி	வந்த	பொருள்.
Translation: Translation :Their wealth, who blameless means can use aright, Is source of virtue and of choice delight.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth acquired with a knowledge of the proper means and without foul practices will yield virtue and happiness.

Verse: அருளொடும்	அன்பொடும்	வாராப்	பொருளாக்கம்			புல்லார்	புரள	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Wealth gained by loss of love and grace, Let man cast off from his embrace.
Explanation: Explanation :(Kings) should rather avoid than seek the accumulation of wealth which does not flow in with mercy and love.

Verse: உறுபொருளும்	உல்கு	பொருளும்தன்	ஒன்னார்த்			தெறுபொருளும்	வேந்தன்	பொருள்.
Translation: Translation :Wealth that falls to him as heir, wealth from the kingdom's dues, The spoils of slaughtered foes; these are the royal revenues.
Explanation: Explanation :Unclaimed wealth, wealth acquired by taxes, and wealth (got) by conquest of foes are (all) the wealth of the king.

Verse: அருளென்னும்	அன்பீன்	குழவி	பொருளென்னும்			செல்வச்	செவிலியால்	உண்டு.
Translation: Translation :'Tis love that kindliness as offspring bears: And wealth as bounteous nurse the infant rears.
Explanation: Explanation :The child mercy which is borne by love grows under the care of the rich nurse of wealth.

Verse: குன்றேறி	யானைப்போர்	கண்டற்றால்	தன்கைத்தொன்று			உண்டாகச்	செய்வான்	வினை.
Translation: Translation :As one to view the strife of elephants who takes his stand, On hill he's climbed, is he who works with money in his hand.
Explanation: Explanation :An undertaking of one who has wealth in one's hands is like viewing an elephant-fight from a hill-top.

Verse: செய்க	பொருளைச்	செறுநர்	செருக்கறுக்கும்			எஃகதனிற்	கூரிய	தில்.
Translation: Translation :Make money! Foeman's insolence o'ergrown To lop away no keener steel is known.
Explanation: Explanation :Accumulate wealth; it will destroy the arrogance of (your) foes; there is no weapon sharper than it.

Verse: ஒண்பொருள்	காழ்ப்ப	இயற்றியார்க்கு	எண்பொருள்			ஏனை	இரண்டும்	ஒருங்கு.
Translation: Translation :Who plenteous store of glorious wealth have gained, By them the other two are easily obtained.
Explanation: Explanation :To those who have honestly acquired an abundance of riches, the other two, (virtue and pleasure) are things easy (of acquisition).

Verse: உறுப்பமைந்து	ஊறஞ்சா	வெல்படை	வேந்தன்			வெறுக்கையுள்	எல்லாம்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :A conquering host, complete in all its limbs, that fears no wound, Mid treasures of the king is chiefest found.
Explanation: Explanation :The army which is complete in (its) parts and conquers without fear of wounds is the chief wealth of the king.

Verse: உலைவிடத்து	ஊறஞ்சா	வன்கண்	தொலைவிடத்துத்			தொல்படைக்	கல்லால்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :In adverse hour, to face undaunted might of conquering foe, Is bravery that only veteran host can show.
Explanation: Explanation :Ancient army can alone have the valour which makes it stand by its king at the time of defeat, fearless of wounds and unmindful of its reduced strength.

Verse: ஒலித்தக்கால்	என்னாம்	உவரி	எலிப்பகை			நாகம்	உயிர்ப்பக்	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :Though, like the sea, the angry mice send forth their battle cry; What then? The dragon breathes upon them, and they die!
Explanation: Explanation :What if (a host of) hostile rats roar like the sea ? They will perish at the mere breath of the cobra.

Verse: அழிவின்றி	அறைபோகா	தாகி	வழிவந்த			வன்க	ணதுவே	படை.
Translation: Translation :That is a host, by no defeats, by no desertions shamed, For old hereditary courage famed.
Explanation: Explanation :That indeed is an army which has stood firm of old without suffering destruction or deserting (to the enemy).

Verse: கூற்றுடன்று	மேல்வரினும்	கூடி	எதிர்நிற்கும்			ஆற்ற	லதுவே	படை.
Translation: Translation :That is a 'host' that joins its ranks, and mightily withstands, Though death with sudden wrath should fall upon its bands.
Explanation: Explanation :That indeed is an army which is capable of offering a united resistance, even if Yama advances against it with fury.

Verse: மறமானம்	மாண்ட	வழிச்செலவு	தேற்றம்			எனநான்கே	ஏமம்	படைக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Valour with honour, sure advance in glory's path, with confidence; To warlike host these four are sure defence.
Explanation: Explanation :Valour, honour, following in the excellent-footsteps (of its predecessors) and trust-worthiness; these four alone constitute the safeguard of an army.

Verse: தார்தாங்கிச்	செல்வது	தானை	தலைவந்த			போர்தாங்கும்	தன்மை	அறிந்து.
Translation: Translation :A valiant army bears the onslaught, onward goes, Well taught with marshalled ranks to meet their coming foes.
Explanation: Explanation :That is an army which knowing the art of warding off an impending struggle, can bear against the dust-van (of a hostile force).

Verse: அடல்தகையும்	ஆற்றலும்	இல்லெனினும்	தானை			படைத்தகையால்	பாடு	பெறும்.
Translation: Translation :Though not in war offensive or defensive skilled; An army gains applause when well equipped and drilled.
Explanation: Explanation :Though destitute of courage to fight and strength (to endure), an army may yet gain renown by the splendour of its appearance.

Verse: சிறுமையும்	செல்லாத்	துனியும்	வறுமையும்			இல்லாயின்	வெல்லும்	படை.
Translation: Translation :Where weakness, clinging fear and poverty Are not, the host will gain the victory.
Explanation: Explanation :An army can triumph (over its foes) if it is free from diminution; irremediable aversion and poverty.

Verse: நிலைமக்கள்	சால	உடைத்தெனினும்	தானை			தலைமக்கள்	இல்வழி	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Though men abound, all ready for the war, No army is where no fit leaders are.
Explanation: Explanation :Though an army may contain a large number of permanent soldiers, it cannot last if it has no generals.

Verse: என்னைமுன்	நில்லன்மின்	தெவ்விர்	பலரென்னை			முன்நின்று	கல்நின்	றவர்.
Translation: Translation :Ye foes! stand not before my lord! for many a one Who did my lord withstand, now stands in stone!
Explanation: Explanation :O my foes, stand not before my leader; (for) many are those who did so but afterwards stood (in the shape of) statues.

Verse: கான	முயலெய்த	அம்பினில்	யானை			பிழைத்தவேல்	ஏந்தல்	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :Who aims at elephant, though dart should fail, has greater praise. Than he who woodland hare with winged arrow slays.
Explanation: Explanation :It is more pleasant to hold the dart that has missed an elephant than that which has hit hare in the forest.

Verse: பேராண்மை	என்ப	தறுகண்ஒன்	றுற்றக்கால்			ஊராண்மை	மற்றதன்	எஃகு.
Translation: Translation :Fierceness in hour of strife heroic greatness shows; Its edge is kindness to our suffering foes.
Explanation: Explanation :The learned say that fierceness (incontest with a foe) is indeed great valour; but to become a benefactor in case of accident (to a foe) is the extreme (limit) of that valour.

Verse: கைவேல்	களிற்றொடு	போக்கி	வருபவன்			மெய்வேல்	பறியா	நகும்.
Translation: Translation :At elephant he hurls the dart in hand; for weapon pressed, He laughs and plucks the javelin from his wounded breast.
Explanation: Explanation :The hero who after casting the lance in his hand on an elephant, comes (in search of another) will pluck the one (that sticks) in his body and laugh (exultingly).

Verse: விழித்தகண்	வேல்கொண	டெறிய	அழித்திமைப்பின்			ஒட்டன்றோ	வன்க	ணவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :To hero fearless must it not defeat appear, If he but wink his eye when foemen hurls his spear.
Explanation: Explanation :Is it not a defeat to the valiant to wink and destroy their ferocious look when a lance in cast at them (by their foe) ?

Verse: விழுப்புண்	படாதநாள்	எல்லாம்	வழுக்கினுள்			வைக்கும்தன்	நாளை	எடுத்து.
Translation: Translation :The heroes, counting up their days, set down as vain Each day when they no glorious wound sustain.
Explanation: Explanation :The hero will reckon among wasted days all those on which he had not received severe wounds.

Verse: சுழலும்	இசைவேண்டி	வேண்டா	உயிரார்			கழல்யாப்புக்	காரிகை	நீர்த்து.
Translation: Translation :Who seek for world-wide fame, regardless of their life, The glorious clasp adorns, sign of heroic strife.
Explanation: Explanation :The fastening of ankle-ring by those who disire a world-wide renown and not (the safety of) their lives is like adorning (themselves).

Verse: உறின்உயிர்	அஞ்சா	மறவர்	இறைவன்			செறினும்	சீர்குன்றல்	இலர்.
Translation: Translation :Fearless they rush where'er 'the tide of battle rolls'; The king's reproof damps not the ardour of their eager souls.
Explanation: Explanation :The heroes who are not afraid of losing their life in a contest will not cool their ardour, even if the king prohibits (their fighting).

Verse: இழைத்தது	இகவாமைச்	சாவாரை	யாரே			பிழைத்தது	ஒறுக்கிற்	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who says they err, and visits them scorn, Who die and faithful guard the vow they've sworn?
Explanation: Explanation :Who would reproach with failure those who seal their oath with their death ?

Verse: புரந்தார்கண்	நீர்மல்கச்	சாகிற்பின்	சாக்காடு			இரந்துகோள்	தக்கது	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :If monarch's eyes o'erflow with tears for hero slain, Who would not beg such boon of glorious death to gain?
Explanation: Explanation :If (heroes) can so die as to fill with tears the eyes of their rulers, such a death deserves to be obtained even by begging.

Verse: செயற்கரிய	யாவுள	நட்பின்	அதுபோல்			வினைக்கரிய	யாவுள	காப்பு.
Translation: Translation :What so hard for men to gain as friendship true? What so sure defence 'gainst all that foe can do?
Explanation: Explanation :What things are there so difficult to acquire as friendship ? What guards are there so difficult to break through by the efforts (of one's foes) ?

Verse: நிறைநீர	நீரவர்	கேண்மை	பிறைமதிப்			பின்னீர	பேதையார்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Friendship with men fulfilled of good Waxes like the crescent moon; Friendship with men of foolish mood, Like the full orb, waneth soon.
Explanation: Explanation :The friendship of the wise waxes like the new moon; (but) that of fools wanes like the full moon.

Verse: நவில்தொறும்	நூல்நயம்	போலும்	பயில்தொறும்			பண்புடை	யாளர்	தொடர்பு.
Translation: Translation :Learned scroll the more you ponder, Sweeter grows the mental food; So the heart by use grows fonder, Bound in friendship with the good.
Explanation: Explanation :Like learning, the friendship of the noble, the more it is cultivated, the more delightful does it become.

Verse: நகுதற்	பொருட்டன்று	நட்டல்	மிகுதிக்கண்			மேற்செனறு	இடித்தற்	பொருட்டு.
Translation: Translation :Nor for laughter only friendship all the pleasant day, But for strokes of sharp reproving, when from right you stray.
Explanation: Explanation :Friendship is to be practised not for the purpose of laughing but for that of being beforehand in giving one another sharp rebukes in case of transgression.

Verse: புணர்ச்சி	பழகுதல்	வேண்டா	உணர்ச்சிதான்			நட்பாங்	கிழமை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Not association constant, not affection's token bind; 'Tis the unison of feeling friends unites of kindred mind.
Explanation: Explanation :Living together and holding frequent intercourse are not necessary (for friendship); (mutual) understanding can alone create a claim for it.

Verse: முகநக	நட்பது	நட்பன்று	நெஞ்சத்து			அகநக	நட்பது	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Not the face's smile of welcome shows the friend sincere, But the heart's rejoicing gladness when the friend is near.
Explanation: Explanation :The love that dwells (merely in the smiles of the face is not friendship; (but) that which dwells deep in the smiles of the heart is true friendship.

Verse: அழிவி	னவைநீக்கி	ஆறுய்த்து	அழிவின்கண்			அல்லல்	உழப்பதாம்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Friendship from ruin saves, in way of virtue keeps; In troublous time, it weeps with him who weeps.
Explanation: Explanation :(True) friendship turns aside from evil (ways) makes (him) walk in the (good) way, and, in case of loss if shares his sorrow (with him).

Verse: உடுக்கை	இழந்தவன்	கைபோல	ஆங்கே			இடுக்கண்	களைவதாம்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :As hand of him whose vesture slips away, Friendship at once the coming grief will stay.
Explanation: Explanation :(True) friendship hastens to the rescue of the afflicted (as readily) as the hand of one whose garment is loosened (before an assembly).

Verse: நட்பிற்கு	வீற்றிருக்கை	யாதெனின்	கொட்பின்றி			ஒல்லும்வாய்	ஊன்றும்	நிலை.
Translation: Translation :And where is friendship's royal seat? In stable mind, Where friend in every time of need support may find.
Explanation: Explanation :Friendship may be said to be on its throne when it possesses the power of supporting one at all times and under all circumstances, (in the practice or virtue and wealth).

Verse: இனையர்	இவரெமக்கு	இன்னம்யாம்	என்று			புனையினும்	புல்லென்னும்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Mean is the friendship that men blazon forth, 'He's thus to me' and 'such to him my worth'.
Explanation: Explanation :Though friends may praise one another saying, "He is so intimate with us, and we so much (with him)"; (still) such friendship will appear mean.

Verse: நாடாது	நட்டலிற்	கேடில்லை	நட்டபின்			வீடில்லை	நட்பாள்	பவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :To make an untried man your friend is ruin sure; For friendship formed unbroken must endure.
Explanation: Explanation :As those who are of a friendly nature will not forsake (a friend) after once loving (him), there is no evil so great as contracting a friendship without due inquiry.

Verse: ஆய்ந்தாய்ந்து	கொள்ளாதான்	கேண்மை	கடைமுறை			தான்சாம்	துயரம்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Alliance with the man you have not proved and proved again, In length of days will give you mortal pain.
Explanation: Explanation :The friendship contracted by him who has not made repeated inquiry will in the end grieve (him) to death.

Verse: குணமும்	குடிமையும்	குற்றமும்	குன்றா			இனனும்	அறிந்தியாக்க	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Temper, descent, defects, associations free From blame: know these, then let the man be friend to thee.
Explanation: Explanation :Make friendship (with one) after ascertaining (his) character, birth, defects and the whole of one's relations.

Verse: குடிப்பிறந்து	தன்கண்	பழிநாணு	வானைக்			கொடுத்தும்	கொளல்வேண்டும்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Who, born of noble race, from guilt would shrink with shame, Pay any price so you as friend that man may claim.
Explanation: Explanation :The friendship of one who belongs to a (good) family and is afraid of (being charged with) guilt, is worth even purchasing.

Verse: அழச்சொல்லி	அல்லது	இடித்து	வழக்கறிய			வல்லார்நடபு	ஆய்ந்து	கொளல்.
Translation: Translation :Make them your chosen friend whose words repentance move, With power prescription's path to show, while evil they reprove.
Explanation: Explanation :You should examine and secure the friendship of those who can speak so as to make you weep over a crime (before its commission) or rebuke you severely (after you have done it) and are able to teach you (the ways of) the world.

Verse: கேட்டினும்	உண்டோர்	உறுதி	கிளைஞரை			நீட்டி	அளப்பதோர்	கோல்.
Translation: Translation :Ruin itself one blessing lends: 'Tis staff that measures out one's friends.
Explanation: Explanation :Even in ruin there is some good; (for) it is a rod by which one may measure fully (the affection of one's) relations.

Verse: ஊதியம்	என்பது	ஒருவற்குப்	பேதையார்			கேண்மை	ஒரீஇ	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis gain to any man, the sages say, Friendship of fools to put away.
Explanation: Explanation :It is indead a gain for one to renounce the friendship of fools.

Verse: உள்ளற்க	உள்ளம்	சிறுகுவ	கொள்ளற்க			அல்லற்கண்	ஆற்றறுப்பார்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Think not the thoughts that dwarf the soul; nor take For friends the men who friends in time of grief forsake.
Explanation: Explanation :Do not think of things that discourage your mind, nor contract friendship with those who would forsake you in adversity.

Verse: கெடுங்காலைக்	கைவிடுவார்	கேண்மை	அடுங்காலை			உள்ளினும்	உள்ளஞ்	சுடும்.
Translation: Translation :Of friends deserting us on ruin's brink, 'Tis torture e'en in life's last hour to think.
Explanation: Explanation :The very thought of the friendship of those who have deserted one at the approach of adversity will burn one's mind at the time of death.

Verse: மருவுக	மாசற்றார்	கேண்மைஒன்	றீத்தும்			ஒருவுக	ஒப்பிலார்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Cling to the friendship of the spotless one's; whate'er you pay. Renounce alliance with the men of evil way.
Explanation: Explanation :Continue to enjoy the friendship of the pure; (but) renounce even with a gift, the friendship of those who do not agree (with the world).

Verse: பழைமை	எனப்படுவது	யாதெனின்	யாதும்			கிழமையைக்	கீழ்ந்திடா	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Familiarity is friendship's silent pact, That puts restraint on no familiar act.
Explanation: Explanation :Imtimate friendship is that which cannot in the least be injured by (things done through the) right (of longstanding intimacy).

Verse: நட்பிற்	குறுப்புக்	கெழுதகைமை	மற்றதற்கு			உப்பாதல்	சான்றோர்	கடன்.
Translation: Translation :Familiar freedom friendship's very frame supplies; To be its savour sweet is duty of the wise.
Explanation: Explanation :The constituents of friendship are (things done through) the right of intimacy; to be pleased with such a right is the duty of the wise.

Verse: பழகிய	நட்பெவன்	செய்யுங்	கெழுதகைமை			செய்தாங்கு	அமையாக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :When to familiar acts men kind response refuse, What fruit from ancient friendship's use?
Explanation: Explanation :Of what avail is long-standing friendship, if friends do not admit as their own actions done through the right of intimacy ?

Verse: விழைதகையான்	வேண்டி	இருப்பர்	கெழுதகையாற்			கேளாது	நட்டார்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :When friends unbidden do familiar acts with loving heart, Friends take the kindly deed in friendly part.
Explanation: Explanation :If friends, through the right of friendship, do (anything) without being asked, the wise will be pleased with them on account of its desirability.

Verse: பேதைமை	ஒன்றோ	பெருங்கிழமை	என்றுணர்க			நோதக்க	நட்டார்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :Not folly merely, but familiar carelessness, Esteem it, when your friends cause you distress.
Explanation: Explanation :If friends should perform what is painful, understand that it is owing not only to ignorance, but also to the strong claims of intimacy.

Verse: எல்லைக்கண்	நின்றார்	துறவார்	தொலைவிடத்தும்			தொல்லைக்கண்	நின்றார்	தொடர்பு.
Translation: Translation :Who stand within the bounds quit not, though loss impends, Association with the old familiar friends.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who stand within the limits (of true friendship) will not even in adversity give up the intimacy of long-standing friends.

Verse: அழிவந்த	செய்யினும்	அன்பறார்	அன்பின்			வழிவந்த	கேண்மை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :True friends, well versed in loving ways, Cease not to love, when friend their love betrays.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have (long) stood in the path of affection will not give it up even if their friends cause (them) their ruin.

Verse: கேளிழுக்கம்	கேளாக்	கெழுதகைமை	வல்லார்க்கு			நாளிழுக்கம்	நட்டார்	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :In strength of friendship rare of friend's disgrace who will not hear, The day his friend offends will day of grace to him appear.
Explanation: Explanation :To those who understand that by which they should not listen to (tales about) the faults of their friends, that is a (profitable) day on which the latter may commit a fault.

Verse: கெடாஅ	வழிவந்த	கேண்மையார்	கேண்மை			விடாஅர்	விழையும்	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :Friendship of old and faithful friends, Who ne'er forsake, the world commends.
Explanation: Explanation :They will be loved by the world, who have not forsaken the friendship of those with whom they have kept up an unbroken long-standing intimacy.

Verse: விழையார்	விழையப்	படுப	பழையார்கண்			பண்பின்	தலைப்பிரியா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :Ill-wishers even wish them well, who guard. For ancient friends, their wonted kind regard.
Explanation: Explanation :Even enemies will love those who have never changed in their affection to their long-standing friends.

Verse: பருகுவார்	போலினும்	பண்பிலார்	கேண்மை			பெருகலிற்	குன்றல்	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :Though evil men should all-absorbing friendship show, Their love had better die away than grow.
Explanation: Explanation :The decrease of friendship with those who look as if they would eat you up (through excess of love) while they are really destitute of goodness is far better than its increase.

Verse: உறின்நட்டு	அறின்ஙருஉம்	ஒப்பிலார்	கேண்மை			பெறினும்	இழப்பினும்	என்.
Translation: Translation :What though you gain or lose friendship of men of alien heart, Who when you thrive are friends, and when you fail depart?
Explanation: Explanation :Of what avail is it to get or lose the friendship of those who love when there is gain and leave when there is none ?

Verse: உறுவது	சீர்தூக்கும்	நட்பும்	பெறுவது			கொள்வாரும்	கள்வரும்	நேர்.
Translation: Translation :These are alike: the friends who ponder friendship's gain Those who accept whate'er you give, and all the plundering train.
Explanation: Explanation :Friendship who calculate the profits (of their friendship), prostitutes who are bent on obtaining their gains, and thieves are (all) of the same character.

Verse: அமரகத்து	ஆற்றறுக்கும்	கல்லாமா	அன்னார்			தமரின்	தனிமை	தலை.
Translation: Translation :A steed untrained will leave you in the tug of war; Than friends like that to dwell alone is better far.
Explanation: Explanation :Solitude is more to be desired than the society of those who resemble the untrained horses which throw down (their riders) in the fields of battle.

Verse: செய்தேமஞ்	சாராச்	சிறியவர்	புன்கேண்மை			எய்தலின்	எய்தாமை	நன்று.
Translation: Translation :'Tis better not to gain than gain the friendship profitless Of men of little minds, who succour fails when dangers press.
Explanation: Explanation :It is far better to avoid that to contract the evil friendship of the base who cannot protect (their friends) even when appointed to do so.

Verse: பேதை	பெருங்கெழீஇ	நட்பின்	அறிவுடையார்			ஏதின்மை	கோடி	உறும்.
Translation: Translation :Better ten million times incur the wise man's hate, Than form with foolish men a friendship intimate.
Explanation: Explanation :The hatred of the wise is ten-million times more profitable than the excessive intimacy of the fool.

Verse: நகைவகைய	ராகிய	நட்பின்	பகைவரால்			பத்தடுத்த	கோடி	உறும்.
Translation: Translation :From foes ten million fold a greater good you gain, Than friendship yields that's formed with laughers vain.
Explanation: Explanation :What comes from enemies is a hundred million times more profitable than what comes from the friendship of those who cause only laughter.

Verse: ஒல்லும்	கருமம்	உடற்று	பவர்கேண்மை			சொல்லாடார்	சோர	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Those men who make a grievous toil of what they do On your behalf, their friendship silently eschew.
Explanation: Explanation :Gradually abandon without revealing (beforehand) the friendship of those who pretend inability to carry out what they (really) could do.

Verse: கனவினும்	இன்னாது	மன்னோ	வினைவேறு			சொல்வேறு	பட்டார்	தொடர்பு.
Translation: Translation :E'en in a dream the intercourse is bitterness With men whose deeds are other than their words profess.
Explanation: Explanation :The friendship of those whose actions do not agree with their words will distress (one) even in (one's) dreams.

Verse: எனைத்தும்	குறுகுதல்	ஓம்பல்	மனைக்கெழீஇ			மன்றில்	பழிப்பார்	தொடர்பு.
Translation: Translation :In anywise maintain not intercourse with those, Who in the house are friends, in hall are slandering foes.
Explanation: Explanation :Avoid even the least approach to a contraction of friendship with those who would love you in private but ridicule you in public.

Verse: சீரிடம்	காணின்	எறிதற்குப்	பட்டடை			நேரா	நிரந்தவர்	நட்பு.
Translation: Translation :Anvil where thou shalt smitten be, when men occasion find, Is friendship's form without consenting mind.
Explanation: Explanation :The friendship of those who behave like friends without inward affection is a weapon that may be thrown when a favourable opportunity presents itself.

Verse: இனம்போன்று	இனமல்லார்	கேண்மை	மகளிர்			மனம்போல	வேறு	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Friendship of those who seem our kin, but are not really kind. Will change from hour to hour like woman's mind.
Explanation: Explanation :The friendship of those who seem to be friends while they are not, will change like the love of women.

Verse: பலநல்ல	கற்றக்	கடைத்து	மனநல்லர்			ஆகுதல்	மாணார்க்	கரிது.
Translation: Translation :To heartfelt goodness men ignoble hardly may attain, Although abundant stores of goodly lore they gain.
Explanation: Explanation :Though (one's) enemies may have mastered many good books, it will be impossible for them to become truly loving at heart.

Verse: முகத்தின்	இனிய	நகாஅ	அகத்தின்னா			வஞ்சரை	அஞ்சப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis fitting you should dread dissemblers' guile, Whose hearts are bitter while their faces smile.
Explanation: Explanation :One should fear the deceitful who smile sweetly with their face but never love with their heart.

Verse: மனத்தின்	அமையா	தவரை	எனைத்தொன்றும்			சொல்லினால்	தேறற்பாற்று	அன்று.
Translation: Translation :When minds are not in unison, 'its never; just, In any words men speak to put your trust.
Explanation: Explanation :In nothing whatever is it proper to rely on the words of those who do not love with their heart.

Verse: நட்டார்போல்	நல்லவை	சொல்லினும்	ஒட்டார்சொல்			ஒல்லை	உணரப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Though many goodly words they speak in friendly tone, The words of foes will speedily be known.
Explanation: Explanation :Though (one's) foes may utter good things as though they were friends, once will at once understand (their evil, import).

Verse: சொல்வணக்கம்	ஒன்னார்கண்	கொள்ளற்க	வில்வணக்கம்			தீங்கு	குறித்தமை	யான்.
Translation: Translation :To pliant speech from hostile lips give thou no ear; 'Tis pliant bow that show the deadly peril near!
Explanation: Explanation :Since the bending of the bow bespeaks evil, one should not accept (as good) the humiliating speeches of one's foes.

Verse: தொழுதகை	யுள்ளும்	படையொடுங்கும்	ஒன்னார்			அழுதகண்	ணீரும்	அனைத்து.
Translation: Translation :In hands that worship weapon ten hidden lies; Such are the tears that fall from foeman's eyes.
Explanation: Explanation :A weapon may be hid in the very hands with which (one's) foes adore (him) (and) the tears they shed are of the same nature.

Verse: மிகச்செய்து	தம்மெள்ளு	வாரை	நகச்செய்து			நட்பினுள்	சாப்புல்லற்	பாற்று.
Translation: Translation :'Tis just, when men make much of you, and then despise, To make them smile, and slap in friendship's guise.
Explanation: Explanation :It is the duty of kings to affect great love but make it die (inwardly); as regard those foes who shew them great friendship but despise them (in their heart).

Verse: பகைநட்பாம்	காலம்	வருங்கால்	முகநட்டு			அகநட்பு	ஒரீஇ	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :When time shall come that foes as friends appear, Then thou, to hide a hostile heart, a smiling face may'st wear.
Explanation: Explanation :When one's foes begin to affect friendship, one should love them with one's looks, and, cherishing no love in the heart, give up (even the former).

Verse: பேதைமை	என்பதொன்று	யாதெனின்	ஏதங்கொண்டு			ஊதியம்	போக	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :What one thing merits folly's special name. Letting gain go, loss for one's own to claim!
Explanation: Explanation :Folly is one (of the chief defects); it is that which (makes one) incur loss and forego gain.

Verse: பேதைமையுள்	எல்லாம்	பேதைமை	காதன்மை			கையல்ல	தன்கட்	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :'Mid follies chiefest folly is to fix your love On deeds which to your station unbefitting prove.
Explanation: Explanation :The greatest folly is that which leads one to take delight in doing what is forbidden.

Verse: நாணாமை	நாடாமை	நாரின்மை	யாதொன்றும்			பேணாமை	பேதை	தொழில்
Translation: Translation :Ashamed of nothing, searching nothing out, of loveless heart, Nought cherishing, 'tis thus the fool will play his part.
Explanation: Explanation :Shamelessness indifference (to what must be sought after), harshness, and aversion for everything (that ought to be desired) are the qualities of the fool.

Verse: ஓதி	உணர்ந்தும்	பிறர்க்குரைத்தும்	தானடங்காப்			பேதையின்	பேதையார்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :The sacred law he reads and learns, to other men expounds,- Himself obeys not; where can greater fool be found?
Explanation: Explanation :There are no greater fools than he who, though he has read and understood (a great deal) and even taught it to others, does not walk according to his own teaching.

Verse: ஒருமைச்	செயலாற்றும்	பேதை	எழுமையும்			தான்புக்	கழுந்தும்	அளறு.
Translation: Translation :The fool will merit hell in one brief life on earth, In which he entering sinks through sevenfold round of birth.
Explanation: Explanation :A fool can procure in a single birth a hell into which he may enter and suffer through all the seven births.

Verse: பொய்படும்	ஒன்றோ	புனைபூணும்	கையறியாப்			பேதை	வினைமேற்	கொளின்.
Translation: Translation :When fool some task attempts with uninstructed pains, It fails; nor that alone, himself he binds with chains.
Explanation: Explanation :If the fool, who knows not how to act undertakes a work, he will (certainly) fail. (But) is it all ? He will even adorn himself with fetters.

Verse: ஏதிலார்	ஆரத்	தமர்பசிப்பர்	பேதை			பெருஞ்செல்வம்	உற்றக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :When fools are blessed with fortune's bounteous store, Their foes feed full, their friends are prey to hunger sore.
Explanation: Explanation :If a fool happens to get an immense fortune, his neighbours will enjoy it while his relations starve.

Verse: மையல்	ஒருவன்	களித்தற்றால்	பேதைதன்			கையொன்று	உடைமை	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :When folly's hand grasps wealth's increase, 'twill be As when a mad man raves in drunken glee.
Explanation: Explanation :A fool happening to possess something is like the intoxication of one who is (already) giddy.

Verse: பெரிதினிது	பேதையார்	கேண்மை	பிரிவின்கண்			பீழை	தருவதொன்	றில்.
Translation: Translation :Friendship of fools is very pleasant thing, Parting with them will leave behind no sting.
Explanation: Explanation :The friendship between fools is exceedingly delightful (to each other): for at parting there will be nothing to cause them pain.

Verse: கழாஅக்கால்	பள்ளியுள்	வைத்தற்றால்	சான்றோர்			குழாஅத்துப்	பேதை	புகல்.
Translation: Translation :Like him who seeks his couch with unwashed feet, Is fool whose foot intrudes where wise men meet.
Explanation: Explanation :The appearance of a fool in an assembly of the learned is like placing (one's) unwashed feet on a bed.

Verse: அறிவின்மை	இன்மையுள்	இன்மை	பிறிதின்மை			இன்மையா	வையா	துலகு.
Translation: Translation :Want of knowledge, 'mid all wants the sorest want we deem; Want of other things the world will not as want esteem.
Explanation: Explanation :The want of wisdom is the greatest of all wants; but that of wealth the world will not regard as such.

Verse: அறிவிலான்	நெஞ்சுவந்து	ஈதல்	பிறிதியாதும்			இல்லை	பெறுவான்	தவம்.
Translation: Translation :The gift of foolish man, with willing heart bestowed, is nought, But blessing by receiver's penance bought.
Explanation: Explanation :(The cause of) a fool cheerfully giving (something) is nothing else but the receiver's merit (in a former birth).

Verse: அறிவிலார்	தாந்தம்மைப்	பீழிக்கும்	பீழை			செறுவார்க்கும்	செய்தல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :With keener anguish foolish men their own hearts wring, Than aught that even malice of their foes can bring.
Explanation: Explanation :The suffering that fools inflict upon themselves is hardly possible even to foes.

Verse: வெண்மை	எனப்படுவ	தியாதெனின்	ஒண்மை			உடையம்யாம்	என்னும்	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :What is stupidity? The arrogance that cries, 'Behold, we claim the glory of the wise.'
Explanation: Explanation :What is called want of wisdom is the vanity which says, "We are wise".

Verse: கல்லாத	மேற்கொண்	டொழுகல்	கசடற			வல்லதூஉம்	ஐயம்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :If men what they have never learned assume to know, Upon their real learning's power a doubt 'twill throw.
Explanation: Explanation :Fools pretending to know what has not been read (by them) will rouse suspicion even as to what they have thoroughly mastered.

Verse: அற்றம்	மறைத்தலோ	புல்லறிவு	தம்வயின்			குற்றம்	மறையா	வழி.
Translation: Translation :Fools are they who their nakedness conceal, And yet their faults unveiled reveal.
Explanation: Explanation :Even to cover one's nakedness would be folly, if (one's) faults were not covered (by forsaking them).

Verse: அருமறை	சோரும்	அறிவிலான்	செய்யும்			பெருமிறை	தானே	தனக்கு.
Translation: Translation :From out his soul who lets the mystic teachings die, Entails upon himself abiding misery.
Explanation: Explanation :The fool who neglects precious counsel does, of his own accord, a great injury to himself.

Verse: ஏவவும்	செய்கலான்	தான்தேறான்	அவ்வுயிர்			போஒம்	அளவுமோர்	நோய்.
Translation: Translation :Advised, he heeds not; of himself knows nothing wise; This man's whole life is all one plague until he dies.
Explanation: Explanation :The fool will not perform (his duties) even when advised nor ascertain them himself; such a soul is a burden (to the earth) till it departs (from the body).

Verse: காணாதான்	காட்டுவான்	தான்காணான்	காணாதான்			கண்டானாம்	தான்கண்ட	வாறு.
Translation: Translation :That man is blind to eyes that will not see who knowledge shows;- The blind man still in his blind fashion knows.
Explanation: Explanation :One who would teach a fool will (simply) betray his folly; and the fool would (still) think himself "wise in his own conceit".

Verse: உலகத்தார்	உண்டென்பது	இல்லென்பான்	வையத்து			அலகையா	வைக்கப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Who what the world affirms as false proclaim, O'er all the earth receive a demon's name.
Explanation: Explanation :He who denies the existence of what the world believes in will be regarded as a demon on earth.

Verse: இகலென்ப	எல்லா	உயிர்க்கும்	பகலென்னும்			பண்பின்மை	பார஧க்கும்	நோய்.
Translation: Translation :Hostility disunion's plague will bring, That evil quality, to every living thing.
Explanation: Explanation :The disease which fosters the evil of disunion among all creatures is termed hatred by the wise.

Verse: பகல்கருதிப்	பற்றா	செயினும்	இகல்கருதி			இன்னாசெய்	யாமை	தலை.
Translation: Translation :Though men disunion plan, and do thee much despite 'Tis best no enmity to plan, nor evil deeds requite.
Explanation: Explanation :Though disagreeable things may be done from (a feeling of) disunion, it is far better that nothing painful be done from (that of) hatred.

Verse: இகலென்னும்	எவ்வநோய்	நீக்கின்	தவலில்லாத்			தாவில்	விளக்கம்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :If enmity, that grievous plague, you shun, Endless undying praises shall be won.
Explanation: Explanation :To rid one-self of the distressing dtsease of hatred will bestow (on one) a never-decreasing imperishable fame.

Verse: இன்பத்துள்	இன்பம்	பயக்கும்	இகலென்னும்			துன்பத்துள்	துன்பங்	கெடின்.
Translation: Translation :Joy of joys abundant grows, When malice dies that woe of woes.
Explanation: Explanation :If hatred which is the greatest misery is destroyed, it will yield the greatest delight.

Verse: இகலெதிர்	சாய்ந்தொழுக	வல்லாரை	யாரே			மிக்லூக்கும்	தன்மை	யவர்.
Translation: Translation :If men from enmity can keep their spirits free, Who over them shall gain the victory?
Explanation: Explanation :Who indeed would think of conquering those who naturally shrink back from hatred ?

Verse: இகலின்	மிகலினிது	என்பவன்	வாழ்க்கை			தவலும்	கெடலும்	நணித்து.
Translation: Translation :The life of those who cherished enmity hold dear, To grievous fault and utter death is near.
Explanation: Explanation :Failure and ruin are not far from him who says it is sweet to excel in hatred.

Verse: மிகல்மேவல்	மெய்ப்பொருள்	காணார்	இகல்மேவல்			இன்னா	அறிவி	னவர்.
Translation: Translation :The very truth that greatness gives their eyes can never see, Who only know to work men woe, fulfilled of enmity.
Explanation: Explanation :Those whose judgement brings misery through its connection with hatred cannot understand the triumphant nature of truth.

Verse: இகலிற்கு	எதிர்சாய்தல்	ஆக்கம்	அதனை			மிக்லூக்கின்	ஊக்குமாம்	கேடு.
Translation: Translation :'Tis gain to turn the soul from enmity; Ruin reigns where this hath mastery.
Explanation: Explanation :Shrinking back from hatred will yield wealth; indulging in its increase will hasten ruin.

Verse: இகல்காணான்	ஆக்கம்	வருங்கால்	அதனை			மிகல்காணும்	கேடு	தரற்கு.
Translation: Translation :Men think not hostile thought in fortune's favouring hour, They cherish enmity when in misfortune's power.
Explanation: Explanation :At the approach of wealth one will not think of hatred (but) to secure one's ruin, one will look to its increase.

Verse: இகலானாம்	இன்னாத	எல்லாம்	நகலானாம்			நன்னயம்	என்னும்	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :From enmity do all afflictive evils flow; But friendliness doth wealth of kindly good bestow.
Explanation: Explanation :All calamities are caused by hatred; but by the delight (of friendship) is caused the great wealth of good virtues.

Verse: வலியார்க்கு	மாறேற்றல்	ஓம்புக	ஓம்பா			மெலியார்மேல்	மேக	பகை.
Translation: Translation :With stronger than thyself, turn from the strife away; With weaker shun not, rather court the fray.
Explanation: Explanation :Avoid offering resistance to the strong; (but) never fail to cherish enmity towards the weak.

Verse: அன்பிலன்	ஆன்ற	துணையிலன்	தான்துவ்வான்			என்பரியும்	ஏதிலான்	துப்பு.
Translation: Translation :No kinsman's love, no strength of friends has he; How can he bear his foeman's enmity?
Explanation: Explanation :How can he who is unloving, destitute of powerful aids, and himself without strength overcome the might of his foe ?

Verse: அஞ்சும்	அறியான்	அமைவிலன்	ஈகலான்			தஞ்சம்	எளியன்	பகைக்கு.
Translation: Translation :A craven thing! knows nought, accords with none, gives nought away; To wrath of any foe he falls an easy prey.
Explanation: Explanation :In the estimation of foes miserably weak is he, who is timid, ignorant, unsociable and niggardly.

Verse: நீங்கான்	வெகுளி	நிறையிலன்	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			யாங்கணும்	யார்க்கும்	எளிது.
Translation: Translation :His wrath still blazes, every secret told; each day This man's in every place to every foe an easy prey.
Explanation: Explanation :He who neither refrains from anger nor keeps his secrets will at all times and in all places be easily conquered by all.

Verse: வழிநோக்கான்	வாய்ப்பன	செய்யான்	பழிநோக்கான்			பண்பிலன்	பற்றார்க்கு	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :No way of right he scans, no precepts bind, no crimes affright, No grace of good he owns; such man's his foes' delight.
Explanation: Explanation :(A) pleasing (object) to his foes is he who reads not moral works, does nothing that is enjoined by them cares not for reproach and is not possessed of good qualities.

Verse: காணாச்	சினத்தான்	கழிபெருங்	காமத்தான்			பேணாமை	பேணப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :Blind in his rage, his lustful passions rage and swell; If such a man mislikes you, like it well.
Explanation: Explanation :Highly to be desired is the hatred of him whose anger is blind, and whose lust increases beyond measure.

Verse: கொடுத்தும்	கொளல்வேண்டும்	மன்ற	அடுத்திருந்து			மாணாத	செய்வான்	பகை.
Translation: Translation :Unseemly are his deeds, yet proffering aid, the man draws nigh: His hate- 'tis cheap at any price- be sure to buy!
Explanation: Explanation :It is indeed necessary to obtain even by purchase the hatred of him who having begun (a work) does what is not conductive (to its accomplishment).

Verse: குணனிலனாய்க்	குற்றம்	பலவாயின்	மாற்றார்க்கு			இனனிலனாம்	ஏமாப்	புடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :No gracious gifts he owns, faults many cloud his fame; His foes rejoice, for none with kindred claim.
Explanation: Explanation :He will become friendless who is without (any good) qualities. and whose faults are many; (such a character) is a help to (his) foes.

Verse: செறுவார்க்குச்	சேணிகவா	இன்பம்	அறிவிலா			அஞ்சும்	பகைவர்ப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :The joy of victory is never far removed from those Who've luck to meet with ignorant and timid foes.
Explanation: Explanation :There will be no end of lofty delights to the victorious, if their foes are (both) ignorant and timid.

Verse: கல்லான்	வெகுளும்	சிறுபொருள்	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			ஒல்லானை	ஒல்லா	தொளி.
Translation: Translation :The task of angry war with men unlearned in virtue's lore Who will not meet, glory shall meet him never more.
Explanation: Explanation :The light (of fame) will never be gained by him who gains not the trifling reputation of having fought an unlearned (foe).

Verse: பகைஎன்னும்	பண்பி	லதனை	ஒருவன்			நகையேயும்	வேண்டற்பாற்று	அன்று.
Translation: Translation :For Hate, that ill-conditioned thing not e'en in jest. Let any evil longing rule your breast.
Explanation: Explanation :The evil of hatred is not of a nature to be desired by one even in sport.

Verse: வில்லேர்	உழவர்	பகைகொளினும்	கொள்ளற்க			சொல்லேர்	உழவர்	பகை.
Translation: Translation :Although you hate incur of those whose ploughs are bows, Make not the men whose ploughs are words your foes!
Explanation: Explanation :Though you may incur the hatred of warriors whose ploughs are bows, incur not that of ministers whose ploughs are words.

Verse: ஏமுற்	றவரினும்	ஏழை	தமியனாய்ப்			பல்லார்	பகைகொள்	பவன்.
Translation: Translation :Than men of mind diseased, a wretch more utterly forlorn, Is he who stands alone, object of many foeman's scorn.
Explanation: Explanation :He who being alone, incurs the hatred of many is more infatuated than even mad men.

Verse: பகைநட்பாக்	கொண்டொழுகும்	பண்புடை	யாளன்			தகைமைக்கண்	தங்கிற்று	உலகு.
Translation: Translation :The world secure on his dexterity depends, Whose worthy rule can change his foes to friends.
Explanation: Explanation :The world abides in the greatness of that good-natured man who behaves so as to turn hatred into friendship.

Verse: தன்துணை	இன்றால்	பகையிரண்டால்	தான்ஒருவன்			இன்துணையாக்	கொள்கவற்றின்	ஒன்று.
Translation: Translation :Without ally, who fights with twofold enemy o'ermatched, Must render one of these a friend attached.
Explanation: Explanation :He who is alone and helpless while his foes are two should secure one of them as an agreeable help (to himself).

Verse: தேற஧னும்	தேறா	விடினும்	அழிவின்கண்			தேறான்	பகாஅன்	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Whether you trust or not, in time of sore distress, Questions of diff'rence or agreement cease to press.
Explanation: Explanation :Though (one's foe is) aware or not of one's misfortune one should act so as neither to join nor separate (from him).

Verse: நோவற்க	நொந்தது	அறியார்க்கு	மேவற்க			மென்மை	பகைவர்	அகத்து.
Translation: Translation :To those who know them not, complain not of your woes; Nor to your foeman's eyes infirmities disclose.
Explanation: Explanation :Relate not your suffering even to friends who are ignorant of it, nor refer to your weakness in the presence of your foes.

Verse: வகையறிந்து	தற்செய்து	தற்காப்ப	மாயும்			பகைவர்கண்	பட்ட	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Know thou the way, then do thy part, thyself defend; Thus shall the pride of those that hate thee have an end.
Explanation: Explanation :The joy of one's foes will be destroyed if one guards oneself by knowing the way (of acting) and securing assistance.

Verse: இளைதாக	முள்மரம்	கொல்க	களையுநர்			கைகொல்லும்	காழ்த்த	இடத்து.
Translation: Translation :Destroy the thorn, while tender point can work thee no offence; Matured by time, 'twill pierce the hand that plucks it thence.
Explanation: Explanation :A thorny tree should be felled while young, (for) when it is grown it will destroy the hand of the feller.

Verse: உயிர்ப்ப	உளரல்லர்	மன்ற	செயிர்ப்பவர்			செம்மல்	சிதைக்கலா	தார்.
Translation: Translation :But breathe upon them, and they surely die, Who fail to tame the pride of angry enemy.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who do not destroy the pride of those who hate (them) will certainly not exist even to breathe.

Verse: நிழல்நீரும்	இன்னாத	இன்னா	தமர்நீரும்			இன்னாவாம்	இன்னா	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :Water and shade, if they unwholesome prove, will bring you pain. And qualities of friends who treacherous act, will be your bane.
Explanation: Explanation :Shade and water are not pleasant, (if) they cause disease; so are the qualities of (one's) relations not agreeable, (if) they cause pain.

Verse: வாள்போல	பகைவரை	அஞ்சற்க	அஞ்சுக			கேள்போல்	பகைவர்	தொடர்பு.
Translation: Translation :Dread not the foes that as drawn swords appear; Friendship of foes, who seem like kinsmen, fear!
Explanation: Explanation :Fear not foes (who say they would cut) like a sword; (but) fear the friendship of foes (who seemingly act) like relations.

Verse: உட்பகை	அஞ்சித்தற்	காக்க	உலைவிடத்து			மட்பகையின்	மாணத்	தெறும்.
Translation: Translation :Of hidden hate beware, and guard thy life; In troublous time 'twill deeper wound than potter's knife.
Explanation: Explanation :Fear internal enmity and guard yourself; (if not) it will destroy (you) in an evil hour, as surely as the tool which cuts the potter's clay.

Verse: மனமாணா	உட்பகை	தோன்றின்	இனமாணா			ஏதம்	பலவும்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :If secret enmities arise that minds pervert, Then even kin unkind will work thee grievous hurt.
Explanation: Explanation :The secret enmity of a person whose mind in unreformed will lead to many evils causing disaffection among (one's) relations.

Verse: உறல்முறையான்	உட்பகை	தோன்றின்	இறல்முறையான்			ஏதம்	பலவும்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Amid one's relatives if hidden hath arise, 'Twill hurt inflict in deadly wise.
Explanation: Explanation :If there appears internal hatred in a (king's) family; it will lead to many a fatal crime.

Verse: ஒன்றாமை	ஒன்றியார்	கட்படின்	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			பொன்றாமை	ஒன்றல்	அரிது.
Translation: Translation :If discord finds a place midst those who dwelt at one before, 'Tis ever hard to keep destruction from the door.
Explanation: Explanation :If hatred arises among (one's) own people, it will be hardly possible (for one) to escape death.

Verse: செப்பின்	புணர்ச்சிபோல்	கூடினும்	கூடாதே			உட்பகை	உற்ற	குடி.
Translation: Translation :As casket with its cover, though in one they live alway, No union to the house where hate concealed hath sway.
Explanation: Explanation :Never indeed will a family subject to internal hatred unite (really) though it may present an apparent union like that of a casket and its lid.

Verse: அரம்பொருத	பொன்போலத்	தேயும்	உரம்பொருது			உட்பகை	உற்ற	குடி.
Translation: Translation :As gold with which the file contends is worn away, So strength of house declines where hate concealed hath sway.
Explanation: Explanation :A family subject to internal hatred will wear out and lose its strength like iron that has been filed away.

Verse: எட்பக	வன்ன	சிறுமைத்தே	ஆயினும்			உட்பகை	உள்ளதாங்	கேடு.
Translation: Translation :Though slight as shred of 'seasame' seed it be, Destruction lurks in hidden enmity.
Explanation: Explanation :Although internal hatred be as small as the fragment of the sesamum (seed), still does destruction dwell in it.

Verse: உடம்பாடு	இலாதவர்	வாழ்க்கை	குடங்கருள்			பாம்போடு	உடனுறைந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :Domestic life with those who don't agree, Is dwelling in a shed with snake for company.
Explanation: Explanation :Living with those who do not agree (with one) is like dwelling with a cobra (in the same) hut.

Verse: ஆற்றுவார்	ஆற்றல்	இகழாமை	போற்றுவார்			போற்றலுள்	எல்லாம்	தலை.
Translation: Translation :The chiefest care of those who guard themselves from ill, Is not to slight the powers of those who work their mighty will.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to disregard the power of those who can carry out (their wishes) is more important than all the watchfulness of those who guard (themselves against evil).

Verse: பெரியாரைப்	பேணாது	ஒழுகிற்	பெரியாரால்			பேரா	இடும்பை	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :If men will lead their lives reckless of great men's will, Such life, through great men's powers, will bring perpetual ill.
Explanation: Explanation :To behave without respect for the great (rulers) will make them do (us) irremediable evils.

Verse: கெடல்வேண்டின்	கேளாது	செய்க	அடல்வேண்டின்			ஆற்று	பவர்கண்	இழுக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Who ruin covet let them shut their ears, and do despite To those who, where they list to ruin have the might.
Explanation: Explanation :If a person desires ruin, let him not listen to the righteous dictates of law, but commit crimes against those who are able to slay (other sovereigns).

Verse: கூற்றத்தைக்	கையால்	விளித்தற்றால்	ஆற்றுவார்க்கு			ஆற்றாதார்	இன்னா	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :When powerless man 'gainst men of power will evil deeds essay, Tis beck'ning with the hand for Death to seize them for its prey.
Explanation: Explanation :The weak doing evil to the strong is like beckoning Yama to come (and destroy them).

Verse: யாண்டுச்சென்று	யாண்டும்	உளராகார்	வெந்துப்பின்			வேந்து	செறப்பட்	டவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who dare the fiery wrath of monarchs dread, Where'er they flee, are numbered with the dead.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who have incurred the wrath of a cruel and mighty potentate will not prosper wherever they may go.

Verse: எரியால்	சுடப்படினும்	உய்வுண்டாம்	உய்யார்			பெரியார்ப்	பிழைத்தொழுகு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Though in the conflagration caught, he may escape from thence: He 'scapes not who in life to great ones gives offence.
Explanation: Explanation :Though burnt by a fire (from a forest), one may perhaps live; (but) never will he live who has shown disrespect to the great (devotees).

Verse: வகைமாண்ட	வாழ்க்கையும்	வான்பொருளும்	என்னாம்			தகைமாண்ட	தக்கார்	செறின்.
Translation: Translation :Though every royal gift, and stores of wealth your life should crown, What are they, if the worthy men of mighty virtue frown?
Explanation: Explanation :If a king incurs the wrath of the righteous great, what will become of his government with its splendid auxiliaries and (all) its untold wealth ?

Verse: குன்றன்னார்	குன்ற	மதிப்பின்	குடியொடு			நின்றன்னார்	மாய்வர்	நிலத்து.
Translation: Translation :If they, whose virtues like a mountain rise, are light esteemed; They die from earth who, with their households, ever-during seemed.
Explanation: Explanation :If (the) hill-like (devotees) resolve on destruction, those who seemed to be everlasting will be destroyed root and branch from the earth.

Verse: ஏந்திய	கொள்கையார்	சீறின்	இடைமுரிந்து			வேந்தனும்	வேந்து	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :When blazes forth the wrath of men of lofty fame, Kings even fall from high estate and perish in the flame.
Explanation: Explanation :If those of exalted vows burst in a rage, even (Indra) the king will suffer a sudden loss and be entirely ruined.

Verse: இறந்தமைந்த	சார்புடையர்	ஆயினும்	உய்யார்			சிறந்தமைந்த	சீரார்	செறின்.
Translation: Translation :Though all-surpassing wealth of aid the boast, If men in glorious virtue great are wrath, they're lost.
Explanation: Explanation :Though in possession of numerous auxiliaries, they will perish who are-exposed to the wrath of the noble whose penance is boundless.

Verse: மனைவிழைவார்	மாண்பயன்	எய்தார்	வினைவிழையார்			வேண்டாப்	பொருளும்	அது.
Translation: Translation :Who give their soul to love of wife acquire not nobler gain; Who give their soul to strenuous deeds such meaner joys disdain.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who lust after their wives will not attain the excellence of virtue; and it is just this that is not desired by those who are bent on acquiring wealth.

Verse: பேணாது	பெண்விழைவான்	ஆக்கம்	பெரியதோர்			நாணாக	நாணுத்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Who gives himself to love of wife, careless of noble name His wealth will clothe him with o'erwhelming shame.
Explanation: Explanation :The wealth of him who, regardless (of his manliness), devotes himself to his wife's feminine nature will cause great shame (to ali men) and to himself;

Verse: இல்லாள்கண்	தாழ்ந்த	இயல்பின்மை	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			நல்லாருள்	நாணுத்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Who to his wife submits, his strange, unmanly mood Will daily bring him shame among the good.
Explanation: Explanation :The frailty that stoops to a wife will always make (her husband) feel ashamed among the good.

Verse: மனையாளை	அஞ்சும்	மறுமையி	லாளன்			வினையாண்மை	வீறெய்த	லின்று.
Translation: Translation :No glory crowns e'en manly actions wrought By him who dreads his wife, nor gives the other world a thought.
Explanation: Explanation :The undertaking of one, who fears his wife and is therefore destitute of (bliss), will never be applauded.

Verse: இல்லாளை	அஞ்சுவான்	அஞ்சுமற்	றெஞ்ஞான்றும்			நல்லார்க்கு	நல்ல	செயல்.
Translation: Translation :Who quakes before his wife will ever tremble too, Good deeds to men of good deserts to do.
Explanation: Explanation :He that fears his wife will always be afraid of doing good deeds (even) to the good.

Verse: இமையாரின்	வாழினும்	பாடிலரே	இல்லாள்			அமையார்தோள்	அஞ்சு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Though, like the demi-gods, in bliss they dwell secure from harm, Those have no dignity who fear the housewife's slender arm.
Explanation: Explanation :They that fear the bamboo-like shoulders of their wives will be destitute of manliness though they may flourish like the Gods.

Verse: பெண்ணேவல்	செய்தொழுகும்	ஆண்மையின்	நாணுடைப்			பெண்ணே	பெருமை	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :The dignity of modest womanhood excels His manliness, obedient to a woman's law who dwells.
Explanation: Explanation :Even shame faced womanhood is more to be esteemed than the shameless manhood that performs the behests of a wife.

Verse: நட்டார்	குறைமுடியார்	நன்றாற்றார்	நன்னுதலாள்			பெட்டாங்கு	ஒழுகு	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who to the will of her with beauteous brow their lives conform, Aid not their friends in need, nor acts of charity perform.
Explanation: Explanation :Those who yield to the wishes of their wives will neither relieve the wants of (their) friends nor perform virtuous deeds.

Verse: அறவினையும்	ஆன்ற	பொருளும்	பிறவினையும்			பெண்ஏவல்	செய்வார்கண்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :No virtuous deed, no seemly wealth, no pleasure, rests With them who live obedient to their wives' behests.
Explanation: Explanation :From those who obey the commands of their wives are to be expected neither deeds of virtue, nor those of wealth nor (even) those of pleasure.

Verse: எண்சேர்ந்த	நெஞ்சத்	திடனுடையார்க்கு	எஞ்ஞான்றும்			பெண்சேர்ந்தாம்	பேதைமை	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Where pleasures of the mind, that dwell in realms of thought, abound, Folly, that springs from overweening woman's love, is never found.
Explanation: Explanation :The foolishness that results from devotion to a wife will never be found in those who possess a reflecting mind and a prosperity (flowing) therefrom.

Verse: அன்பின்	விழையார்	பொருள்விழையும்	ஆய்தொடியார்			இன்சொல்	இழுக்குத்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :Those that choice armlets wear who seek not thee with love, But seek thy wealth, their pleasant words will ruin prove.
Explanation: Explanation :The sweet words of elegant braceleted (prostitutes) who desire (a man) not from affection but from avarice, will cause sorrow.

Verse: பயன்தூக்கிப்	பண்புரைக்கும்	பண்பின்	மகளிர்			நயன்தூக்கி	நள்ளா	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :Who weigh the gain, and utter virtuous words with vicious heart, Weighing such women's worth, from their society depart.
Explanation: Explanation :One must ascertain the character of the ill-natured women who after ascertaining the wealth (of a man) speak (as if they were) good natured-ones, and avoid intercourse (with them).

Verse: பொருட்பெண்டிர்	பொய்ம்மை	முயக்கம்	இருட்டறையில்			ஏத஧ல்	பிணந்தழீஇ	அற்று.
Translation: Translation :As one in darkened room, some stranger corpse inarms, Is he who seeks delight in mercenary women's charms!
Explanation: Explanation :The false embraces of wealth-loving women are like (hired men) embracing a strange corpse in a dark room.
