Translation: Translation :With butter-oil extinguish fire! 'Twill prove Harder by scandal to extinguish love.
Explanation: Explanation :To say that one could extinguish passion by rumour is like extinguishing fire with ghee.

Verse: அலர்நாண	ஒல்வதோ	அஞ்சலோம்பு	என்றார்			பலர்நாண	நீத்தக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :When he who said 'Fear not!' hath left me blamed, While many shrink, can I from rumour hide ashamed?
Explanation: Explanation :When the departure of him who said "fear not" has put me to shame before others, why need I be ashamed of scandal.

Verse: தாம்வேண்டின்	நல்குவர்	காதலர்	யாம்வேண்டும்			கெளவை	எடுக்கும்இவ்	வூர்.
Translation: Translation :If we desire, who loves will grant what we require; This town sends forth the rumour we desire!
Explanation: Explanation :The rumour I desire is raised by the town (itself); and my lover would if desired consent (to my following him).

Verse: செல்லாமை	உண்டேல்	எனக்குரை	மற்றுநின்			வல்வரவு	வாழ்வார்க்	குரை.
Translation: Translation :If you will say, 'I leave thee not,' then tell me so; Of quick return tell those that can survive this woe.
Explanation: Explanation :If it is not departure, tell me; but if it is your speedy return, tell it to those who would be alive then.

Verse: இன்கண்	உடைத்தவர்	பார்வல்	பிரிவஞ்சும்			புன்கண்	உடைத்தால்	புணர்வு.
Translation: Translation :It once was perfect joy to look upon his face; But now the fear of parting saddens each embrace.
Explanation: Explanation :His very look was once pleasing; but (now) even intercourse is painful through fear of separation.

Verse: அரிதரோ	தேற்றம்	அறிவுடையார்	கண்ணும்			பிரிவோ	ரிடத்துண்மை	யான்.
Translation: Translation :To trust henceforth is hard, if ever he depart, E'en he, who knows his promise and my breaking heart.
Explanation: Explanation :As even the lover who understands (everything) may at times depart, confidence is hardly possible.

Verse: அளித்தஞ்சல்	என்றவர்	நீப்பின்	தெளித்தசொல்			தேறியார்க்கு	உண்டோ	தவறு.
Translation: Translation :If he depart, who fondly said, 'Fear not,' what blame's incurred By those who trusted to his reassuring word?
Explanation: Explanation :If he who bestowed his love and said "fear not" should depart, will it be the fault of those who believed in (his) assuring words ?

Verse: ஓம்பின்	அமைந்தார்	பிரிவோம்பல்	மற்றவர்			நீங்கின்	அரிதால்	புணர்வு.
Translation: Translation :If you would guard my life, from going him restrain Who fills my life! If he depart, hardly we meet again.
Explanation: Explanation :If you would save (my life), delay the departure of my destined (husband); for if he departs, intercourse will become impossible.

Verse: பிரிவுரைக்கும்	வன்கண்ணர்	ஆயின்	அரிதவர்			நல்குவர்	என்னும்	நசை.
Translation: Translation :To cherish longing hope that he should ever gracious be, Is hard, when he could stand, and of departure speak to me.
Explanation: Explanation :If he is so cruel as to mention his departure (to me), the hope that he would bestow (his love) must be given up.

Verse: துறைவன்	துறந்தமை	தூற்றாகொல்	முன்கை			இறைஇறவா	நின்ற	வளை.
Translation: Translation :The bracelet slipping from my wrist announced before Departure of the Prince that rules the ocean shore.
Explanation: Explanation :Do not the rings that begin to slide down my fingers forebode the separation of my lord ?

Verse: இன்னாது	இனன்இல்ஊர்	வாழ்தல்	அதனினும்			இன்னாது	இனியார்ப்	பிரிவு.
Translation: Translation :'Tis sad to sojourn in the town where no kind kinsmen dwell; 'Tis sadder still to bid a friend beloved farewell.
Explanation: Explanation :Painful is it to live in a friendless town; but far more painful is it to part from one's lover.

Verse: தொடிற்சுடின்	அல்லது	காமநோய்	போல			விடிற்சுடல்	ஆற்றுமோ	தீ.
Translation: Translation :Fire burns the hands that touch; but smart of love Will burn in hearts that far away remove.
Explanation: Explanation :Fire burns when touched; but, like the sickness of love, can it also burn when removed ?

Verse: அரிதாற்றி	அல்லல்நோய்	நீக்கிப்	பிரிவாற்றிப்			பின்இருந்து	வாழ்வார்	பலர்.
Translation: Translation :Sorrow's sadness meek sustaining, Driving sore distress away, Separation uncomplaining Many bear the livelong day!
Explanation: Explanation :As if there were many indeed that can consent to the impossible, kill their pain, endure separation and yet continue to live afterwards.

Verse: மறைப்பேன்மன்	யானிஃதோ	நோயை	இறைப்பவர்க்கு			ஊற்றுநீர்	போல	மிகும்.
Translation: Translation :I would my pain conceal, but see! it surging swells, As streams to those that draw from ever-springing wells.
Explanation: Explanation :I would hide this pain from others; but it (only) swells like a spring to those who drain it.

Verse: கரத்தலும்	ஆற்றேன்இந்	நோயைநோய்	செய்தார்க்கு			உரைத்தலும்	நாணுத்	தரும்.
Translation: Translation :I cannot hide this pain of mine, yet shame restrains When I would tell it out to him who caused my pains.
Explanation: Explanation :I cannot conceal this pain, nor can I relate it without shame to him who has caused it.

Verse: காமமும்	நாணும்	உயிர்காவாத்	தூங்கும்என்			நோனா	உடம்பின்	அகத்து.
Translation: Translation :My soul, like porter's pole, within my wearied frame, Sustains a two-fold burthen poised, of love and shame.
Explanation: Explanation :(Both) lust and shame, with my soul for their shoulder pole balance themselves on a body that cannot bear them.

Verse: காமக்	கடல்மன்னும்	உண்டே	அதுநீந்தும்			ஏமப்	புணைமன்னும்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :A sea of love, 'tis true, I see stretched out before, But not the trusty bark that wafts to yonder shore.
Explanation: Explanation :There is indeed a flood of lust; but there is no raft of safety to cross it with.

Verse: துப்பின்	எவனாவர்	மன்கொல்	துயர்வரவு			நட்பினுள்	ஆற்று	பவர்.
Translation: Translation :Who work us woe in friendship's trustful hour, What will they prove when angry tempests lower?
Explanation: Explanation :He who can produce sorrow from friendship, what can he not bring forth out of enmity ?

Verse: இன்பம்	கடல்மற்றுக்	காமம்	அஃதடுங்கால்			துன்பம்	அதனிற்	பெரிது.
Translation: Translation :A happy love 's sea of joy; but mightier sorrows roll From unpropitious love athwart the troubled soul.
Explanation: Explanation :The pleasure of lust is (as great as) the sea; but the pain of lust is far greater.

Verse: காமக்	கடும்புனல்	நீந்திக்	கரைகாணேன்			யாமத்தும்	யானே	உளேன்.
Translation: Translation :I swim the cruel tide of love, and can no shore descry, In watches of the night, too, 'mid the waters, only I!
Explanation: Explanation :I have swam across the terrible flood of lust, but have not seen its shore; even at midnight I am alone; still I live.

Verse: மன்னுயிர்	எல்லாம்	துயிற்றி	அளித்திரா			என்னல்லது	இல்லை	துணை.
Translation: Translation :All living souls in slumber soft she steeps; But me alone kind night for her companing keeps!
Explanation: Explanation :The night which graciously lulls to sleep all living creatures, has me alone for her companion.

Verse: கொடியார்	கொடுமையின்	தாம்கொடிய	விந்நாள்			நெடிய	கழியும்	இரா.
Translation: Translation :More cruel than the cruelty of him, the cruel one, In these sad times are lengthening hours of night I watch alone.
Explanation: Explanation :The long nights of these days are far more cruel than the heartless one who is torturing me.

Verse: உள்ளம்போன்று	உள்வழிச்	செல்கிற்பின்	வெள்ளநீர்			நீந்தல	மன்னோஎன்	கண்.
Translation: Translation :When eye of mine would as my soul go forth to him, It knows not how through floods of its own tears to swim.
Explanation: Explanation :Could mine eyes travel like my thoughts to the abode (of my absent lord), they would not swim in this flood of tears.

Verse: கண்தாம்	கலுழ்வ	தெவன்கொலோ	தண்டாநோய்			தாம்காட்ட	யாம்கண்	டது.
Translation: Translation :They showed me him, and then my endless pain I saw: why then should weeping eyes complain?
Explanation: Explanation :As this incurable malady has been caused by my eyes which showed (him) to me, why should they now weep for (him).

Verse: தெரிந்துணரா	நோக்கிய	உண்கண்	பரிந்துணராப்			பைதல்	உழப்பது	எவன்.
Translation: Translation :How glancing eyes, that rash unweeting looked that day, With sorrow measureless are wasting now away!
Explanation: Explanation :The dyed eyes that (then) looked without foresight, why should they now endure sorrow, without feeling sharply (their own fault).

Verse: கதுமெனத்	தாநோக்கித்	தாமே	கலுழும்			இதுநகத்	தக்க	துடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :The eyes that threw such eager glances round erewhile Are weeping now. Such folly surely claims a smile!
Explanation: Explanation :They themselves looked eagerly (on him) and now they weep. Is not this to be laughed at ?

Verse: பெயலாற்றா	நீருலந்த	உண்கண்	உயலாற்றா			உய்வில்நோய்	என்கண்	நிறுத்து.
Translation: Translation :Those eyes have wept till all the fount of tears is dry, That brought upon me pain that knows no remedy.
Explanation: Explanation :These painted eyes have caused me a lasting mortal disease; and now they can weep no more, the tears having dried up.

Verse: படலாற்றா	பைதல்	உழக்கும்	கடலாற்றாக்			காமநோய்	செய்தஎன்	கண்.
Translation: Translation :The eye that wrought me more than sea could hold of woes, Is suffering pangs that banish all repose.
Explanation: Explanation :Mine eyes have caused me a lust that is greater than the sea and (they themselves) endure the torture of sleeplessness.

Verse: ஓஒ	இனிதே	எமக்கிந்நோய்	செய்தகண்			தாஅம்	இதற்பட்	டது.
Translation: Translation :Oho! how sweet a thing to see! the eye That wrought this pain, in the same gulf doth lie.
Explanation: Explanation :The eyes that have given me this disease have themselves been seized with this (suffering). Oh! I am much delighted.

Verse: உழந்துழந்	துள்நீர்	அறுக	விழைந்திழைந்து			வேண்டி	அவர்க்கண்ட	கண்.
Translation: Translation :Aching, aching, let those exhaust their stream, That melting, melting, that day gazed on him.
Explanation: Explanation :The eyes that became tender and gazed intently on him, may they suffer so much as to dry up the fountain of their tears.

Verse: பேணாது	பெட்டார்	உளர்மன்னோ	மற்றவர்க்			காணாது	அமைவில	கண்.
Translation: Translation :Who loved me once, onloving now doth here remain; Not seeing him, my eye no rest can gain.
Explanation: Explanation :He is indeed here who loved me with his lips but not with his heart but mine eyes suffer from not seeing him.

Verse: வாராக்கால்	துஞ்சா	வரின்துஞ்சா	ஆயிடை			ஆரஞர்	உற்றன	கண்.
Translation: Translation :When he comes not, all slumber flies; no sleep when he is there; Thus every way my eyes have troubles hard to bear.
Explanation: Explanation :When he is away they do not sleep; when he is present they do not sleep; in either case, mine eyes endure unbearable agony.

Verse: மறைபெறல்	ஊரார்க்கு	அரிதன்றால்	எம்போல்			அறைபறை	கண்ணார்	அகத்து.
Translation: Translation :It is not hard for all the town the knowledge to obtain, When eyes, as mine, like beaten tambours, make the mystery plain.
Explanation: Explanation :It is not difficult for the people of this place to understand the secret of those whose eyes, like mine, are as it were beaten drums.

Verse: நயந்தவர்க்கு	நல்காமை	நேர்ந்தேன்	பசந்தவென்			பண்பியார்க்கு	உரைக்கோ	பிற.
Translation: Translation :I willed my lover absent should remain; Of pining's sickly hue to whom shall I complain?
Explanation: Explanation :I who (then) consented to the absence of my loving lord, to whom can I (now) relate the fact of my having turned sallow.

Verse: அவர்தந்தார்	என்னும்	தகையால்	இவர்தந்தென்			மேனிமேல்	ஊரும்	பசப்பு.
Translation: Translation :'He gave': this sickly hue thus proudly speaks, Then climbs, and all my frame its chariot makes.
Explanation: Explanation :Sallowness, as if proud of having been caused by him, would now ride on my person.

Verse: சாயலும்	நாணும்	அவர்கொண்டார்	கைம்மாறா			நோயும்	பசலையும்	தந்து.
Translation: Translation :Of comeliness and shame he me bereft, While pain and sickly hue, in recompense, he left.
Explanation: Explanation :He has taken (away) my beauty and modesty, and given me instead disease and sallowness.

Verse: உள்ளுவன்	மன்யான்	உரைப்பது	அவர்திறமால்			கள்ளம்	பிறவோ	பசப்பு.
Translation: Translation :I meditate his words, his worth is theme of all I say, This sickly hue is false that would my trust betray.
Explanation: Explanation :I think (of him); and what I speak about is but his excellence; still is there sallowness; and this is deceitful.

Verse: உவக்காண்எம்	காதலர்	செல்வார்	இவக்காண்என்			மேனி	பசப்பூர்	வது.
Translation: Translation :My lover there went forth to roam; This pallor of my frame usurps his place at home.
Explanation: Explanation :Just as my lover departed then, did not sallowness spread here on my person ?

Verse: விளக்கற்றம்	பார்க்கும்	இருளேபோல்	கொண்கன்			முயக்கற்றம்	பார்க்கும்	பசப்பு.
Translation: Translation :As darkness waits till lamp expires, to fill the place, This pallor waits till I enjoy no more my lord's embrace.
Explanation: Explanation :Just as darkness waits for the failing light; so does sallowness wait for the laxity of my husband's intercourse.

Verse: புல்லிக்	கிடந்தேன்	புடைபெயர்ந்தேன்	அவ்வளவில்			அள்ளிக்கொள்	வற்றே	பசப்பு.
Translation: Translation :I lay in his embrace, I turned unwittingly; Forthwith this hue, as you might grasp it, came on me.
Explanation: Explanation :I who was in close embrace just turned aside and the moment I did so, sallowness came on me like something to be seized on.

Verse: பசந்தாள்	இவள்என்பது	அல்லால்	இவளைத்			துறந்தார்	அவர்என்பார்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :On me, because I pine, they cast a slur; But no one says, 'He first deserted her.'
Explanation: Explanation :Besides those who say "she has turned sallow" there are none who say "he has forsaken her".

Verse: பசக்கமன்	பட்டாங்கென்	மேனி	நயப்பித்தார்			நன்னிலையர்	ஆவர்	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :Well! let my frame, as now, be sicklied o'er with pain, If he who won my heart's consent, in good estate remain!
Explanation: Explanation :If he is clear of guilt who has conciliated me (to his departure) let my body suffer its due and turn sallow.

Verse: பசப்பெனப்	பேர்பெறுதல்	நன்றே	நயப்பித்தார்			நல்காமை	தூற்றார்	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis well, though men deride me for my sickly hue of pain; If they from calling him unkind, who won my love, refrain.
Explanation: Explanation :It would be good to be said of me that I have turned sallow, if friends do not reproach with unkindness him who pleased me (then).

Verse: தாம்வீழ்வார்	தம்வீழப்	பெற்றவர்	பெற்றாரே			காமத்துக்	காழில்	கனி.
Translation: Translation :The bliss to be beloved by those they love who gains, Of love the stoneless, luscious fruit obtains.
Explanation: Explanation :The women who are beloved by those whom they love, have they have not got the stone-less fruit of sexual delight ?

Verse: வாழ்வார்க்கு	வானம்	பயந்தற்றால்	வீழ்வார்க்கு			வீழ்வார்	அளிக்கும்	அளி.
Translation: Translation :As heaven on living men showers blessings from above, Is tender grace by lovers shown to those they love.
Explanation: Explanation :The bestowal of love by the beloved on those who love them is like the rain raining (at the proper season) on those who live by it.

Verse: வீழுநர்	வீழப்	படுவார்க்கு	அமையுமே			வாழுநம்	என்னும்	செருக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Who love and are beloved to them alone Belongs the boast, 'We've made life's very joys our own.'
Explanation: Explanation :The pride that says "we shall live" suits only those who are loved by their beloved (husbands).

Verse: வீழப்	படுவார்	கெழீஇயிலர்	தாம்வீழ்வார்			வீழப்	படாஅர்	எனின்.
Translation: Translation :Those well-beloved will luckless prove, Unless beloved by those they love.
Explanation: Explanation :Even those who are esteemed (by other women) are devoid of excellence, if they are not loved by their beloved.

Verse: நாம்காதல்	கொண்டார்	நமக்கெவன்	செய்பவோ			தாம்காதல்	கொள்ளாக்	கடை.
Translation: Translation :From him I love to me what gain can be, Unless, as I love him, he loveth me?
Explanation: Explanation :He who is beloved by me, what will he do to me, if I am not beloved by him ?

Verse: ஒருதலையான்	இன்னாது	காமம்காப்	போல			இருதலை	யானும்	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :Love on one side is bad; like balanced load By porter borne, love on both sides is good.
Explanation: Explanation :Lust, like the weight of the KAVADI, pains if it lies in one end only but pleases if it is in both.

Verse: பருவரலும்	பைதலும்	காணான்கொல்	காமன்			ஒருவர்கண்	நின்றொழுகு	வான்.
Translation: Translation :While Kaman rushes straight at me alone, Is all my pain and wasting grief unknown?
Explanation: Explanation :Would not cupid who abides and contends in one party (only) witness the pain and sorrow (in that party)?

Verse: வீழ்வாரின்	இன்சொல்	பெறாஅது	உலகத்து			வாழ்வாரின்	வன்கணார்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :Who hear from lover's lips no pleasant word from day to day, Yet in the world live out their life,- no braver souls than they!
Explanation: Explanation :There is no one in the world so hard-hearted as those who can live without receiving (even) a kind word from their beloved.

Verse: நசைஇயார்	நல்கார்	எனினும்	அவர்மாட்டு			இசையும்	இனிய	செவிக்கு.
Translation: Translation :Though he my heart desires no grace accords to me, Yet every accent of his voice is melody.
Explanation: Explanation :Though my beloved bestows no love on one, still are his words sweet to my ears.

Verse: உறாஅர்க்கு	உறுநோய்	உரைப்பாய்	கடலைச்			செறாஅஅய்	வாழிய	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :Tell him thy pain that loves not thee? Farewell, my soul, fill up the sea!
Explanation: Explanation :Live, O my soul, would you who relate your great sorrow to strangers, try rather to fill up your own sea (of sorrow).

Verse: உள்ளினும்	தீராப்	பெருமகிழ்	செய்தலால்			கள்ளினும்	காமம்	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :From thought of her unfailing gladness springs, Sweeter than palm-rice wine the joy love brings.
Explanation: Explanation :Sexuality is sweeter than liquor, because when remembered, it creates a most rapturous delight.

Verse: எனைத்தொனறு	ஏனிதேகாண்	காமம்தாம்	வீழ்வார்			நினைப்ப	வருவதொன்று	ஏல்.
Translation: Translation :How great is love! Behold its sweetness past belief! Think on the lover, and the spirit knows no grief.
Explanation: Explanation :Even to think of one's beloved gives one no pain. Sexuality, in any degree, is always delightful.

Verse: நினைப்பவர்	போன்று	நினையார்கொல்	தும்மல்			சினைப்பது	போன்று	கெடும்.
Translation: Translation :A fit of sneezing threatened, but it passed away; He seemed to think of me, but do his fancies stray?
Explanation: Explanation :I feel as if I am going to sneeze but do not, and (therefore) my beloved is about to think (of me) but does not.

Verse: யாமும்	உளேங்கொல்	அவர்நெஞ்சத்து	எந்நெஞ்சத்து			ஓஒ	உளரே	அவர்.
Translation: Translation :Have I a place within his heart! From mine, alas! he never doth depart.
Explanation: Explanation :He continues to abide in my soul, do I likewise abide in his ?

Verse: தம்நெஞ்சத்து	எம்மைக்	கடிகொண்டார்	நாணார்கொல்			எம்நெஞ்சத்து	ஓவா	வரல்.
Translation: Translation :Me from his heart he jealously excludes: Hath he no shame who ceaseless on my heart intrudes?
Explanation: Explanation :He who has imprisoned me in his soul, is he ashamed to enter incessantly into mine.

Verse: மற்றியான்	என்னுளேன்	மன்னோ	அவரொடியான்			உற்றநாள்	உள்ள	உளேன்.
Translation: Translation :How live I yet? I live to ponder o'er The days of bliss with him that are no more.
Explanation: Explanation :I live by remembering my (former) intercourse with him; if it were not so, how could I live ?

Verse: மறப்பின்	எவனாவன்	மற்கொல்	மறப்பறியேன்			உள்ளினும்	உள்ளம்	சுடும்.
Translation: Translation :If I remembered not what were I then? And yet, The fiery smart of what my spirit knows not to forget!
Explanation: Explanation :I have never forgotten (the pleasure); even to think of it burns my soul; could I live, if I should ever forget it ?

Verse: எனைத்து	நினைப்பினும்	காயார்	அனைத்தன்றோ			காதலர்	செய்யும்	சிறப்பு.
Translation: Translation :My frequent thought no wrath excites. It is not so? This honour doth my love on me bestow.
Explanation: Explanation :He will not be angry however much I may think of him; is it not so much the delight my beloved affords me ?

Verse: விளியுமென்	இன்னுயிர்	வேறல்லம்	என்பார்			அளியின்மை	ஆற்ற	நினைந்து.
Translation: Translation :Dear life departs, when his ungracious deeds I ponder o'er, Who said erewhile, 'We're one for evermore'.
Explanation: Explanation :My precious life is wasting away by thinking too much on the cruelty of him who said we were not different.

Verse: விடாஅது	சென்றாரைக்	கண்ணினால்	காணப்			படாஅதி	வாழி	மதி.
Translation: Translation :Set not; so may'st thou prosper, moon! that eyes may see My love who went away, but ever bides with me.
Explanation: Explanation :May you live, O Moon! Do not set, that I mine see him who has departed without quitting my soul.

Verse: காதலர்	தூதொடு	வந்த	கனவினுக்கு			யாதுசெய்	வேன்கொல்	விருந்து.
Translation: Translation :It came and brought to me, that nightly vision rare, A message from my love,- what feast shall I prepare?
Explanation: Explanation :Where with shall I feast the dream which has brought me my dear one's messenger ?

Verse: கயலுண்கண்	யானிரப்பத்	துஞ்சிற்	கலந்தார்க்கு			உயலுண்மை	சாற்றுவேன்	மன்.
Translation: Translation :If my dark, carp-like eye will close in sleep, as I implore, The tale of my long-suffering life I'll tell my loved one o'er.
Explanation: Explanation :If my fish-like painted eyes should, at my begging, close in sleep, I could fully relate my sufferings to my lord.

Verse: நனவினால்	நல்கா	தவரைக்	கனவினால்			காண்டலின்	உண்டென்	உயிர்.
Translation: Translation :Him, who in waking hour no kindness shows, In dreams I see; and so my lifetime goes!
Explanation: Explanation :My life lasts because in my dream I behold him who does not favour me in my waking hours.

Verse: கனவினான்	உண்டாகும்	காமம்	நனவினான்			நல்காரை	நாடித்	தரற்கு.
Translation: Translation :Some pleasure I enjoy when him who loves not me In waking hours, the vision searches out and makes me see.
Explanation: Explanation :There is pleasure in my dream, because in it I seek and obtain him who does not visit me in my wakefulness.

Verse: நனவினால்	கண்டதூஉம்	ஆங்கே	கனவுந்தான்			கண்ட	பொழுதே	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :As what I then beheld in waking hour was sweet, So pleasant dreams in hour of sleep my spirit greet.
Explanation: Explanation :I saw him in my waking hours, and then it was pleasant; I see him just now in my dream, and it is (equally) pleasant.

Verse: நனவென	ஒன்றில்லை	ஆயின்	கனவினால்			காதலர்	நீங்கலர்	மன்.
Translation: Translation :And if there were no waking hour, my love In dreams would never from my side remove.
Explanation: Explanation :Were there no such thing as wakefulness, my beloved (who visited me) in my dream would not depart from me.

Verse: நனவினால்	நல்காக்	கொடியார்	கனவனால்			என்எம்மைப்	பீழிப்	பது.
Translation: Translation :The cruel one, in waking hour, who all ungracious seems, Why should he thus torment my soul in nightly dreams?
Explanation: Explanation :The cruel one who would not favour me in my wakefulness, what right has he to torture me in my dreams?

Verse: துஞ்சுங்கால்	தோள்மேலர்	ஆகி	விழிக்குங்கால்			நெஞ்சத்தர்	ஆவர்	விரைந்து.
Translation: Translation :And when I sleep he holds my form embraced; And when I wake to fill my heart makes haste!
Explanation: Explanation :When I am asleep he rests on my shoulders, (but) when I awake he hastens into my soul.

Verse: நனவினால்	நல்காரை	நோவர்	கனவினால்			காதலர்க்	காணா	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :In dreams who ne'er their lover's form perceive, For those in waking hours who show no love will grieve.
Explanation: Explanation :They who have no dear ones to behold in their dreams blame him who visits me not in my waking hours.

Verse: நனவினால்	நம்நீத்தார்	என்பர்	கனவினால்			காணார்கொல்	இவ்வூ	ரவர்.
Translation: Translation :They say, that he in waking hours has left me lone; In dreams they surely see him not,- these people of the town;
Explanation: Explanation :The women of this place say he has forsaken me in my wakefulness. I think they have not seen him visit me in my dreams.

Verse: மாலையோ	அல்லை	மணந்தார்	உயிருண்ணும்			வேலைநீ	வாழி	பொழுது.
Translation: Translation :Thou art not evening, but a spear that doth devour The souls of brides; farewell, thou evening hour!
Explanation: Explanation :Live, O you evening are you (the former) evening? No, you are the season that slays (married) women.

Verse: புன்கண்ணை	வாழி	மருள்மாலை	எம்கேள்போல்			வன்கண்ண	தோநின்	துணை.
Translation: Translation :Thine eye is sad; Hail, doubtful hour of eventide! Of cruel eye, as is my spouse, is too thy bride?
Explanation: Explanation :A long life to you, O dark evening! You are sightless. Is your help-mate (also) as hard-hearted as mine.

Verse: பனிஅரும்பிப்	பைதல்கொள்	மாலை	துனிஅரும்பித்			துன்பம்	வளர	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :With buds of chilly dew wan evening's shade enclose; My anguish buds space and all my sorrow grows.
Explanation: Explanation :The evening that (once) came in with trembling and dimness (now) brings me an aversion for life and increasing sorrow.

Verse: காதலர்	இல்வழி	மாலை	கொலைக்களத்து			ஏதிலர்	போல	வரும்.
Translation: Translation :When absent is my love, the evening hour descends, As when an alien host to field of battle wends.
Explanation: Explanation :In the absence of my lover, evening comes in like slayers on the field of slaughter.

Verse: காலைக்குச்	செய்தநன்று	என்கொல்	எவன்கொல்யான்			மாலைக்குச்	செய்த	பகை.
Translation: Translation :O morn, how have I won thy grace? thou bring'st relief O eve, why art thou foe! thou dost renew my grief.
Explanation: Explanation :What good have I done to morning (and) what evil to evening?

Verse: மாலைநோய்	செய்தல்	மணந்தார்	அகலாத			காலை	அறிந்த	திலேன்.
Translation: Translation :The pangs that evening brings I never knew, Till he, my wedded spouse, from me withdrew.
Explanation: Explanation :Previous to my husband's departure, I know not the painful nature of evening.

Verse: காலை	அரும்பிப்	பகலெல்லாம்	போதாகி			மாலை	மலரும்இந்	நோய்.
Translation: Translation :My grief at morn a bud, all day an opening flower, Full-blown expands in evening hour.
Explanation: Explanation :This malady buds forth in the morning, expands all day long and blossoms in the evening.

Verse: அழல்போலும்	மாலைக்குத்	தூதாகி	ஆயன்			குழல்போலும்	கொல்லும்	படை.
Translation: Translation :The shepherd's pipe is like a murderous weapon, to my ear, For it proclaims the hour of ev'ning's fiery anguish near.
Explanation: Explanation :The shepherd's flute now sounds as a fiery forerunner of night, and is become a weapon that slays (me).

Verse: பதிமருண்டு	பைதல்	உழக்கும்	மதிமருண்டு			மாலை	படர்தரும்	போழ்து.
Translation: Translation :If evening's shades, that darken all my soul, extend; From this afflicted town will would of grief ascend.
Explanation: Explanation :When night comes on confusing (everyone's) mind, the (whole) town will lose its sense and be plunged in sorrow.

Verse: பொருள்மாலை	யாளரை	உள்ளி	மருள்மாலை			மாயும்என்	மாயா	உயிர்.
Translation: Translation :This darkening eve, my darkling soul must perish utterly; Remembering him who seeks for wealth, but seeks not me.
Explanation: Explanation :My (hitherto) unextinguished life is now lost in this bewildering night at the thought of him who has the nature of wealth.

Verse: சிறுமை	நமக்கொழியச்	சேட்சென்றார்	உள்ளி			நறுமலர்	நாணின	கண்.
Translation: Translation :Thine eyes grown dim are now ashamed the fragrant flow'rs to see, Thinking on him, who wand'ring far, leaves us in misery.
Explanation: Explanation :While we endure the unbearable sorrow, your eyes weep for him who is gone afar, and shun (the sight of) fragrant flowers.

Verse: நயந்தவர்	நல்காமை	சொல்லுவ	போலும்			பசந்து	பனிவாரும்	கண்.
Translation: Translation :The eye, with sorrow wan, all wet with dew of tears, As witness of the lover's lack of love appears.
Explanation: Explanation :The discoloured eyes that shed tears profusely seem to betray the unkindness of our beloved.

Verse: தணந்தமை	சால	அறிவிப்ப	போலும்			மணந்தநாள்	வீங்கிய	தோள்.
Translation: Translation :These withered arms, desertion's pangs abundantly display, That swelled with joy on that glad nuptial day.
Explanation: Explanation :The shoulders that swelled on the day of our union (now) seem to announce our separation clearly (to the public).

Verse: பணைநீங்கிப்	பைந்தொடி	சோரும்	துணைநீங்கித்			தொல்கவின்	வாடிய	தோள்.
Translation: Translation :When lover went, then faded all their wonted charms, And armlets' golden round slips off from these poor wasted arms.
Explanation: Explanation :In the absence of your consort, your shoulders having lost their former beauty and fulness, your bracelets of pure gold have become loose.

Verse: கொடியார்	கொடுமை	உரைக்கும்	தொடியொடு			தொல்கவின்	வாடிய	தோள்.
Translation: Translation :These wasted arms, the bracelet with their wonted beauty gone, The cruelty declare of that most cruel one.
Explanation: Explanation :The (loosened) bracelets, and the shoulders from which the old beauty has faded, relate the cruelty of the pitiless one.

Verse: தொடியொடு	தோள்நெகிழ	நோவல்	அவரைக்			கொடியர்	எனக்கூறல்	நொந்து.
Translation: Translation :I grieve, 'tis pain to me to hear him cruel chid, Because the armlet from my wasted arm has slid.
Explanation: Explanation :I am greatly pained to hear you call him a cruel man, just because your shoulders are reduced and your bracelets loosened.

Verse: பாடுபெறுதியோ	நெஞ்சே	கொடியார்க்கென்	வாடுதோட்			பூசல்	உரைத்து.
Translation: Translation :My heart! say ought of glory wilt thou gain, If to that cruel one thou of thy wasted arms complain?
Explanation: Explanation :Can you O my soul! gain glory by relating to the (so-called) cruel one the clamour of my fading shoulders?

Verse: முயங்கிய	கைகளை	ஊக்கப்	பசந்தது			பைந்தொடிப்	பேதை	நுதல்.
Translation: Translation :One day the fervent pressure of embracing arms I checked, Grew wan the forehead of the maid with golden armlet decked.
Explanation: Explanation :When I once loosened the arms that were in embrace, the forehead of the gold-braceleted women turned sallow.

Verse: முயக்கிடைத்	தண்வளி	போழப்	பசப்புற்ற			பேதை	பெருமழைக்	கண்.
Translation: Translation :As we embraced a breath of wind found entrance there; The maid's large liquid eyes were dimmed with care.
Explanation: Explanation :When but a breath of breeze penetrated our embrace, her large cool eyes became sallow.

Verse: கண்ணின்	பசப்போ	பருவரல்	எய்தின்றே			ஒண்ணுதல்	செய்தது	கண்டு.
Translation: Translation :The dimness of her eye felt sorrow now, Beholding what was done by that bright brow.
Explanation: Explanation :Was it at the sight of what the bright forehead had done that the sallowness of her eyes became sad?

Verse: நினைத்தொன்று	சொல்லாயோ	நெஞ்சே	எனைத்தொன்றும்			எவ்வநோய்	தீர்க்கும்	மருந்து.
Translation: Translation :My heart, canst thou not thinking of some med'cine tell, Not any one, to drive away this grief incurable?
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul, will you not think and tell me some medicine be it what it may, that can cure this incurable malady?

Verse: காதல்	அவரிலர்	ஆகநீ	நோவது			பேதைமை	வாழியென்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :Since he loves not, thy smart Is folly, fare thee well my heart!
Explanation: Explanation :May you live, O my soul! While he is without love, for you to suffer is (simple) folly.

Verse: இருந்துள்ளி	என்பரிதல்	நெஞ்சே	பரிந்துள்ளல்			பைதல்நோய்	செய்தார்கண்	இல்.
Translation: Translation :What comes of sitting here in pining thought, O heart? He knows No pitying thought, the cause of all these wasting woes.
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! why remain (here) and suffer thinking (of him)? There are no lewd thoughts (of you) in him who has caused you this disease of sorrow.

Verse: கண்ணும்	கொளச்சேறி	நெஞ்சே	இவையென்னைத்			தின்னும்	அவர்க்காணல்	உற்று.
Translation: Translation :O rid me of these eyes, my heart; for they, Longing to see him, wear my life away.
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! take my eyes also with you, (if not), these would eat me up (in their desire) to see him.

Verse: செற்றார்	எனக்கை	விடல்உண்டோ	நெஞ்சேயாம்			உற்றால்	உறாஅ	தவர்.
Translation: Translation :O heart, as a foe, can I abandon utterly Him who, though I long for him, longs not for me?
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! can he who loves not though he is beloved, be forsaken saying he hates me (now)?

Verse: கலந்துணர்த்தும்	காதலர்க்	கண்டாற்	புலந்துணராய்			பொய்க்காய்வு	காய்திஎன்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :My heart, false is the fire that burns; thou canst not wrath maintain, If thou thy love behold, embracing, soothing all thy pain.
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! when you see the dear one who remove dislike by intercourse, you are displeased and continue to be so. Nay, your displeasure is (simply) false.

Verse: காமம்	விடுஒன்றோ	நாண்விடு	நன்னெஞ்சே			யானோ	பொறேன்இவ்	விரண்டு.
Translation: Translation :Or bid thy love, or bid thy shame depart; For me, I cannot bear them both, my worthy heart!
Explanation: Explanation :O my good soul, give up either lust or honour, as for me I can endure neither.

Verse: பரிந்தவர்	நல்காரென்று	ஏங்கிப்	பிரிந்தவர்			பின்செல்வாய்	பேதைஎன்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :Thou art befooled, my heart, thou followest him who flees from thee; And still thou yearning criest: 'He will nor pity show nor love to me.'
Explanation: Explanation :You are a fool, O my soul! to go after my departed one, while you mourn that he is not kind enough to favour you.

Verse: உள்ளத்தார்	காத	லவரால்	உள்ளிநீ			யாருழைச்	சேறியென்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :My heart! my lover lives within my mind; Roaming, whom dost thou think to find?
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! to whom would you repair, while the dear one is within yourself?

Verse: துன்னாத்	துறந்தாரை	நெஞ்சத்து	உடையேமா			இன்னும்	இழத்தும்	கவின்.
Translation: Translation :If I should keep in mind the man who utterly renounces me, My soul must suffer further loss of dignity.
Explanation: Explanation :If I retain in my heart him who has left me without befriending me, I shall lose even the (inward) beauty that remains.

Verse: காமக்	கணிச்சி	உடைக்கும்	நிறையென்னும்			நாணுத்தாழ்	வீழ்த்த	கதவு.
Translation: Translation :Of womanly reserve love's axe breaks through the door, Barred by the bolt of shame before.
Explanation: Explanation :The axe of lust can break the door of chastity which is bolted with the bolt of modesty.

Verse: காமம்	எனவொன்றோ	கண்ணின்றென்	நெஞ்சத்தை			யாமத்தும்	ஆளும்	தொழில்.
Translation: Translation :What men call love is the one thing of merciless power; It gives my soul no rest, e'en in the midnight hour.
Explanation: Explanation :Even at midnight is my mind worried by lust, and this one thing, alas! is without mercy.

Verse: மறைப்பேன்மன்	காமத்தை	யானோ	குறிப்பின்றித்			தும்மல்போல்	தோன்றி	விடும்.
Translation: Translation :I would my love conceal, but like a sneeze It shows itself, and gives no warning sign.
Explanation: Explanation :I would conceal my lust, but alas, it yields not to my will but breaks out like a sneeze.

Verse: நிறையுடையேன்	என்பேன்மன்	யானோஎன்	காமம்			மறையிறந்து	மன்று	படும்.
Translation: Translation :In womanly reserve I deemed myself beyond assail; But love will come abroad, and casts away the veil.
Explanation: Explanation :I say I would be firm, but alas, my malady breaks out from its concealment and appears in public.

Verse: செற்றார்பின்	செல்லாப்	பெருந்தகைமை	காமநோய்			உற்றார்	அறிவதொன்று	அன்று.
Translation: Translation :The dignity that seeks not him who acts as foe, Is the one thing that loving heart can never know.
Explanation: Explanation :The dignity that would not go after an absent lover is not known to those who are sticken by love.

Verse: செற்றவர்	பின்சேறல்	வேண்டி	அளித்தரோ			எற்றென்னை	உற்ற	துயர்.
Translation: Translation :My grief how full of grace, I pray you see! It seeks to follow him that hateth me.
Explanation: Explanation :The sorrow I have endured by desiring to go after my absent lover, in what way is it excellent?

Verse: நாணென	ஒன்றோ	அறியலம்	காமத்தால்			பேணியார்	பெட்ப	செயின்.
Translation: Translation :No sense of shame my gladdened mind shall prove, When he returns my longing heart to bless with love.
Explanation: Explanation :I know nothing like shame when my beloved does from love (just) what is desired (by me).

Verse: பன்மாயக்	கள்வன்	பணிமொழி	அன்றோநம்			பெண்மை	உடைக்கும்	படை.
Translation: Translation :The words of that deceiver, versed in every wily art, Are instruments that break through every guard of woman's heart!
Explanation: Explanation :Are not the enticing words of my trick-abounding roguish lover the weapon that breaks away my feminine firmness?

Verse: புலப்பல்	எனச்சென்றேன்	புல்லினேன்	நெஞ்சம்			கலத்தல்	உறுவது	கண்டு.
Translation: Translation :'I 'll shun his greeting'; saying thus with pride away I went: I held him in my arms, for straight I felt my heart relent.
Explanation: Explanation :I said I would feign dislike and so went (away); (but) I embraced him the moment I say my mind began to unite with him!

Verse: நிணந்தீயில்	இட்டன்ன	நெஞ்சினார்க்கு	உண்டோ			புணர்ந்தூடி	நிற்பேம்	எனல்.
Translation: Translation :'We 'll stand aloof and then embrace': is this for them to say, Whose hearts are as the fat that in the blaze dissolves away?
Explanation: Explanation :Is it possible for those whose hearts melt like fat in the fire to say they can feign a strong dislike and remain so?

Verse: வாளற்றுப்	புற்கென்ற	கண்ணும்	அவர்சென்ற			நாளொற்றித்	தேய்ந்த	விரல்.
Translation: Translation :My eyes have lost their brightness, sight is dimmed; my fingers worn, With nothing on the wall the days since I was left forlorn.
Explanation: Explanation :My finger has worn away by marking (on the wall) the days he has been absent while my eyes have lost their lustre and begin to fail.

Verse: இலங்கிழாய்	இன்று	மறப்பின்என்	தோள்மேல்			கலங்கழியும்	காரிகை	நீத்து.
Translation: Translation :O thou with gleaming jewels decked, could I forget for this one day, Henceforth these bracelets from my arms will slip, my beauty worn away.
Explanation: Explanation :O you bright-jewelled maid, if I forget (him) today, my shoulders will lose their beauty even in the other life and make my bracelets loose.

Verse: உரன்நசைஇ	உள்ளம்	துணையாகச்	சென்றார்			வரல்நசைஇ	இன்னும்	உளேன்.
Translation: Translation :On victory intent, His mind sole company he went; And I yet life sustain! And long to see his face again!
Explanation: Explanation :I still live by longing for the arrival of him who has gone out of love for victory and with valour as his guide.

Verse: கூடிய	காமம்	பிர஧ந்தார்	வரவுள்ளிக்			கோடுகொ	டேறுமென்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :'He comes again, who left my side, and I shall taste love's joy,'- My heart with rapture swells, when thoughts like these my mind employ.
Explanation: Explanation :My heart is rid of its sorrow and swells with rapture to think of my absent lover returning with his love.

Verse: காண்கமன்	கொண்கனைக்	கண்ணாரக்	கண்டபின்			நீங்கும்என்	மென்தோள்	பசப்பு.
Translation: Translation :O let me see my spouse again and sate these longing eyes! That instant from my wasted frame all pallor flies.
Explanation: Explanation :May I look on my lover till I am satisfied and thereafter will vanish the sallowness of my slender shoulders.

Verse: வருகமன்	கொண்கன்	ஒருநாள்	பருகுவன்			பைதல்நோய்	எல்லாம்	கெட.
Translation: Translation :O let my spouse but come again to me one day! I'll drink that nectar: wasting grief shall flee away.
Explanation: Explanation :May my husband return some day; and then will I enjoy (him) so as to destroy all this agonizing sorrow.

Verse: புலப்பேன்கொல்	புல்லுவேன்	கொல்லோ	கலப்பேன்கொல்			கண்அன்ன	கேளிர்	விரன்.
Translation: Translation :Shall I draw back, or yield myself, or shall both mingled be, When he returns, my spouse, dear as these eyes to me.
Explanation: Explanation :On the return of him who is as dear as my eyes, am I displeased or am I to embrace (him); or am I to do both?

Verse: வினைகலந்து	வென்றீக	வேந்தன்	மனைகலந்து			மாலை	அயர்கம்	விருந்து.
Translation: Translation :O would my king would fight, o'ercome, devide the spoil; At home, to-night, the banquet spread should crown the toil.
Explanation: Explanation :Let the king fight and gain (victories); (but) let me be united to my wife and feast the evening.

Verse: ஒருநாள்	எழுநாள்போல்	செல்லும்சேண்	சென்றார்			வருநாள்வைத்து	ஏங்கு	பவர்க்கு.
Translation: Translation :One day will seem like seven to those who watch and yearn For that glad day when wanderers from afar return.
Explanation: Explanation :To those who suffer waiting for the day of return of their distant lovers one day is as long as seven days.

Verse: பெறின்என்னாம்	பெற்றக்கால்	என்னாம்	உறினென்னாம்			உள்ளம்	உடைந்துக்கக்	கால்.
Translation: Translation :What's my return, the meeting hour, the wished-for greeting worth, If she heart-broken lie, with all her life poured forth?
Explanation: Explanation :After (my wife) has died of a broken heart, what good will there be if she is to receive me, has received me, or has even embraced me?

Verse: கரப்பினுங்	கையிகந்	தொல்லாநின்	உண்கண்			உரைக்கல்	உறுவதொன்	றுண்டு.
Translation: Translation :Thou hid'st it, yet thine eye, disdaining all restraint, Something, I know not, what, would utter of complaint.
Explanation: Explanation :Though you would conceal (your feelings), your painted eyes would not, for, transgressing (their bounds), they tell (me) something.

Verse: கண்ணிறைந்த	காரிகைக்	காம்பேர்தோட்	பேதைக்குப்			பெண்நிறைந்த	நீர்மை	பெரிது.
Translation: Translation :The simple one whose beauty fills mine eye, whose shoulders curve Like bambu stem, hath all a woman's modest sweet reserve.
Explanation: Explanation :Unusually great is the female simplicity of your maid whose beauty fills my eyes and whose shoulders resemble the bamboo.

Verse: மணியில்	திகழ்தரு	நூல்போல்	மடந்தை			அணியில்	திகழ்வதொன்று	உண்டு.
Translation: Translation :As through the crystal beads is seen the thread on which they 're strung So in her beauty gleams some thought cannot find a tongue.
Explanation: Explanation :There is something that is implied in the beauty of this woman, like the thread that is visible in a garland of gems.

Verse: முகைமொக்குள்	உள்ளது	நாற்றம்போல்	பேதை			நகைமொக்குள்	உள்ளதொன்	றுண்டு.
Translation: Translation :As fragrance in the opening bud, some secret lies Concealed in budding smile of this dear damsel's eyes.
Explanation: Explanation :There is something in the unmatured smile of this maid like the fragrance that is contained in an unblossomed bud.

Verse: செறிதொடி	செய்திறந்த	கள்ளம்	உறுதுயர்			தீர்க்கும்	மருந்தொன்று	உடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :The secret wiles of her with thronging armlets decked, Are medicines by which my raising grief is checked.
Explanation: Explanation :The well-meant departure of her whose bangles are tight-fitting contains a remedy that can cure my great sorrow.

Verse: பெரிதாற்றிப்	பெட்பக்	கலத்தல்	அரிதாற்றி			அன்பின்மை	சூழ்வ	துடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :While lovingly embracing me, his heart is only grieved: It makes me think that I again shall live of love bereaved.
Explanation: Explanation :The embrace that fills me with comfort and gladness is capable of enduring (my former) sorrow and meditating on his want of love.

Verse: தண்ணந்	துறைவன்	தணந்தமை	நம்மினும்			முன்னம்	உணர்ந்த	வளை.
Translation: Translation :My severance from the lord of this cool shore, My very armlets told me long before.
Explanation: Explanation :My bracelets have understood before me the (mental) separation of him who rules the cool seashore.

Verse: நெருநற்றுச்	சென்றார்எம்	காதலர்	யாமும்			எழுநாளேம்	மேனி	பசந்து.
Translation: Translation :My loved one left me, was it yesterday? Days seven my pallid body wastes away!
Explanation: Explanation :It was but yesterday my lover departed (from me); and it is seven days since my complexion turned sallow.

Verse: தொடிநோக்கி	மென்தோளும்	நோக்கி	அடிநோக்கி			அஃதாண்	டவள்செய்	தது.
Translation: Translation :She viewed her tender arms, she viewed the armlets from them slid; She viewed her feet: all this the lady did.
Explanation: Explanation :She looked at her bracelets, her tender shoulders, and her feet; this was what she did there (significantly).

Verse: பெண்ணினால்	பெண்மை	உடைத்தென்ப	கண்ணினால்			காமநோய்	சொல்லி	இரவு.
Translation: Translation :To show by eye the pain of love, and for relief to pray, Is womanhood's most womanly device, men say.
Explanation: Explanation :To express their love-sickness by their eyes and resort to begging bespeaks more than ordinary female excellence.

Verse: உள்ளக்	களித்தலும்	காண	மகிழ்தலும்			கள்ளுக்கில்	காமத்திற்	குண்டு.
Translation: Translation :Gladness at the thought, rejoicing at the sight, Not palm-tree wine, but love, yields such delight.
Explanation: Explanation :To please by thought and cheer by sight is peculiar, not to liquor but lust.

Verse: தினைத்துணையும்	ஊடாமை	வேண்டும்	பனைத்துணையும்			காமம்	நிறைய	வரின்.
Translation: Translation :When as palmyra tall, fulness of perfect love we gain, Distrust can find no place small as the millet grain.
Explanation: Explanation :If women have a lust that exceeds even the measure of the palmyra fruit, they will not desire (to feign) dislike even as much as the millet.

Verse: பேணாது	பெட்பவே	செய்யினும்	கொண்கனைக்			காணா	தமையல	கண்.
Translation: Translation :Although his will his only law, he lightly value me, My heart knows no repose unless my lord I see.
Explanation: Explanation :Though my eyes disregard me and do what is pleasing to my husband, still will they not be satisfied unless they see him.

Verse: ஊடற்கண்	சென்றேன்மன்	தோழி	அதுமறந்து			கூடற்கண்	சென்றதுஎன்	னெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :My friend, I went prepared to show a cool disdain; My heart, forgetting all, could not its love restrain.
Explanation: Explanation :O my friend! I was prepared to feign displeasure but my mind forgetting it was ready to embrace him.

Verse: எழுதுங்கால்	கோல்காணாக்	கண்ணேபோல்	கொண்கன்			பழிகாணேன்	கண்ட	இடத்து.
Translation: Translation :The eye sees not the rod that paints it; nor can I See any fault, when I behold my husband nigh.
Explanation: Explanation :Like the eyes which see not the pencil that paints it, I cannot see my husband's fault (just) when I meet him.

Verse: காணுங்கால்	காணேன்	தவறாய	காணாக்கால்			காணேன்	தவறல்	லவை.
Translation: Translation :When him I see, to all his faults I 'm blind; But when I see him not, nothing but faults I find.
Explanation: Explanation :When I see my husband, I do not see any faults; but when I do not see him, I do not see anything but faults.

Verse: உய்த்தல்	அறிந்து	புனல்பாய்	பவரேபோல்			பொய்த்தல்	அறிந்தென்	புலந்து.
Translation: Translation :As those of rescue sure, who plunge into the stream, So did I anger feign, though it must falsehood seem?
Explanation: Explanation :Like those who leap into a stream which they know will carry them off, why should a wife feign dislike which she knows cannot hold out long?

Verse: இளித்தக்க	இன்னா	செயினும்	களித்தார்க்குக்			கள்ளற்றே	கள்வநின்	மார்பு.
Translation: Translation :Though shameful ill it works, dear is the palm-tree wine To drunkards; traitor, so to me that breast of thine!
Explanation: Explanation :O you rogue! your breast is to me what liquor is to those who rejoice in it, though it only gives them an unpleasant disgrace.

Verse: மலரினும்	மெல்லிது	காமம்	சிலர்அதன்			செவ்வி	தலைப்படு	வார்.
Translation: Translation :Love is tender as an opening flower. In season due To gain its perfect bliss is rapture known to few.
Explanation: Explanation :Sexual delight is more delicate than a flower, and few are those who understand its real nature.

Verse: கண்ணின்	துனித்தே	கலங்கினாள்	புல்லுதல்			என்னினும்	தான்விதுப்	புற்று.
Translation: Translation :Her eye, as I drew nigh one day, with anger shone: By love o'erpowered, her tenderness surpassed my own.
Explanation: Explanation :She once feigned dislike in her eyes, but the warmth of her embrace exceeded my own.

Verse: அவர்நெஞ்சு	அவர்க்காதல்	கண்டும்	எவன்நெஞ்சே			நீஎமக்கு	ஆகா	தது.
Translation: Translation :You see his heart is his alone O heart, why not be all my own?
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! although you have seen how his soul stands by him, how is it you do not stand by me?

Verse: உறாஅ	தவர்க்கண்ட	கண்ணும்	அவரைச்			செறாஅரெனச்	சேறியென்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :'Tis plain, my heart, that he 's estranged from thee; Why go to him as though he were not enemy?
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! although you have known him who does not love me, still do you go to him, saying "he will not be displeased."

Verse: கெட்டார்க்கு	நட்டார்இல்	என்பதோ	நெஞ்சேநீ			பெட்டாங்கு	அவர்பின்	செலல்.
Translation: Translation :'The ruined have no friends, 'they say; and so, my heart, To follow him, at thy desire, from me thou dost depart.
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! do you follow him at pleasure under the belief that the ruined have no friends?

Verse: இனிஅன்ன	நின்னொடு	சூழ்வார்யார்	நெஞ்சே			துனிசெய்து	துவ்வாய்காண்	மற்று.
Translation: Translation :'See, thou first show offended pride, and then submit,' I bade; Henceforth such council who will share with thee my heart?
Explanation: Explanation :O my soul! you would not first seem sulky and then enjoy (him); who then would in future consult you about such things?

Verse: பெறாஅமை	அஞ்சும்	பெறின்பிரிவு	அஞ்சும்			அறாஅ	இடும்பைத்தென்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :I fear I shall not gain, I fear to lose him when I gain; And thus my heart endures unceasing pain.
Explanation: Explanation :My soul fears when it is without him; it also fears when it is with him; it is subject to incessant sorrow.

Verse: தனியே	இருந்து	நினைத்தக்கால்	என்னைத்			தினிய	இருந்ததென்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :My heart consumes me when I ponder lone, And all my lover's cruelty bemoan.
Explanation: Explanation :My mind has been (here) in order to eat me up (as it were) whenever I think of him in my solitude.

Verse: நாணும்	மறந்தேன்	அவர்மறக்	கல்லாஎன்			மாணா	மடநெஞ்சிற்	பட்டு.
Translation: Translation :Fall'n 'neath the sway of this ignoble foolish heart, Which will not him forget, I have forgotten shame.
Explanation: Explanation :I have even forgotten my modesty, having been caught in my foolish mind which is not dignified enough to forget him.

Verse: எள்ளின்	இளிவாம்என்று	எண்ணி	அவர்திறம்			உள்ளும்	உயிர்க்காதல்	நெஞ்சு.
Translation: Translation :If I contemn him, then disgrace awaits me evermore; My soul that seeks to live his virtues numbers o'er.
Explanation: Explanation :My soul which clings to life thinks only of his (own) gain in the belief that it would be disgraceful for it to despise him.

Verse: துன்பத்திற்கு	யாரே	துணையாவார்	தாமுடைய			நெஞ்சந்	துணையல்	வழி.
Translation: Translation :And who will aid me in my hour of grief, If my own heart comes not to my relief?
Explanation: Explanation :Who would help me out of one's distress, when one's own soul refuses help to one?

Verse: தஞ்சம்	தமரல்லர்	ஏதிலார்	தாமுடைய			நெஞ்சம்	தமரல்	வழி.
Translation: Translation :A trifle is unfriendliness by aliens shown, When our own heart itself is not our own!
Explanation: Explanation :It is hardly possible for strangers to behave like relations, when one's own soul acts like a stranger.

Verse: புல்லா	திராஅப்	புலத்தை	அவர்உறும்			அல்லல்நோய்	காண்கம்	சிறிது.
Translation: Translation :Be still reserved, decline his profferred love; A little while his sore distress we 'll prove.
Explanation: Explanation :Let us witness awhile his keen suffering; just feign dislike and embrace him not.

Verse: உப்பமைந்	தற்றால்	புலவி	அதுசிறிது			மிக்கற்றால்	நீள	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :A cool reserve is like the salt that seasons well the mess, Too long maintained, 'tis like the salt's excess.
Explanation: Explanation :A little dislike is like salt in proportion; to prolong it a little is like salt a little too much.

Verse: அலந்தாரை	அல்லல்நோய்	செய்தற்றால்	தம்மைப்			புலந்தாரைப்	புல்லா	விடல்.
Translation: Translation :'Tis heaping griefs on those whose hearts are grieved; To leave the grieving one without a fond embrace.
Explanation: Explanation :For men not to embrace those who have feigned dislike is like torturing those already in agony.

Verse: ஊடி	யவரை	உணராமை	வாடிய			வள்ளி	முதலரிந்	தற்று.
Translation: Translation :To use no kind conciliating art when lover grieves, Is cutting out the root of tender winding plant that droops.
Explanation: Explanation :Not to reconcile those who have feigned dislike is like cutting a faded creeper at its root.

Verse: நலத்தகை	நல்லவர்க்கு	ஏஎர்	புலத்தகை			பூஅன்ன	கண்ணார்	அகத்து.
Translation: Translation :Even to men of good and worthy mind, the petulance Of wives with flowery eyes lacks not a lovely grace.
Explanation: Explanation :An increased shyness in those whose eyes are like flowers is beautiful even to good and virtuous husbands.

Verse: துனியும்	புலவியும்	இல்லாயின்	காமம்			கனியும்	கருக்காயும்	அற்று.
Translation: Translation :Love without hatred is ripened fruit; Without some lesser strife, fruit immature.
Explanation: Explanation :Sexual pleasure, without prolonged and short-lived dislike, is like too ripe, and unripe fruit.

Verse: ஊடலின்	உண்டாங்கோர்	துன்பம்	புணர்வது			நீடுவ	தன்றுகொல்	என்று.
Translation: Translation :A lovers' quarrel brings its pain, when mind afraid Asks doubtful, 'Will reunion sweet be long delayed?'
Explanation: Explanation :The doubt as to whether intercourse would take place soon or not, creates a sorrow (even) in feigned dislike.

Verse: நோதல்	எவன்மற்று	நொந்தாரென்று	அஃதறியும்			காதலர்	இல்லா	வழி.
Translation: Translation :What good can grieving do, when none who love Are there to know the grief thy soul endures?
Explanation: Explanation :What avails sorrow when I am without a wife who can understand the cause of my sorrow?

Verse: நீரும்	நிழலது	இனிதே	புலவியும்			வீழுநர்	கண்ணே	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :Water is pleasant in the cooling shade; So coolness for a time with those we love.
Explanation: Explanation :Like water in the shade, dislike is delicious only in those who love.

Verse: ஊடல்	உணங்க	விடுவாரோடு	என்நெஞ்சம்			கூடுவேம்	என்பது	அவா.
Translation: Translation :Of her who leaves me thus in variance languishing, To think within my heart with love is fond desire.
Explanation: Explanation :It is nothing but strong desire that makes her mind unite with me who can leave her to her own dislike.

Verse: பெண்ணியலார்	எல்லாரும்	கண்ணின்	பொதுஉண்பர்			நண்ணேன்	பரத்தநின்	மார்பு.
Translation: Translation :From thy regard all womankind Enjoys an equal grace; O thou of wandering fickle mind, I shrink from thine embrace!
Explanation: Explanation :You are given to prostitution; all those who are born as womankind enjoy you with their eyes in an ordinary way. I will not embrace you.

Verse: ஊடி	இருந்தேமாத்	தும்மினார்	யாம்தம்மை			நீடுவாழ்	கென்பாக்	கறிந்து.
Translation: Translation :One day we silent sulked; he sneezed: The reason well I knew; He thought that I, to speak well pleased, Would say, 'Long life to you!'
Explanation: Explanation :When I continued to be sulky he sneezed and thought I would (then) wish him a long life.

Verse: கோட்டுப்பூச்	சூடினும்	காயும்	ஒருத்தியைக்			காட்டிய	சூடினீர்	என்று.
Translation: Translation :I wreathed with flowers one day my brow, The angry tempest lowers; She cries, 'Pray, for what woman now Do you put on your flowers?'
Explanation: Explanation :Even if I were adorned with a garland of branch-flowers, she would say I did so to show it to another woman.

Verse: யாரினும்	காதலம்	என்றேனா	ஊடினாள்			யாரினும்	யாரினும்	என்று.
Translation: Translation :'I love you more than all beside,' 'T was thus I gently spoke; 'What all, what all?' she instant cried; And all her anger woke.
Explanation: Explanation :When I said I loved her more than any other woman, she said "more than others, yes, more than others," and remained sulky.

Verse: இம்மைப்	பிறப்பில்	பிரியலம்	என்றேனாக்			கண்நிறை	நீர்கொண்	டனள்.
Translation: Translation :'While here I live, I leave you not,' I said to calm her fears. She cried, 'There, then, I read your thought'; And straight dissolved in tears.
Explanation: Explanation :When I said I would never part from her in this life her eyes were filled with tears.

Verse: உள்ளினேன்	என்றேன்மற்	றென்மறந்தீர்	என்றென்னைப்			புல்லாள்	புலத்தக்	கனள்.
Translation: Translation :'Each day I called to mind your charms,' 'O, then, you had forgot,' She cried, and then her opened arms, Forthwith embraced me not.
Explanation: Explanation :When I said I had remembered her, she said I had forgotten her and relaxing her embrace, began to feign dislike.

Verse: வழுத்தினாள்	தும்மினேன்	ஆக	அழித்தழுதாள்			யாருள்ளித்	தும்மினீர்	என்று.
Translation: Translation :She hailed me when I sneezed one day; But straight with anger seized, She cried; 'Who was the woman, pray, Thinking of whom you sneezed?'
Explanation: Explanation :When I sneezed she blessed me, but at once changed (her mind) and wept, asking, "At the thought of whom did you sneeze?"

Verse: தும்முச்	செறுப்ப	அழுதாள்	நுமர்உள்ளல்			எம்மை	மறைத்திரோ	என்று.
Translation: Translation :And so next time I checked my sneeze; She forthwith wept and cried, (That woman difficult to please), 'Your thoughts from me you hide'.
Explanation: Explanation :When I suppressed my sneezing, she wept saying, "I suppose you (did so) to hide from me your own people's remembrance of you".

Verse: தன்னை	உணர்த்தினும்	காயும்	பிறர்க்கும்நீர்			இந்நீரர்	ஆகுதிர்	என்று.
Translation: Translation :I then began to soothe and coax, To calm her jealous mind; 'I see', quoth she, 'to other folks How you are wondrous kind'
Explanation: Explanation :Even when I try to remove her dislike, she is displeased and says, "This is the way you behave towards (other women)."

Verse: நினைத்திருந்து	நோக்கினும்	காயும்	அனைத்துநீர்			யாருள்ளி	நோக்கினீர்	என்று.
Translation: Translation :I silent sat, but thought the more, And gazed on her. Then she Cried out, 'While thus you eye me o'er, Tell me whose form you see'.
Explanation: Explanation :Even when I look on her contemplating (her beauty), she is displeased and says, "With whose thought have you (thus) looked on my person?"

Verse: இல்லை	தவறவர்க்கு	ஆயினும்	ஊடுதல்			வல்லது	அவர்அள஧க்கு	மாறு.
Translation: Translation :Although there be no fault in him, the sweetness of his love Hath power in me a fretful jealousy to move.
Explanation: Explanation :Although my husband is free from defects, the way in which he embraces me is such as to make me feign dislike.

Verse: ஊடலின்	தோன்றும்	சிறுதுனி	நல்லளி			வாடினும்	பாடு	பெறும்.
Translation: Translation :My 'anger feigned' gives but a little pain; And when affection droops, it makes it bloom again.
Explanation: Explanation :His love will increase though it may (at first seem to) fade through the short-lived distress caused by (my) dislike.

Verse: புலத்தலின்	புத்தேள்நாடு	உண்டோ	நிலத்தொடு			நீரியைந்	தன்னார்	அகத்து.
Translation: Translation :Is there a bliss in any world more utterly divine, Than 'coyness' gives, when hearts as earth and water join?
Explanation: Explanation :Is there a celestial land that can please like the feigned dislike of those whose union resembles that of earth and water?

Verse: புல்லி	விடாஅப்	புலவியுள்	தோன்றுமென்			உள்ளம்	உடைக்கும்	படை.
Translation: Translation :'Within the anger feigned' that close love's tie doth bind, A weapon lurks, which quite breaks down my mind.
Explanation: Explanation :In prolonged dislike after an embrace there is a weapon that can break my heart.

Verse: தவறிலர்	ஆயினும்	தாம்வீழ்வார்	மென்றோள்			அகறலின்	ஆங்கொன்	றுடைத்து.
Translation: Translation :Though free from fault, from loved one's tender arms To be estranged a while hath its own special charms.
Explanation: Explanation :Though free from defects, men feel pleased when they cannot embrace the delicate shoulders of those whom they love.

Verse: உணலினும்	உண்டது	அறல்இனிது	காமம்			புணர்தலின்	ஊடல்	இனிது.
Translation: Translation :'Tis sweeter to digest your food than 'tis to eat; In love, than union's self is anger feigned more sweet.
Explanation: Explanation :To digest what has been eaten is more delightful than to eat more; likewise love is more delightful in dislike than intercourse.

Verse: ஊடலில்	தோற்றவர்	வென்றார்	அதுமன்னும்			கூடலிற்	காணப்	படும்.
Translation: Translation :In lovers' quarrels, 'tis the one that first gives way, That in re-union's joy is seen to win the day.
Explanation: Explanation :Those are conquerors whose dislike has been defeated and that is proved by the love (which follows).

Verse: ஊடிப்	பெறுகுவம்	கொல்லோ	நுதல்வெயர்ப்பக்			கூடலில்	தோன்றிய	உப்பு.
Translation: Translation :And shall we ever more the sweetness know of that embrace With dewy brow; to which 'feigned anger' lent its piquant grace.
Explanation: Explanation :Will I enjoy once more through her dislike, the pleasure of that love that makes her forehead perspire?

Verse: ஊடுக	மன்னோ	ஒளியிழை	யாமிரப்ப			நீடுக	மன்னோ	இரா.
Translation: Translation :Let her, whose jewels brightly shine, aversion feign! That I may still plead on, O night, prolong thy reign!
Explanation: Explanation :May the bright-jewelled one feign dislike, and may the night be prolonged for me to implore her!

Verse: ஊடுதல்	காமத்திற்கு	இன்பம்	அதற்கின்பம்			கூடி	முயங்கப்	பெறின்.
Translation: Translation :A 'feigned aversion' coy to pleasure gives a zest; The pleasure's crowned when breast is clasped to breast.
Explanation: Explanation :Dislike adds delight to love; and a hearty embrace (thereafter) will add delight to dislike.
